story:
Short Summary

There is another world just above our heads. A world both comfortingly familiar and completely alien. Look in just the right direction at just the right time, and you may catch a glimpse of this parallel universe. 

Although human in appearance, at least to us, Eddie and the other aliens of Lab 99 are nothing of the sort. In reality they are comprised of a group of bioluminescent living particles sharing a unified consciousness. Although they can exist individually as separate particles, traveling throughout outer space and drifting from galaxy to galaxy following the interstellar winds over millennia, the living particles can also form bonds with one another, fusing their identity and experience of the world to form a more complex and powerful whole.

The Laboratory is their home, one of many scattered throughout the universe. Those that have found themselves in our corner of the solar system built it long ago, a refuge and a place of gathering amongst the lonely, desolate eons of space. 

What does their presence mean for us? Do they fear us? Do they understand us? What would they do if they did? 

Creators

Lab 99 is a production of Nebula Creatives, a Chicago-based film production company. It is written by Rujanee Mahakanjana and Christian Stanfield, with artwork by Oscar Joyo. 

 

Ruja​nee:

Growing up watching a good amount of Japanese animated television shows in the 80s and 90s, I have always been fascinated by existential and philosophical stories with science-fiction elements. Lab 99 started off as a 20-year collective personal journey, and it has now turned into something much more than passion. It’s an enlightenment of what humanity is about and anyone can relate. My goal is to show the audience how to appreciate and embrace what we are while understanding our differences and choices we make towards changes and transformations.

Christian:

I've always been a fan of mystery and science fiction from an early age, especially stories with philosophical and social commentary elements to them such as the Twilight Zone. What drew me to Lab 99 was the concept of an alien coming to Earth with incredibly advanced technology and the ability to cure all of our diseases, and the idea of what that would really mean for the human race and how we would really react. I'm also a big fan of movies with a witty and quirky sense of humor, especially when combined with science fiction such as The Adventures of Buckaroo Banzai, and that's another thing that drew me to Lab 99.

Oscar:

Born to a Malawian family, I was introduced to art at a young age through animation, comic books, video games and film. Anime, surreal art, and music have always been a driving force in my work. I hold a BFA in life drawing at the American Academy of Art. Technical training in traditional drawing skills from the Academy led me to find interests in professional illustration, graphic design, photography, and fine art which I am heavily influenced by, to create a variety of visually striking imagery. I have been involved in many artist exhibitions around Chicago, including showcases outside such as The Society of Illustrators in New York and the Congressional Art Exhibition and Digital Arts Showcase in South Korea.

 

What We Need & What You Get

We began Lab 99 the comic book with a preview issue (available for free as a digital copy on our website) setting up the world and introducing the main characters. Our goal from here is to continue to create rich and engaging content accompanied by high quality artwork, drawing you further into the world and story of the Lab 99 alien named Eddie, as he struggles to cope with the increasingly dangerous set of circumstances surrounding him. 

In particular, this campaign is to raise funds for the second issue, picking up right where the first left off. We are currently offering both digital and printed copies of the first and second issues, with many more rewards to come. Our goal is to continue creating many more issues as well, beyond these first two, as the story continues to develop. 

 

The Impact

As a small independent group of artists, our choice to go with a crowdfunding site such as indiegogo was based on 1) having a direct line of communication with our fans, where we can share our ideas and inspiration, and 2) having a way we can sell our work directly to you, and deliver it in as efficient and fast a way as possible. 

By contributing and purchasing a copy of Lab 99, you are helping to support independent artists in doing what they love, and helping to make this series as good as it can be for many more issues to come. We sincerely hope you will enjoy what we have in store for you. And we can't wait to show you what's coming in the next issue. 

 

Risks & Challenges

Although this is our first comic book, our company Nebula Creatives has been around for several years and has successfully produced a wide range of videos and projects, including a yearly film festival we run in Chicago.

The money we raise here will be used to produce the second issue in the comic book series, and we will continue to notify our fans (via our website) when future issues are planned for release. 

In the event that we do not raise enough money to produce the issue, we are happy to return anyone's money who no longer wishes to support the project. Our primary goal is to produce quality art and storytelling for our fans, and we do not wish to take your money without delivering you what we promised. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot contribute financially to our campaign for whatever reason but would still like to help, we are offering the first preview issue for free on our website at nebulacreatives.com/lab-99. We would love it if you could pass it along to any fans of science fiction or fantasy who you think would be interested in our project. 

We are also open to all forms of collaborating with other artists. If you or someone you know has something they would like to contribute or offer, we work on many different kinds of projects including videos and events, and we always enjoy working with other likeminded creatives. 

As Seen On

story:
Why?

Hi my name is Sharon and I love Zombies, I love graphic novels & comics and I love original artwork! I also have a formidable zombie persona called 'Mamma Zombie' who often takes over the human me for films, events, conventions and sometimes just for fun! [ http://www.mammazombie.co.uk ]

My zombie is over two years old now and in this time has gained a lot of knowledge and experience working on numerous films and at live events. For over 12 months I have been teaching Zombie Schools/101's on film sets and for live scare events. Having spent hours absorbing everything Zombie I have acquired a rather large folder of notes containing all my hints, tips and secrets to being an effective zombie for any occasion! I use theses notes when teaching Zombie School and Zombie 101's and thought, WOW, how about combining Zombie School hints and tips with Fantastic Artwork and creating a collectible graphic book!

I then met the talented comic book artist Rees Finlay who designed a poster for a Zombie film I was in ... Rees sent me a Mamma Zombie illustration (see the video) from a photo on my Facebook page and at that point I knew I had found the artist I wanted to work with on this project!

So Rees and I have been working away, creating unique artwork and content to share with zombie fans everywhere! We are nearly there - the only thing we need now is the support of our family and friends and some ££££'s to get the final ball rolling.

I am reaching out for contributions to help with the following costs:

  • Each illustration can take up to 20 hours, sometimes more - and with 12 unique images to create I cannot expect Rees to supply the illustrations or work for 240 hours for free so part of the funding will go towards covering the cost of the original art.

  • High quality printing - I want my Zombie 101 manual to be something you treasure and turn to for years for inspiration! I am hoping that it will become your one stop Zombie Guide and will be well used so want it to be up to the job.

  • I have costed the project to ensure it is the best quality it can be and the bottom line is that although I would love to be able to self-fund this, I just don't have the pennies right now to do that.

Your contribution!

It would be great if you just wanted to make a donation to the project, however, as you are showing faith in Mamma, Rees and our project by  contributing we have put together some fun perks for you! PS  If you don't speak Zombie and don't know your 'srrR GrrR urrrr!!' from your 'RrrAa orr grRrRrrrRr!!' then just check out the translations as the bottom of the page.

What if we don't make target!

Being realistic, £1200 is a lot of money to raise, but with the superb perks I believe it to be an achievable target. I am relying on my family, my friends, my peers and zombie fans to dig deep to get this unique manual out into the world! If I don't reach target I will still honour any perks bought, however the quality of the final product may be reduced and it may take a few months longer to finish the project and get the perks out to contributors as I will need to sell my soul, my grandma and my son to finish it! (Only kidding - my Grandma and my Son are not for sale)

Other Ways You Can Help

So it is not payday and you have other financial priorities - I know how you feel, I have wanted to support campaigns in the past but not been in a place to do so! You can still help though by spreading the word  and getting the 'ZOMBIE 101 - AN ILLUSTRATED MANUAL' and the funding campaign out there! Indiegogo has a great share tool to make it easy!

Zombie Translation:

RRaAaA!! = Follow

rraaa OrR!! = Thank You

srrR GrrR urrrr!! = and post cards

mrrrr rrrAA RaaA!! = first print copy

sRRr Ooooo Gggg GGGgRr!! = and it's signed

RrrAa orr grRrRrrrRr!! = thank you caricature

ORRR RAaa MrR RRaAaAA!! = your very own artwork


Thanks for taking the time to check this out, it is appreciated!
Sharon Greenwood
AKA Mamma Zombie

Notes:
We can currently only ship within the UK - all perks include P&P, if you have multiple items in your perk that need shipping these may be sent seperatley,

story:
Hello, Errbody! 

I have a kick-ass proposal for the sequel to the movie Sisters.  In it, I will be their Half Sister and this campaign is to help me fund the venture of producing and pitching a short film to be reviewed by Amy Poehler and Tina Fey.    

How did this happen you ask?  Well, keep reading!

For years, I have been told I am a cross between Amy Poehler and Tina Fey. Being a well-trained actor who loves comedic roles, that is the best compliment I could ever receive!  I would rather be told that than told I look like Giselle. ;) 

Earlier this year, I decided it was time for me to create my own opportunity as an Actor. Gone are the days of waiting around for a call from my agent - at my age, I don't have time to climb the Actor's ladder to success, rung by rung. Besides, that is sooooooo not my style!  

I am the girl who comes in from the right and shocks everyone!  So, I decided to take inspired action and come up with a way to create my OWN success! Oprah is going to love this story :)  Yes, I just put that out there!  Oprah,  I am coming for you!  Ellen, don't think you got away.  I am coming for you too!  

Ok,  focus Stephanie,

So, back in January, I saw the movie Sisters and realized that I do truly look and act like both of them, and I am the perfect "Half Sister" for a sequel.  It was like I was hit on the head with a coconut. I knew then and there that this idea was precious, and I promised to honor it.  

At first, I aimed small, thinking I will produce a little web-series and grab a following in hopes of Amy and Tina discovering me.  Yeah.  That made the Universe laugh.  Way too small of a goal...  

However, in March, I gave a motivational speech in NYC about taking big leaps (video below) and from that speech, I met contacts directly related to both Amy and Tina.  I have been asked to produce a short film that will be presented to them as a proposal.  I know ... how flippin amazing!  I am beyond excited!  

Watch this video to learn more about my story and my style. It is the speech that set my dream on a course for becoming a reality. 

  


As a result, I am packing the good ole bags and hightailing it up to NYC to make this happen!  I am raising money to make it all happen. Not only are you investing in my project, you are investing in me and I promise to not let you down!

I understand there is a risk.  And the rewards presented in this campaign are not guaranteed.  I JUST HAVE NEVER BEEN MORE CERTAIN OF SOMETHING IN MY ENTIRE LIFE!  I WILL HAVE THIS MOVIE DEAL NAILED DOWN BY SEPT 1st.  I can feel it in my bones.  

This film will be presented to Amy and Tina, and will also be submitted to various film festivals all over the United States as a way of gaining further exposure.  

There is no plan B.  This is it, folks!  My big move.  Like the part at the end of Dirty Dancing when he lifts her up!  No backing down.  I am 100% committed to this project.

I have learned something rather valuable from my new friend Kristin Gracie. She says, "I believe the power of the individual lies in the strength of their community.”  So here's to you, my community, thank you for helping me make my big dream a reality! 

If you believe in me and my project, any little bit will help!  I thank you from the bottom of my soul.  

If you are not able to contribute, getting the word out would be so helpful to me!  

Thank you again for visiting my campaign.  


Love and light,

Stephanie  Wilson

www.stephaniewilsonacts.com
www.facebook.com/stephaniewilsonacts
www.instagram.com/where_is_stephanie

story:
We're Going Worldwide

The Scrimshaw team has been hard at work over the last year since the book debuted at Silicon Valley Comic Con. Since then we've completed three issues, taken part in the Amazing Las Vegas, Los Angeles, and Comic Excitement Conventions, and also seen Scrimshaw go digital on ComiXology. It's been a fun year for certain and now we're set to take the next step with our publisher, Alterna Comics in a couple of different ways. 

 

First the Scrimshaw graphic novel will contain Issue #1 - #3. It's 120 pages of awesome high seas action including all the uber nerd stuff we came up with for the Captains Log. The character profiles, ship schematics, and the fictional ads. Yep that's all in there.  That will be available in book stores beginning in May 2017 and comic shops shortly thereafter.

Why the delay you ask?

Well that's because we've got an opportunity to take Scrimshaw to a massive audience this year as Alterna has signed a worldwide wide distribution deal to bring newsprint comics to comic shops and newsstands everywhere. This is special to us for two reasons.

1: Nostalgia: these are the comics we had when we were kids.

2: Access: this development makes Scrimshaw available to a lot more people.

The newsprint deal means a kid with a handful of quarters can once again buy a comic book and it's very special that we get to be at the vanguard of this "new age". We're excited to take part in an initiative that can make comics accessible to everyone. That's where we need your help.

 

What We Need & What You Get

We Need: $4400 that's it. This amount goes strictly to funding the print run of both the graphic novel and the newprint comic book with a smattering left to run an ad in Alterna's SIX TOP SELLERS so that people know Scrimshaw is out there. Any funds raised during this campaign will go directly towards the cost of printing the books. 

You Get: A selection of awesome rewards. In addition to our single issue and collected graphic novel offerings, we have some cool merchandise including Scrimshaw branded thumb drives, kydex wallets featuring the Scrimshaw characters, custom holsters (just like the one our newest villain wears, this guy right here)

Here's a sneak peek at one of our custom holsters and a kydex wallet with Hans Tanaka on the front. 


 

We've also got some cool stretch goals that we'll introduce as we near our number. No reason to jump the gun, but if the items above are any indication then those stretch goals are going to be pretty darn cool. 

In addition for every pledge that this campaign receives we're going to donate a copy of Issue #1 of Scrimshaw to Critical Care Comics. We met these folks at Amazing Las Vegas Comic Con last year and needless to say they're doing amazing work. 

 

The Impact

We get to bring the book and it's themes to the largest audience possible. Global warming, the overfishing of the worlds oceans and corporate control of natural resources are just a couple of the themes we touch on in Scrimshaw. Of course we try to do it in a cool and fantasic way, because if you want bleak you could just turn on the news. Still we want to get people thinking and encourage people of all ages to go out and make THEIR difference, whatever that might be. 

Through our efforts of the last year and along with the help of a lot of great people along the way, we've been able to forward this project and position it to go global. That's pretty cool to us and we hope you'll think it is too.  

 

Risks & Challenges

Risk is inherent in any nearly every endeavor, but we're confident that we can continue to meet our obligations in producing Scrimshaw. Barring any unforeseen disasters or mighty death blows to the creative team. We'll save the mighty death blows for Hans to mete out.  

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't contribute economically you can still play a massive role in the most important aspect to us: bringing Scrimshaw to the largest audience possible. 

Scream Scrimshaw from the rooftops. If you're not a screamer, stalk us relentlessly and you share (Horde Media) far and wide on your social media. Any and every retweet, share and like moves Scrimshaw forward. It may seem a small thing, but it's one we certainly do appreciate.

The character profiles, ship schematics, and the fictional ads. Yep that's all in there.  That will be available in book stores beginning in May 2017 and comic shops shortly thereafter.
Why the delay you ask?
Well that's because we've got an opportunity to take Scrimshaw to a massive audience this year as Alterna has signed a worldwide wide distribution deal to bring newsprint comics to comic shops and newsstands everywhere. This is special to us for two reasons.
1: Nostalgia: these are the comics we had when we were kids.
2: Access: this development makes Scrimshaw available to a lot more people.
The newsprint deal means a kid with a handful of quarters can once again buy a comic book and it's very special that we get to be at the vanguard of this "new age". We're excited to take part in an initiative that can make comics accessible to everyone. That's where we need your help.

 

What We Need & What You Get
We Need: $4400 that's it. This amount goes strictly to funding the print run of both the graphic novel and the newprint comic book with a smattering left to run an ad in Alterna's SIX TOP SELLERS so that people know Scrimshaw is out there. Any funds raised during this campaign will go directly towards the cost of printing the books. 
You Get: A selection of awesome rewards. In addition to our single issue and collected graphic novel offerings, we have some cool merchandise including Scrimshaw branded thumb drives, kydex wallets featuring the Scrimshaw characters, custom holsters (just like the one our newest villain wears, this guy right here)

Here's a sneak peek at one of our custom holsters and a kydex wallet with Hans Tanaka on the front. 

 
We've also got some cool stretch goals that we'll introduce as we near our number. No reason to jump the gun, but if the items above are any indication then those stretch goals are going to be pretty darn cool. 
In addition for every pledge that this campaign receives we're going to donate a copy of Issue #1 of Scrimshaw to Critical Care Comics. We met these folks at Amazing Las Vegas Comic Con last year and needless to say they're doing amazing work. 
 

The Impact
We get to bring the book and it's themes to the largest audience possible. Global warming, the overfishing of the worlds oceans and corporate control of natural resources are just a couple of the themes we touch on in Scrimshaw. Of course we try to do it in a cool and fantasic way, because if you want bleak you could just turn on the news. Still we want to get people thinking and encourage people of all ages to go out and make THEIR difference, whatever that might be. 
Through our efforts of the last year and along with the help of a lot of great people along the way, we've been able to forward this project and position it to go global. That's pretty cool to us and we hope you'll think it is too.  
 

Risks & Challenges
Risk is inherent in any nearly every endeavor, but we're confident that we can continue to meet our obligations in producing Scrimshaw. Barring any unforeseen disasters or mighty death blows to the creative team. We'll save the mighty death blows for Hans to mete out.  
 

Other Ways You Can Help
Even if you can't contribute economically you can still play a massive role in the most important aspect to us: bringing Scrimshaw to the largest audience possible. 
Scream Scrimshaw from the rooftops. If you're not a screamer, stalk us relentlessly and you share (Horde Media) far and wide on your social media. Any and every retweet, share and like moves Scrimshaw forward. It may seem a small thing, but it's one we certainly do appreciate.

story:
About Us

We're two girls from Delaware looking to make a dystopian comic book about powerful teenagers. Our story is about two girls, one of whom is on the autism spectrum, and a boy who have lost their families and are looking to find out why most of the humans have disappeared. This story is important to us because we feel there aren't enough comics about powerful women and especially about powerful girls. With your help we can get this rolling and off the ground.

What We Need & What You Get

  • We need about 150 dollars to get our campaign started. If we could make more that would be great. We are looking for anyone who is interested in making comic-cons and stores a little more female friendly.
  • From this campaign you will enjoy exclusive art from the artists of this comic including scenery, pre-character designs, and much more!
  • The funds will still go towards our comic if we don't reach our goal and if we make it over our goal we will be using the funds to get our comic out on the market.

The Impact

As previously explained, our comic is important to making the comic industry more female friendly and to raise awareness about how powerful girls are and the power of people on the autism spectrum.

Risks & Challenges

  • We work everyday to improve our skills but it can be hard to when you have limited money and also have to work on academics.
  • We will put in as many hours as we can and with your help we can buy the supplies needed to make our comic a success.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Please spread the word about our campaign on your social media and through w.o.m. 
  • You can also use the buttons provided to share our campaign

story:
• When considering contributing, be sure to look at my exciting perks!
Summary
  • I'm Lander Solon. I'm a student of architectural engineering and interior design at the University of Wyoming, and I also write. I've obsessively written fiction all my life, and my current writing project is a 300-page graphic novel called A Death of Anonymity. I'm writing and illustrating a page per day, and will be finished by the end of this year.
  • A Death of Anonymity is a dark and labyrinthine story that explores existentialism, politics, ethics, and epistemology from the perspective of thinkers like Heraclitus, Epicurus, Emerson, and Nietzsche.
  • I focus on story showing rather than story telling; this combined with a visual style abstractly related to Art Noir film and Japanese Edo period woodblock printing leads to a degree of artistic integrity rarely present in mainstream fiction. Contributing to this campaign will allow the addition of a new member of the "pantheon" of serious graphic novels.

Budget

The illustration and self-publication of my 300-page graphic novel will cost $9325.

  • From about 100 international bidders, the winning quote for quality illustrations came in at $7500. this includes four iterations of illustration and renderings to ensure the novel looks exactly as I intend.
  • Page Layout services from self-publishing companies come to $300.
  • A quote from a quality literary editor I trust came to $525.
  • Though most copies of A Death of Anonymity will be printed on-demand with sales, I budgeted for $1000 for 100 copies to pitch to comic book stores on a book tour in 2016.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you just can't make a monetary contribution, but would like to help the campaign, share this blog, help me be seen! Use the Indiegogo share tools and post this campaign any social media you might use!

story:
All proceeds will be used to pay for the booth and tickets at Cleveland Comic Con. As well as covering the production costs of t-shirts, posters, giveaway items, and as many comics as we can print with the funds. Thank You and hopefully see you at Comic Con!

In Spring of 2014 I distributed 1000 copies of my first comic book BEACON, more recently multiple area comic book stores have agreed to start selling my books. In order to spread the word even more, I would like to reach out to a bigger audience. Even with the success I've had so far, paying for the promotion and production of those first 1000 issues left a pretty big hole in my budget.  Even if this campaign doesn't reach its goal all of the money raised will go towards printing more books, posters or shirts.

I thank you for your interest and support in JH Comics, this is my dream but without support, readers and fans it would be impossible to come true. I hope to see you at Cleveland Comic Con in February, and feel free to ask any questions regarding the campaign or anything else about JH Comics!

If you would like to see the current comics available online feel free to visit www.comicsjh.com

Thanks Again

Joey Haas

story:
Yes, that weird and wacky Doctor Atavism is at it again for the very first time! His plan, to release upon the unsuspecting masses a love-letter to the Haunted Attractions Industry and all things Halloween in the form of a COLORING BOOK! The harvest season comes to life, or at least undeath, in six sinister chapters of grisly ghoulish ink illustrations, ready for you to complete with your own artistic flair!

Ben "BAR-1" Rodriguez has been a Haunted Attractions enthusiast and performer for years, and distilled that interest into the inspiration for a manga-styled book of highly detailed black and white illustrations. This 64 page, 31 image (one for every day of October!) coloring book is ready to go to from a proof-of-concept test run to a full printing, and could use your support in making this evil plot-er, creative project a success.

Stretch Goals:

  • At 50 Individual Supporters, 2 2.5x8.5" Full-Color Laminated Bookmarks featuring the Kissing Booth Clown Girl in cheeky pinup poses will be introduced as a $5 Add-On Perk! (Shipping Included)
  • At $1500, All Autograph Editions & Above will receive a free 4x6" full-color photo print of the Killing Booth Clown Girl FREE!

story:
Short Summary

Hello everyone! I'm a comedian and clown (not the scary kind).  I've written a clown show about the dangers and difficulties of depression and I would love to take it to the Edinburgh Fringe Festival this year. My show is about an actor backstage of a back alley vaudeville show, navigating the crippling battle between his depression and his obsession with making people laugh.  While struggling to decide whether or not to take his newly prescribed medication, he decides instead to take his own life.  However, as he attempts to do so, his clown persona takes him over.  The clown carries out the suicide attempt on his behalf, and by failing as clowns do at everything, the clown saves his life.  Fifty percent of all profits the show makes at the Edinburgh Fringe will be donated to Depression Alliance.  This show is dedicated to my hero, Robin Williams.  

What We Need & What You Get

The goal of 4,000 dollars will be used to offset the costs of staging and marketing the show.  The more effectively I can market the show, the more people will be drawn to see it, and the larger the donation to Depression Alliance will be.

The Impact

I am very passionate about comedy's ability to raise awareness and provide catharsis for those who experience it.  If we can make this goal it will greatly increase the scope of the awareness raised by the show.  Aside from the less tangible impacts of raising awareness and mutual catharsis, the charitable aspect of the show will make a direct and concrete difference in the lives of those suffering from depression.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even one dollar donations will go a long way, but I understand that sometimes donation is simply not an option (hence the indiegogo campaign).  If you can not contribute financially, please contribute by sharing this campaign with your friends and followers.  The more people we reach, the more likely it is we will make this goal!  Thank you so much for reading

story:
Vampire Mob Issue 3

I believe this is the greatest time in the history of storytelling. Hi! I'm Joe Wilson, the creator of Vampire Mob, a dark comedy about a hitman whose mother-in-law moves in for eternity. This story and these characters have been a part of my life since I started writing VMob in 2009. 

After making the live-action series released in 2010 and 2011 I wrote a script for the next part of the story that was twice as long as the first two parts combined. Unfortunately, in 2013 we lost cast member Marcia Wallace before we could shoot that script. 

Instead of recasting or writing her character out of the live-action series, I chose to keep her character "alive" in another story form, a graphic novel. Thanks to the support of over four hundred cool people, Issue 1 was created, followed by Vampire Mob Issue 2. 

Issue three picks up the story exactly where Issue 2 ended, with Don in a dark alley banging on a metal garage door. The next part of the story is really fun, with lots of action thanks to the Irish mob hiring Don to do some "consulting."

READ ISSUE 1 ONLINE, FREE! - 

The goal of this campaign is to create Vampire Mob Issue 3 and make it as many pages as possible. The issue will be drawn by Claudio Munoz Cabrera, lettered by Deron Bennet/AndWorld Design and Corey Blake returns as creative consultant. Your contributions will also help with the printing and shipping expenses. 

If we can reach the goal, the issue will be 23 pages, if we hit the stretch goal of $8,000 it will be 33 pages long! More story for everyone who contributes!

Get drawn riding shotgun with Don! 

We are all famous to a few people HOODIE!

Available in Navy Blue, Black, Red, Light Gray and Dark Gray

Page 7 from Vampire Mob Issue 3, art by Claudio Munoz Cabrera

What do I get? 

  • EVERYONE who contributes will have their name in the Supporting Mob section of Vampire Mob Issue 3 (or "anonymous" for those in witness protection)!
  • EVERYONE who contributes receives an Ebook download of Issue 3.
  • Other perks includes "We are all famous to a few people" Hoodies and T-shirts! Two styles!
  • Multiple motivational mugs, including "We are all famous to a few people" mugs! 
  • Graphic Novel Writer's Commentary Video. 
  • Get drawn in the issue! 
  • Get drawn in the passenger seat with Don at the wheel!
  • And of course, ISSUE 3!!! 

                             

We are all famous to a few people T-Shirt is an available perk.

We are all famous to a few people 15 0z coffee mug!!! 

 

                                            Can't contribute now, but want to help?

I've been there. I know what it's like when you want to help, but there's bills to pay. You can still help make this project happen!! 

- Tell your extremely talkative friend on Facebook.

- There's a whole lotta share buttons right under the video to help, you know, share Vampire Mob.

- Yell, "Vampire Mob!" out your window at passersby, or maybe Tweet a link to this campaign. 

- Post a picture of the cover on Instagram.

- Explain to people that Vampire Mob is a vampire story for the rest of us! No sparkling, no romance, no puns!!!!!

Thank YOU for the assists!! Truly appreciated and very needed!

Risks & Challenges

In working on two issues of Vampire Mob I've learned that stuff goes wrong. Every project that I start I'm looking for obstacles, I'm looking for what's going to stop me. 

If we don't raise the budget by the end of the campaign, I will find a way to make this story happen. As those of you know, Vampire Mob season two almost didn't happen, but I found a way and will do that same for Issue 3.

story:
Overview

 

Hexcraft Mechanics Ultimate Control: For years Rahaab has been a part of the Sisterhood of Lilith's Rapid Rebirthing program, creating hybrid humans with demonic DNA helping to foster the current Neo-Nephilim outbreak. Now seeking a cessation from her life of seduction and birthing, she walks away from the Sisterhood, but she knows their secrets and that's a problem. 

Serpina, a succubi jinn along with her soul collector Soulfyre, begin making surprise visits to bring old contracts current, starting with one of her biggest beneficiaries, billionaire and Rise of Magic leader Natas Talbane.  

Cursed to walk among us as a vampire with a soul, Erika Norton fights and feeds on Chicago's violent criminals.

Acting as a prequel to Hexcraft Mechanics, this 36 page book adds another layer to the Hexcraft Mechanics series. With art by Robert Stewart of Afterburner Comics, Nathyn Brendan Masters, a prologue by Paulo Sbragi and cover art by Lelia Pacheco. For mature readers: Contains violence, nudity and sexual situations.

 

Serpina (R'dan) Nude Virgin Cover by Lelia Pacheco 

 

Prologue Art by Paulo Sbragi

 

Robert Stewart Art  

 

Nathyn Brendan Masters Art

story:
But what are people saying?

Features

This is what you can expect if you decide to back this project. 

 The fact that we have successfully funded 7 kickstarters and always have delivered on time.

People that would love this are fans of Avatar The Last Airbender, Mortal Kombat, or even Forbidden Kingdom. Also people that in general love fighting with a bit of mysticism involved. You can even check out some page samples further down the page!

unique rewards such as a bust of the main character or even being a character in the next issue!

Creators

The Plan

After we fund this is how things will go:

By mid October we will be receiving the money from Kickstarter and then we will immediately place the order to get the books printed.

No later than mid November we will receiving the printed books.

By the beginning of December everyone will be receiving their rewards. Just in time for Christmas!

And Finally, Thank You!

Without the help of comic book fans and even people new to comics, stuff like this wouldn't be possible. We creators more than anything just want to produce great stories for individuals like you to be able to just enjoy and have fun reading. To be able to maybe help people momentarily forget about the troubles in the world is truly a great feeling. 

So I just want to say THANK YOU for putting your faith and trust in me as a creator and allowing me to put my work in the world for more people to see. Without your help, none of this would be possible.

Risks and challenges

You can be confident in backing this project as the whole book is complete. The only thing left to do is to get them printed. even most of the other rewards will already be in stock! So the only risk you will be taking is if you don't check out what we are bringing to the table as you might possibly miss out on a new favorite comic book series.

To be able to maybe help people momentarily forget about the troubles in the world is truly a great feeling. So I just want to say THANK YOU for putting your faith and trust in me as a creator and allowing me to put my work in the world for more people to see. Without your help, none of this would be possible.Risks and challengesYou can be confident in backing this project as the whole book is complete. The only thing left to do is to get them printed. even most of the other rewards will already be in stock! So the only risk you will be taking is if you don't check out what we are bringing to the table as you might possibly miss out on a new favorite comic book series.

story:
Campaign Overview
 

Ayurveda Chronicles is a self-contained 38-page graphic edutainment book. This light-hearted adventurous story will give you the answer to the age-old question: How does our body work?

Take on a journey with Amala set in the depths of a village where diseases are lurking just around the corner. However, it is her brother's chronic and frequent illness that causes her to set out to find answers. Destiny takes her to 'The Great Being' who light-heartedly tells Amala to explore the five elements our bodies are made up of: Earth, Water, Fire, Air & Space. Will Amala be able to unlock the mystery of self-healing? Will she be the saviour of her brother and eventually the entire village? Pledge to one of the tiers on the right and be a part of Amala's epic journey.

The goal of this Indiegogo campaign is to fund the production, printing, and shipping of this comic book! Progress has already begun with the book being complete at 90% and we just need a little more help to get over the finish line.

 

Help #AyurvedaChronicles happen!
 

Hi Everyone,

I'm Sunitha Tati, and as many of you know, I've been in the entertainment industry for over two decades. During that time, I've had the privilege of working on some of the most exciting projects in the industry. Everyone has his own battles, I battled with mine, not once but twice in the form of cancer at a young age. It is Ayurveda that helped me fight it with all the might and thus I decided to open the pandora box of knowledge for you. A humble creation that would not have been possible without Dr. Marisa Laursen(Author, Doctor of Ayurveda and Lead Faculty at the California College of Ayurveda) & Vamsi Bandaru(Illustrator, Director at Guru Publishing). I'm also grateful to Guru Publishing & Ayurway for helping make my dreams a reality.

 

Sneak peek of newly finished pages:

Ayurveda Chronicles - The Adventures of Vata, Pitta and Kapha

Come with us on a journey of discovery with young Amala. 

One morning, Amala bounces out of bed eager to play with her baby brother, but discovers that he is ill. It seems to be the same mysterious illness which took her dear mother and is now affecting her entire village. 

Amala’s heart sinks, as her resolve strengthens...

The village bell chimes, calling all the healthy grownups to a much-needed meeting around Grandmother Tree. Hiding behind a boulder, Amala listens carefully, determined to find answers.

 

Conversation bubbles:

“My mother, brother and uncle are all sick!”

“My wife hasn’t been out of bed in a month!”

“Almost every family has lost someone!”

“We must do something! But what?

“I don’t know. But I know who does; Great Being!”

 

Stunned, Amala realizes what she must do. If Great Being has the answers, she will go find him!

Amala searches far, wide, and long, until she collapses in exhaustion. As she surrenders to the unknown, a glow arises from within, illuminating her heart, her mind, her everything. Within the light appears the shimmering, brilliant, all-pervasive image of Great Being. 

 

“You have found me, precious one. Well done. In order to find the answers you seek, you must first obtain the 5 Great Elements. Everything everywhere is made of them. Use all your senses: see them, feel them, hear them, smell them, and they will reveal themselves to you. When they do, collect some of each in this basket.”

“I see you have found the 5 Great Elements! Well done. May I?”

 

Great Being reaches for the basket. He grabs a handful of space, air, fire, water and earth and tosses them high into the sky. The elements multiply endlessly, then flutter to the ground, settling into three separate piles.

 

“Hi! I’m Vata Dosha. I can jump as high as the sky! And fly like a bird!

 

“I am Pitta Dosha. Not “peeta” like “cheetah,” it’s “Pitta” with “it” in the middle. But why are we even here?”

 

“I’m Kapha Dosha and I’m trying to sleep here. Can everyone keep it down please?”

 

The shimmering light of Great Being returns. He explains to Amala that her new friends will help her on her quest to unlock the mystery of health. Together, they must seek the 3 keys that lead to the 3 pathways to solve the 3 puzzles.

 

Join Amala and her friends as they embark upon an adventure to find the ancient yet timeless healing science of Ayurveda…

 

 

 

Dr. Marisa Laursen (Sri Devi) is a Doctor of Ayurveda and Lead Faculty at the California College of Ayurveda. She has been teaching and practicing Ayurveda since 2002. An author to various publications including the Ayurveda Journal of Health, she also teaches Ayurveda and Yoga workshops at various locations worldwide. Her life-long passion has been to bring sacred healing to her students, patients, and the global community. It is this passion which inspires her to write children’s books on Ayurveda, in hopes that it will contribute towards a more peaceful, healthy and loving world.

 

Vamsi, a gifted storyteller and natural illustrator, started his education as an architect and then specialized in entertainment technology from Carnegie Mellon. He brings with him a passion for interactive storytelling in the children’s and young adults’ space backed by experience in AI (Artificial Intelligence) toy design, animation and graphic novels. He has worked as a Creative Head at The Times of India. At Guru Publishing, he integrates storytelling with his distinctive illustration style, in the process, developing original Intellectual Property for his characters

 

Sponsors 

Ayurway is a Holistic Healthcare Service whose vision is to create a powerful grassroots health culture based on integrative and preventive approaches blending the best of East and West in both traditional and modern medical sciences, with a special focus on Cancer prevention.To achieve this, they have developed a unique diagnostic approach coupled with therapeutic techniques from all over the world, including Ayurveda, Siddha, Aromatherapy & Herbology, Sound Therapy, Spiritual Healing and Yoga & Meditation to provide holistic healthcare for healthy well-being.

Steered by Dr. Sarat Addanki (Intern - Ayurvedic Doctor), who holds an Ayurvedic Clinical Specialist Certificate from California College of Ayurveda, CA, USA and Bachelor of Computer Science and Engineering degree from Osmania University of Hyderabad, India. He is an entrepreneur and has 25 years of experience in the technology field helping customer like McKesson and Tesla Motors in implementing quality programs for large complex ERP projects.

 

Publisher

The publishing wing of Guru Group, Guru Publishing tells stories that leverage ancient Local Culture’s wisdom and equip the next generation of children, whether in San Francisco or Chennai or Tokyo with stories that are now shared on a Global Platform using new technologies.

Led by Sunitha Tati, the promoter of Guru Group, Guru Publishing’s team is complete with Meghana Koppala, Creative Director who leads the projects. She comes with an experience as a writer in the Advertising World and a Brand Communication Manager for an Ayurvedic Retail Product. And Manisha Koppala, who is the Editor, and also a Curriculum Editor for an online EdTech Company, has previously won the All India Short Story Competition, judged by Ruskin Bond.



We have different versions of the book available depending on your support level. Support the tier with the rewards you are interested in, and we will make sure you receive them!

 

Help #AyurvedaChronicles happen!

story:
Short Summary

Genre: Action /Comedy/2DAnimation / Motion Comic Series
 
A group of alien hybrid friends and their robot traveling through the Universe in their Star Ship cruiser, Cadence, time travel the interplanetary space-highway.
 
The alien friends are in a pop rock band called, The Galaxy Starz. Whenever they're not on a mission, they can be heard in their recording studio. The fun-loving characters engage in music, fun, action filled adventurous situations while meeting new and interesting characters from other worlds (including Planet Earth.)

The Galaxy Starz team has a huge advantage when saving the Universe from the negative forces of disharmony and spreading good cheer along the way. The Cadence Star Ship is loaded with an advanced self-automated computer system called, Octavius, (voice over talent - Greg Yoder) the voice of The Cadence.


What We Need & What You Get


The Galaxy Starz 2D Animation-Motion Comic Series:

Secrets of The Unknown is our first episode for the motion comic book series. Eight additional episodes are already written for the series with more on the way. Our motion comic and 2D animation series will be produced by a selected team of professionals. Our storyboard artist, Mike Pascale brings his many years of successful talents to The Galaxy Starz motion comic series . Denise Maher, character designer, and other talents are currently being selected to fill the production departments, mentioned in the chart above.

The chart above indicates most of the talents that will be required. Our first budget will be $5,000 USD. Having the "flexible campaign" will allow us to hire some of the industry's best talents and have a great chance to have a completed first high quality episode. All additional funds, past our goal, will go directly into the next episode.


The Impact

The Galaxy Starz motion comic series will be the building blocks for promoting a 2D animation series (based on the motion comic series episodes.) Your contributions will create a huge opportunity to discover new talents looking for their break and bring continued jobs into the market.

Risks & Challenges

Having a good budget to pay the talented professionals is the best way to have the work produced to industry's high standards and bring The Galaxy Starz to life!


Other Ways You Can Help

We truly understand that some people will not be able to contribute. With that in mind, we still appreciate your time reviewing our project. The Galaxy Starz has an on-line store where you can find all kinds of unique (mostly music related) products and gifts. Sharing The Galaxy Starz Products Page with your friends on social media would be sincerely wonderful! 10% of all products sold goes directly back into The Galaxy Starz productions. You can also use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
Written and illustrated by filmmaker and video editor Nabil Ayari, Vagrant X is an original comic book/manga series who takes place nowadays in Thailand, where the culture is amazing.

Why did I choose Thailand?
Firstly, I don't know about many comics or manga that have used Thailand as a background. Secondly, because I have been living in this country for a few years and each local city I've visited, they are beautiful by the way, inspired me to make a story about them.
Also, there is a lot of old stories (realistic or mythological) using special characters and animals that I would like to show up and design in my comic book.



Vagrant X is about a journalist, from Bangkok, specializing in stories unlike any others, who was contacted by one of his readers who has one unique story to tell. The story is about this child who grew up in a well, without knowing why. He never left this jail. At first, he thought that this was normal, that every living being lived like that. But the more time passed, the more he understood that he was the only one living like this.

Later, we will discover that this child is the result of an experience (a failed one?), and he is able to use 100% of his brain capacity, which also allows him to get his subconscious awake in a special way.

This special way will depends on the books he has read when he was imprisoned in the well. Basically, he takes his power from books and from his subconscious.

Where it gets interesting is that we discover later that there was not a single well but dozens more! So we will see other characters with different abilities according to the books they have read and which are stored in their subconscious. These characters will meet in the great adventure that awaits them!

Unfortunately, I can't tell you much about the main story because I don't want to spoil it. But the good news is that I am sharing the first 11 pages of the comic book with you guys.
Please, check it below this page.



As I said above, I was inspired by Thailand, but also by a lot of manga, comics, video games, movies, books and more... And I would like to tell you that Vagrant X is a big tribute (and is full of Easter Eggs) to great films, video games, Japanese anime and others media that have rocked me big time during the 80s and 90s.
And I'll mention all of them in the credits.





That's where you come in...
The $16,000 goal is precisely what's required to release the first book (with more than 100 pages) before the end of 2016.
And to reach this goal, I need to work on it every day. To work on it every day I need some kind of income. Yes, like many people, artists need food to live. Also, there is the printing cost, the artist Fees and the translations -in 4 different languages which is English, French, Japanese and Thai-, Indiegogo Fees (Indiegogo funds are considered taxable income), rewards and shipping (to anywhere in the world)... all are expensive costs, that can be covered by this Indiegogo campaign, if it is successful. That is why I'm asking for your help.




As a reward for the people who want to help me, I have selected some very special and exciting gifts:

Credits-X:
Your name will be mentioned in the credits.

Digital-X:
A digital copy of the first comic book episode of Vagrant X (1600x2560).

Super Digital-X:
The music theme of Vagrant X composed by the great Vincent Séjourné.

Print-X:
A print copy of the first comic book episode of Vagrant X, black and white and with more than 100 pages long.

Wallpaper-X:
A digital full color wallpaper signed and the first comic book episode of Vagrant X signed.

Making-X:
The video documentary of how I’m doing the comic book.

Early Access-X:
Each chapter of the first comic book (contain between 15 and 30 pages) via digital download.

Handsome-X:
The T-Shirt of Vagrant X.

Original-X:
The 10 first original comic digital pages (will contain an original red sketch), 10 digital pages in black and white before the toning and 10 digital pages toned without the speech and the sound effects.

Muay Thai Fighter-X:
The Muay Thai short of Vagrant X.

Super Muay Thai Fighter-X 2:
The Muay Thai gloves an the Muay Thai short of Vagrant X

Your Vagrant X:
You will work with me to design your own character. We will be in touch to polish up the details.



Below are the first 11 pages of Chapter 1 of Vagrant X.
Note 1: I still hesitate about making the sound effects in English or Japanese.
Note 2: Les pages en Français sont disponibles ici.


So, if you want to know more about the story, why some character have a giant scar and an eye inside their hand, why the kid was locked up in the well, etc... You only need to be a part of the project!

And, why didn't I do it before? Because my drawing style wasn't so good. Also, the story was incomplete. You can check some additional pages to see "the before/after."




Ouch! I forgot to introduce my best friend and assistant, Nemo! To tell you the truth, he will be in the story as... Nemo. But not as cute as he is now.


And, here are some more drawings from the first chapter of Vagrant X and more drawings inspirations from the Japanese anime, comics and games in the 80s and 90s.




You can follow me at Nabil Ayari Official:
Nabilayari.com
Facebook.com/NabilAyariOfficial
Youtube.com/nabilayariofficial
Nayarix.deviantart.com

You can follow me at Gamebill Studio:
Gamebillstudio.com
Facebook.com/Gamebill.Studio
Twitter.com/Gamebill_Studio
Youtube.com/GamebillStudio


Risks and Challenges:
This is my first time running a Indiegogo campaign and as a filmmaker, I know that unforeseen problems always arise on projects:
printing, damage to shipments, and above all, unexpected delays.

Of course, backers will be notified in the event of any shipping delays.
I will make sure the promised fulfillment is delivered in good condition.

I will keep in touch with you guys.

here are some more drawings from the first chapter of Vagrant X and more
drawings inspirations from the Japanese anime, comics and games in the 80s and
90s.
You
can follow me at Nabil Ayari Official:Nabilayari.comFacebook.com/NabilAyariOfficialYoutube.com/nabilayariofficialNayarix.deviantart.comYou
can follow me at Gamebill Studio:Gamebillstudio.comFacebook.com/Gamebill.StudioTwitter.com/Gamebill_StudioYoutube.com/GamebillStudio
Risks and Challenges:This is my first time
running a Indiegogo campaign and as a filmmaker, I know that unforeseen
problems always arise on projects: 
printing, damage to shipments, and above all, unexpected delays.
Of course, backers will be
notified in the event of any shipping delays. 
I will make sure the promised fulfillment is delivered in good condition.
I will keep in touch with
you guys.

story:
WE ARE A MAKING THIS FOR NON-PROFIT. ALL FUNDING WILL BE USED TO COVER PRODUCTION COSTS.

MEET THE CAST:

As the Joker grows in power Mr. Dent does everything in his grasp to maintain his strong hold on Gotham.

HARVEY DENT: Christopher Rob Bowen

She lives a life of a Hollywood Scarlet; fine wine, mink coats and expensive jewelry.

GILDA DENT: Melissa Santos

Relentless and determined, The Dark Knight will stop at nothing to take down The Clown Prince of Laughter!

BATMAN: Guy Nardulli

With Chaos on his mind, will The Joker have what it takes to push The Bat to resort to desperate measures?

THE JOKER: Dylan Hobbs

Driven by her curiosity, she searches for ways to understand Mr. J!

HARLEY QUINN: Mariah Picou

He plays both sides in order to survive, because he's much more useful alive then dead!

RIDDLES: Dominique Marsell

Before he was Commissioner he was an Ex-Special Forces and Detective with Gotham P.D.

JAMES GORDON: Manuel Eduardo Ramirez

She's classy, beautiful and Gordon's high school sweet heart!

Barbara Gordon: Jane Santos

A modern Benedict Arnold and a pawn in The Joker's corner.

DRIVER: Chad C. Bianco

A Police Detective with Gotham P.D.

HARVEY BULLOCK: Nazo Bravo

Chaos has to start somewhere.

MOTHER JOKER: Beverly Hynds

THE IDEA:

The City With Two faces is a continuation of the feature length Fan Film Joker Rising (as seen here https://youtu.be/IZaLGhFC7tU) that was a film about the Joker's Origin, but now that the Joker has been born he is free to terrorize Gotham in new and more demented ways than ever.

The City with Two Faces will be two films. Part I and II. This will be the first feature length fan film trilogy ever made. We desire to continue in the same vein as the first and focus on the villains. It will be dark but story and character driven.

If we can raise the funds for this we will be ushering in a new era of fan films that feature amazing performances, character development, and mind blowing stories.

MISSION STATEMENT:

We are a group of indie filmmakers who are dedicated to the craft and stories. A promise that we can make is that once the proper budget is raised we will immediately go into pre-production then into production without any hang ups. We know what we are trying to achieve and how to do it. The first film, JOKER RISING, was written in March 2013, cast in April, and filmed over 8 days in early June. The final cut of the film was released at the end of July. That is our work flow and we intend to maintain it for these next two films. This is the promise we make to you that these films will be maded and completed in a timely manner.

What We Need:

We are asking for $30,000.00 . Both films will be full feature lengthen and will feature numerous characters, sets, action scenes, effects, an original score and more. We are trying to make two epic movies on a micro indie budget similar to what Clerks did in the 90's. Every dime we receive will go to the production of these films.

THE FUNDS WILL GO TO THE FOLLOWING:

Pay for incredible actors, catering, Batman and Bane's suits, large sets, including a bat cave, practical effects, digital effects, make up artists, props, blanks for guns, room and board for actors who live far away, transportation, and post- production.

The Impact:

Your contribution will help bring to the world the first full length fan film trilogy and hopefully usher in a new era of DIY film-making. You will be apart of something epic and ground breaking.

The first Joker Rising was seen by many and featured on numerous huge sites including IGN, GEEK TYRANT, SCREEN RANT, BLOODY DISGUSTING and many more. Imagine where something like this could go. 

We thank you all for your consideration and for possibly being apart of film-making history.

Other Ways You Can Help We would be grateful for any help you can give. Whether it be through donations or even just getting the word out about this page or our facebook page https://www.facebook.com/thejokerrising/

Thank you and please share with the world.

Risks and challenges:

We are facing the challenge of making two, well made feature films at the same time. We have very little funds of our own to make these but know that we could make something amazing with a decent budget. We have to create numerous sets, and feed our cast and crew. We thank you for any help in raising these funds and promise you two great feature films.

It gives me great pleasure to introduce the fan's to our friend and the man who will be doing all the art work for "City With Two Faces".

ART DIRECTOR: Rob Prior

ROB'S PAINTINGS:

story:
Short Summary

A girl and boy are having sex. It's rough, it's dirty. They're sweating, moaning, writhing - close to the wonderful climax. The door opens and an older woman leans into the room.
'For God's sake, put your sister down... Dinner is on the table.'

This is our introduction to the characters who make up the Sick B*stards within the story; a tale of survival, incest and cannibalism based on extreme horror author Matt Shaw's number one best-selling novel of the same name.

Dave and Matt met purely by chance. Matt Shaw was standing in the queue of MCM Telford, bored, when he got chatting to Dave - who was also waiting in the queue, patiently waiting for the doors to open so they could set up for another convention. It turned out Matt Shaw was an author and Dave McCluskey owned Dammaged Comics. By the end of the day, Matt had a couple of Dave's comics and Dave had a copy of "Sick B*stards". A week didn't even pass before they spoke again, teaming up to bring fans of comics the twisted world of The Sick B*stards.


Dave warned Matt comics weren't cheap but Matt shrugged it off and said it needed to be done. As it turned out, Dave wasn't lying but - luckily for Matt - agreed to take on half the costs and organise the illustrator and letterer for the series (because, let's be honest, Matt wouldn't have a clue where to start). With issue one out of the way - and looking mighty impressive - Dave and Matt will see the series through to the final stages come rain or shine but opted to start a campaign in order to get some help from people (such as yourselves) just as keen to see the end product.

There are 6 comics in total (1 being complete). Once these are done, they will also be compiled into a graphic novel giving people the option of purchasing the collection or the stand alone book. They will be available in both physical and electronic formats.

Money raised through this campaign will go towards:

Illustrating
Lettering
Printing

IF there is any left over, money will be put into advertising and developing the sequel SickER B*stards.

Here is a breakdown of the costs:
Cover artwork: £50.00
Per page: £35.00
Lettering per page: £5.00

6 more covers  = £300.00
Artwork for rest of the series = £5250.00
Lettering for whole series = £750.00

Total cost £6300.00

You will notice the cost involved is more than what we are asking for. That's because we are not expecting you to pay for the comic. We're just asking for a little helping hand!

Dave and Matt will be putting their hands in their own pockets to ensure this is finished with all proceeds from Issue #1 also going into the production of the rest of the comics.

The Impact

Once "Sick B*stards: The Comics" is off the ground, it will bring a completely new audience to the dark work of Matt Shaw. It will also benefit David in that readers of Matt's work will be curious to see how it translated to graphic novel. With any luck they'll purchase this, be impressed and then look into the other comics offered by Dammaged Comics!

Risks & Challenges

We have already discussed the financial risks. Putting all money from issue one into the series, and setting this page up, will help with that. It also helps that it's not one man trying to do this himself. It is two men who have agreed to work out the costs together. With neither one wanting to let the other down, and both keen to see the finished product - they won't let obstacles stand in their way to getting to their end goal. Obviously, if nothing is raised from this page, it will just take a little bit longer...

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand not everyone is in a financial position to help out but that doesn't mean you can't help at all. For instance, just sharing this page to your friends and family will help massively - even more so if they like extreme horror...

story:
A little about me. I'm a 24 year old father of two beautiful girls. I'm currently going on 5 years of service in the United States Army and loved every second. I've always been interested in comics and dreamed of creating one myself. Thanks to the help of my partner Ernesto Beltran we've finally completed a detailed and graphic story. Our script is complete and we have an artist lined up to finish our product so we can finally publish. Our ultimate goal is honestly just getting our idea in someone else's hands. The thought of someone reading our material and enjoying it is simply overwhelming.

     Our story does not hold back on the readers. We keep it graphic and detailed through the whole story. We've got a variety of new and interesting characters to offer and we come up with new ones daily. We maintain the chaotic realm that comes with the zombie apocalypse and constantly make situations worse with the help of twisted and demented villains getting involved. We hope continue publishing well after our 1st issue but we need your help to get started.

Most comic books today have high success rates. This is primarily because of digital sales constantly on the rise. Our biggest risk is not receiving the funding that we need. We can sell our product easily by targeting specific audiences that are interested in what our product offers. We only need to get it to them.

    Thanks for any and all help folks! It's greatly appreciated.

story:
THIS CAMPAIGN IS CANCELED AS OF 3/3/2015, PLEASE DO NOT DONATE.

The preview issue is out! Go read download and enjoy it!

Back for more! This is our second fundraiser. We thank those who have donated in the past. Please share this fundraiser so we can get more readers interested!

THIS CAMPAIGN IS CANCELED AS OF 3/3/2015, PLEASE DO NOT DONATE.

Short Summary

In blackly humorous comic series Transhuman Resources, we follow the misadventures of UNIS: a transhuman, transgender and transnational corporate troubleshooter in a world where they've branded people-trafficking, fought wars over breakfast cereal, and founded time-travel temping agencies. 

Packed with utterly gratuitous sex and indefensible amounts of violence, Transhuman Resources is definitely not for the easily offended. 

We are Wood Ingham and K. Guillory. 


Howard "Wood" Ingham (writer, Swansea, UK) is a writer, editor, and performance poet. He contributed to over forty books for White Wolf and Onyx Path's World of Darkness RPG lines (some of which have won awards) and his clients have ranged from charitable and religious organisations through to the British Government (but he can't tell you more about that because he'd have to kill you). He has most recently been published in Parthian books' Gothic fiction anthology A Flock of Shadows and in The Ghastling magazine. io9.com once described his self-published roleplaying game MSG™ as "Stuffed to the gills with black, black humor". @HowtheWoodMoves

K. Guillory (artist, Detroit, USA) is a controversial author, painter, graphic designer and comic publisher. She is part of Ashur Collective, with whom she has published four previous books, including Blood Money: the Road to Detroit. @kgpaints

Past books K. Guillory has illustrated and designed.


What We Need & What You Get

In our comic, nothing comes for free. You'll be able soon to read our Zero Issue for nothing, though, to give you an idea of where we're going. Until then, we're planning on doing each edition in our series as a softback 64-page European-format (8" by 11" or thereabouts) graphic album. 

To publish the first one we're going to need $3700 (left to raise). That breaks down in the end into three things: 

  • Publishing the album (we're going to sell it for £14/about $25)! 
  • Sending you the album in the post! 
  • Giving us money to eat!
If you contribute $150 or more you will get all the perks as listed below, and a 10x10 stretched canvas painting of UNIS (the heroine of the series). Painting is done in acrylic. Ships separately from the book.
If you contribute $60 or more you'll get not only a physical copy of the book and pdf, but a sketch of UNIS (the heroine of the series) along with it! Sketch is done with Japanese ink on bristol paper and ships separately.
If you contribute $25 or more you'll get a real-world copy of the book on paper and pdf. 
If you contribute $10 or more you'll get a pdf download copy of the book.

"How else can I help?"
  • Like us on Facebook. The more people who keep up with us regularly about Transhuman, the better. If you write for a comics blog, we would appreciate you spotlighting our project!
  • Spread the word. Blog our vaporwave images (found in the gallery) on Tumblr and Twitter, and link it back to this fundraiser. Tell people who like to read comics about queer, transgender women. Tell people who like to read comics set in dystopian cyberpunk worlds. Tell people who like to read comics that are just plain funny.
  • Share the preview comic everywhere. Email it to people. Send it to your best friend. If you think someone would want to read it, give them the preview issue for them to enjoy. It's free! We want as many people to check it out as possible.
  • If you own a business in Detroit and you are hiring, contact our illustrator and offer her a job. She freelances normally, but steady capital cuts down on her expenses. She would be willing to do this comic pro bono as long as she were able to afford the office space it requires to produce it. There aren't enough comics about queer black women out there, and she realizes Transhuman's need to exist.


Image courtesy of Tylonn J. Sawyer.  tylonn-j-sawyer.com

Stretch Goals

We want to include other artists in the making of Transhuman Resources, so we're including this awesome stretch goal! If we raise at least $5,000, we'll hire Red Bull House of Art alumni Tylonn J. Sawyer (artist, Detroit, USA) to illustrate two full-color pinups of UNIS.

You may recognize Tylonn from the Red Bull House of Art commercial. If you haven't seen it yet, check it out!


Controversial, Not Hurtful.

We work with a team of beta readers to make sure Transhuman Resources is not hurtful or thoughtless in its writing or depiction. We have transgender friends and extended family. We don't want them to read a book that makes them feel less about themselves--we want them to laugh.


Thank You

We are thrilled to share Transhuman Resources with the world and finally make it a reality. We thank you for your interest and look forward to publishing this amazing project!

story:
It's "A Sigh of the Times."

Were you Charlie last month? If you were, "good for you" but the truth is serious- hard core- political cartoons and satire really don't exist in America today. There's a few cartoonists who make a full time living working with a few publishers, but in general the Art of the Critical Cartoon is almost dead. With no automatic weapons fired.

Beyond Washington Politics the Greatest NON Truths from Power are coming from the Techno-Business world that centers around Wall Street and Silicon Valley. The idea of "FREE SPEECH" has quickly become the narrative of "Terms of Service Speech" as all our civic conversations and ideas are had online.

For many years I created humor based media/ multimedia/ etc. that used technology and spoke to how technology was using us. It all got very technical;), not to mention expensive to create laughs at the cutting edge of tech, plus your best jokes got lost to the endless platform upgrades.

It's time to get back to the simpler things.

I would like you to help me make "A Sigh of the Times" a web place where I can present Cartoons and Comics that bite the hand that used to, and sometimes does still feed me, the Tech World.

I think it's time.

It's time for Cartoons that target those from Silicon Valley,Washington and Wall Street, The Brogrammers and the TechnoGeeks who worship at the Church of the Shiny and Billion dollar valuations based on your babies photos.

It's time as the Super Large Tech Media Corporations are now buying out the Newspapers and reaching into all News Media making the idea of satirical speech to power online look even more bleak. If you think Rupert Murdoch's FOX News doesn't like to pay to be made fun of what chance does Google have of employing political cartoonists.

It's time to see if a Satirical Cartoon App that targets the meglamania of Steve Jobs can be posted in the App Store? Let's find out 
Help to keep tweaking the techies, before they twerk you.
Help fund me to Make Cartoons ! A lot of Cartoons. A lot of the time.

If funded I can stabilize my creative time and get weekly cartoons published and pay for a site that can even try to keep itself alive via ads, promotions, products etc. It takes time to grow a site into a self sustaining activity, so I need your support.

So, it's up to you. Over fund Me Please, so I can really build out a website and offer all that fancy schmancy stuff the big kids at Kickstarter Projects  do. ( Especially the Hollywood made Movie Stars who want you to pay for their first Directing gigs;) The more I can raise now, the more coffee I can drink later.

So visit the temporary website at 
www.asighofthetimes.com
and let me here from ya.
Larry R.
story_txt:
It's "A Sigh of the Times."

Were you Charlie last month? If you were, "good for you" but the truth is serious- hard core- political cartoons and satire really don't exist in America today. There's a few cartoonists who make a full time living working with a few publishers, but in general the Art of the Critical Cartoon is almost dead. With no automatic weapons fired.

Beyond Washington Politics the Greatest NON Truths from Power are coming from the Techno-Business world that centers around Wall Street and Silicon Valley. The idea of "FREE SPEECH" has quickly become the narrative of "Terms of Service Speech" as all our civic conversations and ideas are had online.For many years I created humor based media/ multimedia/ etc. that used technology and spoke to how technology was using us. It all got very technical;), not to mention expensive to create laughs at the cutting edge of tech, plus your best jokes got lost to the endless platform upgrades.It's time to get back to the simpler things.I would like you to help me make "A Sigh of the Times" a web place where I can present Cartoons and Comics that bite the hand that used to, and sometimes does still feed me, the Tech World.
I think it's time.

It's time for Cartoons that target those from Silicon Valley,Washington and Wall Street, The Brogrammers and the TechnoGeeks who worship at the Church of the Shiny and Billion dollar valuations based on your babies photos.

It's time as the Super Large Tech Media Corporations are now buying out the Newspapers and reaching into all News Media making the idea of satirical speech to power online look even more bleak. If you think Rupert Murdoch's FOX News doesn't like to pay to be made fun of what chance does Google have of employing political cartoonists.It's time to see if a Satirical Cartoon App that targets the meglamania of Steve Jobs can be posted in the App Store? Let's find out 


Help to keep tweaking the techies, before they twerk you.
Help fund me to Make Cartoons ! A lot of Cartoons. A lot of the time.If funded I can stabilize my creative time and get weekly cartoons published and pay for a site that can even try to keep itself alive via ads, promotions, products etc. It takes time to grow a site into a self sustaining activity, so I need your support.So, it's up to you.
