http://camocomic.ca
 
OUR MISSION
As an independent comic DS comics is looking to fundraise $3,700.00 for the publication of issues #4 and # 5.  Once the series is completed it is our vision to market the comics to the general public, environmentally minded people, youth and school boards. We hope to entertain you and increase awareness of environmental issues.  Once DS comics  is profitable, 1/3 of net profits will be donated to the environmental causes that we have written about.  The first donations will go to the Spirit Bear Research Foundation, World Elephant Day and the Shark Trust.   
 
Issue # 2 


Camo and Raven are called to Africa to combat elephant poachers in an attempt to stop the ivory trade.  Raven's remarkable tattoos help them talk with gorillas and meet the matriarch of the elephants "Kokoi".  Camo captures the internet tycoon responsible for world wide ivory sales and brings him to natural justice.  
 
 
 
FUNDING
The campaign targets to fundraise $3,700.00 which will be used entirely for production and publication of issues #4 and #5.  As with any indie project we have been self funded to date.    We have a dynamic product that has been accepted by fans at New York Comic-Con 2018, Comixology, Webtoons and local comic-cons and bookstores in British Columbia, Canada.  
We are excited about our success and hope you will join us.  Donate or be a contributor and get

                              ​"Perks" 
         
Issue # 3                                    


The world's oldest alpha predator "The Shark", cannot compete with the earth's most devastating predator "Man".  Camo and Raven join the fight to stop shark finning by taking on Mr. Yu and a scurvy band of shark finners.  Raven's octopus tattoo comes alive to lead them into the depths below.  

 
This is a comic series with a purpose.  It is entertaining, fun and has a message.  See Camo vanish in his surrounding and watch him become one with the Spirit Bear. See Raven's animal tattoos (the raven, the monkey, the octopus and others) come alive to help on the quest.  Evil villains, Big Crude Oil, Mr. Yu and Buckerberg the internet tycoon are driven by greed and power without regard for the earth and it's creatures.  Travel the planet and see Camo and Raven fight evil and stand up for the environment as ECO Warriors.   
Issue # 4

"The Battle"  
Tradition vs. Change!   A family's battle for what is right.  To be published.  Your support is greatly appreciated.  Pledge now to keep the adventures of "Camouflage" continuing. 
                  "SEAS THE DAY-SAVE THE EARTH"
 
Ways you can help:
- download and share Camouflage series for free at camocomic.ca 
- contribute what you can or find a perk level that appeals to you
- give your opinions and ideas at "Postings and News" at camocomic.ca
Follow:
- Earthwatch Institute - advancing science
- Ocean Wise - to protect and restore the oceans
- PacificWild - protecting the Great Bear Rainforest
- Spirit Bear Research Foundation - a collaboration of First Nations and science
- World Elephant Day - August 12, 2021
- Shark Trust - Adopt a Shark
 
Thank you and please go to:
 
 http://camocomic.ca

Your support of this Indiegogo.com campaign is  greatly appreciated

story:
*** FULLY FUNDED ON KICKSTARTER!!! INDIEGOGO BACKERS WILL RECEIVE REWARDS REGARDLESS OF WHETHER WE HIT HE FUNDING GOAL :) ***

 

What's ACCESS DENIED about?

In the near future, an artificial intelligence named Zeus leaves Earth to build an android city on Mars called Neo Olympus. Twenty years on, and although human-android relations are tense, humans are invited to build an embassy in the new city.

Everything goes according to plan, until forbidden love blossoms between the human ambassador’s son and Zeus’ daughter.

The question is… will love conquer all?

Who will enjoy ACCESS DENIED?

  • Fans of Valérian & Laureline, Saga and science fiction comics at large.
  • Collectors of high quality independent comic books.
  • If you like the idea of a sci-fi adventure comic set in space about forbidden love.

What do you get when you back ACCESS DENIED?

  • All reward backers receive an 80 page digital copy of ACCESS DENIED. Alongside a PDF of the original script and a video commentary by Samuel George London.
  • All physical reward backers receive an 80 page, perfect bound copy, printed on 130gm paper with a 300gm card cover at the UK standard sized comic and 2 character colouring cards.
  • Above the standard print copy reward you can also get some waterproof device stickers, a 40 piece jigsaw puzzle or even a hardcover version of the 80 page book.

Hello there, my name is Samuel George London, I'm a comic book writer from Hampshire in the UK, a 5-time successful crowdfunding creator and the writer of ACCESS DENIED.

This story has been in my head for the past 2 years but it’s only now that it’s come to fruition. The idea first came to me after seeing a news story about artificial intelligence.  From there I thought to myself that fictional stories involving artificial intelligence always depict them as wanting to eliminate humans as a natural step of logic but what other options were there...

Trying my best to think outside the box, I wondered that instead of the artificial intelligence putting all its energy into eliminating humans they'd just jump ship and leave Earth altogether. 

With that in mind, here are the prologue pages of ACCESS DENIED for you to enjoy...

If you'd like to read these pages in more detail please click here to download a PDF.

Following on from those pages I'd like to introduce you to the main characters of the story; Zeus, Jane Montgomery, Athena, Robert Montgomery, Aries and Benjamin Montgomery...

Zeus is the leader of the androids, and ever since he orchestrated the exodus of Earth, he's had the motivation to create the perfect society.

Jane Montgomery is the first ever ambassador for Earth. Determined yet diplomatic we couldn't have asked for a better person to represent us on Mars.

Athena is  Zeus' daughter and is best described as carefree. She's a 2nd generation design and was the first android to get the core programming freewill update.

Robert Montgomery is Jane's youngest son. Quiet and thoughtful, Robert is usually on his phone but when he's not he plays his favourite TRPG, Planets of Power.

Aries is Zeus' son and is the very first android to be created by Zeus. Assertive and forthright, it is unknown whether he was given the core programming freewill update.

Benjamin Montgomery is Jane's oldest son. He has his Mother's determination but he also has his Father's anger. He dislikes Planets of Power but loves Mortal Fighter VR.

Those of you familiar with my previous crowdfunding series, Milford Green, will be well aware of the amazing art and colours of Mikael Hankonen, who returns as my continuous collaborator. But for those of you who aren't aware, Mikael is a full-time artist from Finland and the creator of a wonderful webcomic called Year In Hereafter. And if you haven't seen them before, here are Mikael's covers from the Milford Green series, which I'm sure you agree are simply stunning.

As well as Mikael returning, we also have the editor of the Milford Green series, Nicole D'Andria, to complete the dream team.

Nicole, is the Marketing Director and Submissions Editor at Action Lab Comics. She edits numerous comics for Action Lab, from Dog of Wonder to Zombie Tramp. She also adapts Miraculous: Tales of Ladybug and Cat Noir to comics and co-writes DollFace.

Outside of Action Lab, Nicole writes comic book related articles for Comic Frontline, works as a freelance editor and is currently writing the second issue of her successful Kickstarter comic, Road Trip to Hell.

The script is written and edited, the artist is on board, the printers are ready and as long as we're fully funded we'll be able to deliver all of your rewards by January 2021.

Apart from the book itself, the first reward that I'm excited about is an additional reward that isn't listed for those of you at the print copy (£10) and above reward levels will receive 2 character colouring cards you can see below at no extra cost. One side will be Mikael's full version and the other will be the line art version. The cards themselves will be A5 (210x148mm) in size, 300gm thick and uncoated, so that you can properly colour in the line art side however you like.

The second reward I'm excited about are the waterproof device stickers that you can stick on your phone, tablet, laptop or anywhere you like really. And when I say waterproof it doesn't mean it makes your phone waterproof, it means that the adhesive of the sticker is waterproof. I'm sure you assumed that but you can never be too careful.

Disclaimer aside, we have 3 designs; the ACCESS DENIED title, the front cover and the PLANETS OF POWER design. At this point you won't know what PLANETS OF POWER is, but one of our main characters, Robert, is big into TRPG's (tactical role-playing games) and POP is his favourite TRPG. For those of you with a keen eye, you might notice that, Robert has a PLANETS OF POWER sticker on the back of his phone. So, if you'd like to get the same sticker feel free to go for the sticker level reward.

The third reward I'm excited for is 40 piece jigsaw puzzle. It might seem an odd reward but one of our main characters, Robert, is a dab hand at puzzles and strategy games. The jigsaw itself is 4mm thick and is presented in a cardboard tray to make it easier to keep together. 

The last reward I'm excited for is the hardcover option. Over the course of the campaign I've had a fair few messages from backers about the possibility of a hardcover option of ACCESS DENIED. I've managed to price it up from our printers, Mixam, and it's possible to do at £25 for the reward plus £5 postage for the UK and £15 for the rest of the world. Although, the book and the postage are a bit more expensive than the standard print copy, it's bound to make your bookshelf looking amazing if you go for it. Here's an example of the hardcover option from Mixam, courtesy of Dina Norlund.

Thanks for reading, and if you have any questions at all please be sure to get in touch, as we're more than happy to help!

Hoping that you're able to help us make our dreams become a reality :) SGL

 

Risks and challenges

The script is written and edited, the artist is on board, the printers are ready. The only risk we face is that we don't get funded. If you like what you see, please back us and be sure to share ACCESS DENIED with your friends.

story:
We are The Phoenix Press and we have a dream...

   Imagine if you will, a man. Born again in the sands of New Mexico. Ignorant of everything, including his own past. Pursued by a company that on paper doesn't exist, our hero must not only get to the bottom of what this faceless corporation wants. But also the latent abilities that lie in his bloodstream. 

1 of 3 variant covers that will be on display. The "OG Cover"

   Project Axis is an idea long in gestation.  Born in the mind of it's writer Nick Gibson only a few years after leaving High School. To say it's been in development hell would be an understatement.  

   It had a small run in with glory where it had it's initial publication with Dark Elf Designs. Said publication was short and rather limited. Now safely under The Phoenix Press umbrella, Project Axis is now ready to shine. One very successful kickstarter later and we are back to give all you wonderful people another shot at this amazing comic.

That's where you  come in...

The 2nd of three variant covers. The "DeD Cover"

   We are raising funds to a small print run. We aim to print 300 copies. With your help we can make that happen. But what do get in return for your pledge? 

The 3rd of the possible variant covers. The "Garber/Pierce Cover"

   Project Axis Issue 1 will be 24 pages of full color action, suspense, mystery, and overcoming dread. Through 14 pages of amazing storytelling, you will be introduced to the world in which our hero Jyle has come into. A world where corporations run rampant. Breaking all kinds of ethical boundaries in the pursuit of human perfection.

And by pushing we really mean pushing...

  Jyle begins the issue a seemingly blank slate. Devoid of the memories that make a person human. Jyle must now find his place in this new world.  Who shall he become? A hero? A villain? Or something else entirely.  You'll have to read the series to find out.

   But that's just the first 14 pages. Earlier we mentioned that the book would be 24 pages. What fills those other 10 pages? We are very glad you asked! 

We all wear masks...metaphorically speaking...

Inspired by the greatest stories The Twilight Zone had to offer, "We All Wear Masks" is story set in the late 1990's, a slightly alternate 90's in which a mask wearing fad has swept over the face of the nation. This fad is unlike the others before it. Behind the innocence lies a demonic secret that only our protagonist can see.  

The story is 6 pages slow burning suspense. By the end you will be left speechless and bewildered. We certainly don't do things half ass here at The Phoenix Press. 

Here at The Phoenix Press, we do things big or not at all.

Along with these two stories, we will be showing off the new comic strip. "Larry The Inter dimensional Tie". A absurdist look at our daily existence from the ultimate outsider perspective. 

Beyond that, we have a few more things in store. Especially for our returning fans. Namely a few alternate covers.

   3 different covers will be on offer.

  The first is the OG Cover: The cover that graced the Dark Elf Designs version of Project Axis done with care by Jason Jonson.

   The second being the TPP Cover: This one adorned the first edition of Project Axis brought to by it's current home The Phoenix Press. Those who backed the original cover can get this one again. Except now with  re-arranged cover elements. A design all three will share.

  The third and final cover(Garber/Pierce Cover) is truly a special one. For this one was done by the art team for the currently in production comic 2100 Samurai. Featuring pencils and inks by Nick Garber and colors by Kitty Pierce. Marvel at their skill and get pumped for the upcoming showcase of their skill.

You are sure to have a bloody good time reading our comic.

 

  As of the launch of this Indie GO GO, the book is fully complete. We have structed things so that no matter the amount we raise, we will be able to get you whatever you order. We are quite confident in our fans. You all rock.

story:
Short Summary

Hello Cosplay Community!!!

If you are anything like us you grew up watching Ninja Turtles, Ghostbusters, Voltron, Doctor Who, Scooby Doo, Superman and X-men among many many more amazing shows/cartoons and comics! If this is the case then do we have an amazing project for you.

We have created an amazing book that focuses on Cosplay and those that love to participate. This project has been a labor of love and a huge privileged and honor to work on. We have met so many awesome people during our journey.

The journey started in 2019 after Danial (one of the creators) was diagnosed with Cancer. After being diagnosed Danial was not able to attend cons because of the possibility of getting sick with a compromised immune system.  This became a huge part to the start of Heroes and Villains. Danial needed something he could focus on for recovery instead of dwelling on being sick. Danial approached Justin with a new idea for a Cosplay Book and thus they began a journey that they never realized was as big as it has become. 

The original project was to do 15 photo shoots and put together a couple behind the scenes shots, mix in some interviews and boom a cool book to look at. Well that all changed in the blink of an eye. We put out a post in a couple Facebook groups, called a comic shop owner to set up shoots in his building, spoke to some cosplayers and we scheduled 40 shoots. As we started the shoots we also started getting more traction from more and more people ( a little more about that in a minute).

COVID STRIKES 

So we all know that Covid has killed 2020 and the cons. It also tried to derail our project and that was not going to happen. We took some time away from shoots but we didn't take time away from the book. We continue to work toward the publication of Heroes and Villains. We have done a few more shoots, we have interviewed cosplayers and artists, (Remember I said a bit more Later? Well this is later), We have spoken to comic book writers and owners and have been given permission to publish pages from their comics in the book as well as offering SIGNED COPIES in the perks! That's right. You read it correctly. Signed Copies of their comics.  

Covid also had some major changes for us. We lost several printers due to covid and the fact they print in China. We had to go back to the drawing board so to speak. We had many zoom meetings to discuss whats next. We came up with a major change and one we are excited about.

We are printing Heroes and Villains as a volume collection. The book was always intended to be a series but covid helped us change it into a graphic novel style book of volumes. 

 

Perks

 

Retro Style Lunchbox

The Book

Bookmark

2 different Stickers

The Poster

Exclusive Iron Gate Comic Signed!

The Shirts!

The Indiegogo Exclusive 5x7 Print!

PDX Sanderson Sister Collector Set

Collector Set 2

Risks & Challenges

So what are the risks? Well to be honest and transparent there are a couple risks associated with this campaign. The first risk is that covid could cause more printers to either go out of business or up their costs. If this happens then we will compile a list of all the printers out there and be vigilant about contacting them and negotiating the best deal possible to get the book to print. We will also look at other ways to get the finishing funds to complete the book. Even if we have to sell one of our friends kidneys. Just kidding. We haven't asked him yet. No, but we will honestly do everything in our power to get the book to print. 

The second risk is that we do not raise enough money to go to print. Again, this is something we have been discussing and we will find a way to get the finishing funds. We are actively building contingency plans as we move forward. 

The third risk is that it takes longer than expected to go to print. If this is the case we will be diligent about updating everyone and allowing there to be a dialog between us and our fans and backers. We understand that without YOU, this book is just a dream. Like all of you we love cosplay and want to see this a reality.

Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word on social media if you can! Any help is greatly appreciated!! We are also available for interviews on Podcasts, You Tube Streams, etc. Message me through the campaign.

So we all know that Covid has killed 2020 and the cons. It also tried to derail our project and that was not going to happen. We took some time away from shoots but we didn't take time away from the book. We continue to work toward the publication of Heroes and Villains. We have done a few more shoots, we have interviewed cosplayers and artists, (Remember I said a bit more Later? Well this is later), We have spoken to comic book writers and owners and have been given permission to publish pages from their comics in the book as well as offering SIGNED COPIES in the perks! That's right. You read it correctly. Signed Copies of their comics.  
Covid also had some major changes for us. We lost several printers due to covid and the fact they print in China. We had to go back to the drawing board so to speak. We had many zoom meetings to discuss whats next. We came up with a major change and one we are excited about.
We are printing Heroes and Villains as a volume collection. The book was always intended to be a series but covid helped us change it into a graphic novel style book of volumes. 
 

Perks
 


Retro Style Lunchbox

The Book
Bookmark

2 different Stickers

The Poster

Exclusive Iron Gate Comic Signed!


The Shirts!

The Indiegogo Exclusive 5x7 Print!

PDX Sanderson Sister Collector Set

Collector Set 2

Risks & Challenges
So what are the risks? Well to be honest and transparent there are a couple risks associated with this campaign. The first risk is that covid could cause more printers to either go out of business or up their costs. If this happens then we will compile a list of all the printers out there and be vigilant about contacting them and negotiating the best deal possible to get the book to print. We will also look at other ways to get the finishing funds to complete the book. Even if we have to sell one of our friends kidneys. Just kidding. We haven't asked him yet. No, but we will honestly do everything in our power to get the book to print. 
The second risk is that we do not raise enough money to go to print. Again, this is something we have been discussing and we will find a way to get the finishing funds. We are actively building contingency plans as we move forward. 
The third risk is that it takes longer than expected to go to print. If this is the case we will be diligent about updating everyone and allowing there to be a dialog between us and our fans and backers. We understand that without YOU, this book is just a dream. Like all of you we love cosplay and want to see this a reality.

Other Ways You Can Help
Spread the word on social media if you can! Any help is greatly appreciated!! We are also available for interviews on Podcasts, You Tube Streams, etc. Message me through the campaign.

story:
He is a young teen growing up in the big city. An ice cool head in a rough and tumble world. Luckily acid wit and lightning reactions is just what it takes to get by round here.

He is also surrounded by some of the worst best friends ever. A friendship held together by no more than a thin sheet of toilet paper.

Urban Squirrel is a comic about life in the big city. But not any old life - the lives of a bunch of kids who occupy a parallel world - up on roofs, down the back alleys, behind bus stops. And where an all out fruit war can break out at any time. And is there a moral? Heck no.

Don’t hold off - pledge something NOW! I really need your support to get more of the comic finished. The first episode is done, but there are four in the series, and there is a lot more of the story to tell. Episode two will have more pages and lots more fun. And if you want to see the stunning conclusion to this story, then you have better dig deep. Come oooon - the rewards are so cool! There has got to be something there you want.

Subscribe to the website here, and you will get you regular updates on the comic, including process drawings, rough sketches and layouts. You’ll be able to see how messy it can look and how much I change my mind. I'll also tell you little stories about where the ideas and characters come from.

story:
Luke Purrwalker is a young pilot serving at Cat Squad Alpha. Unlike his hero brother Ace, Luke doesn't quite feel up to the task. When a new threat to planet Purrth is discovered, Luke is forced take things into his own hands to save the planet.

Issue #002 continues the epic story arc with incredible developments, intricate plot twists, heart-wrenching conflicts, and a cat nip poisoning.

The funds raised in this campaign will be used to produce episode #002 - "A Cat to Behold."

Catch up on the story! Download a free PDF copy of the first issue at:

http://www.catmospherecafe.com/purrwalker_free_download


Or support us by purchasing a high-resolution digital release for $1!

story:
Hi,


I am Swraj, living my dream,  breaking the shackles of conformity  and just following my heart where it takes.  It has been a roller coaster ride giving up the security of finance, love, community and country to embrace the unkown. My life's plan is ¨No plan, just go with the flow and live every moment as the last moment¨.

You are welcome to know more about me on my website www.solarnomadic.com

I have been travelling since May 2014 across USA, Mexico and Gautemala sharing meditations, energy healing, love and living my life experiences, for life and travel have been my best teachers.  You could follow my journey on facebook : Swraj Khare and SolarNomadic.

My inner self just wanted to follow the sun down in winters to the sea, beaches in Mexico and Gautemala, to connect with music and dance.

These experiences have made me more richer and humble  within, even though my finances have dried out. It made me realise that I have the infinite sea of love within me which will enable me to tide over everything.

It has enabled me to bring out my best and manifest the positive. It is time for me to ride the wave back to USA to connect with spiritual communities and native people in North Carolina, Arizona, New Mexico, Washington, Oregon, Montana and Idaho.

It would be awesome if you contribute to my journey of life, as an Indian saying goes... ¨boond boond se banta sagar¨ ( every drop makes a sea) 


What will your contributions fund ?

To meet my primary needs to travel across to USA :

Air travel ( by low cost carrier Spirit Air based on availability): approx $130-200

Food and refreshments ( at a avg of $30 per day for 40 days) : approx $1200

Buffer for contingency purpose :                                                         $100

Total financial needs : Approx $1500

Accommodation needs: will Couch Surf and will appreciate invitations for homestays ( willing do the following in exchange: run errands,cook,clean, house or pet sit )

How can you contribute?

1. Spread the word by sharing the link amongst your friends and family

2. To contribute financially ( every penny counts)

3. To send out positive vibes to enable this journey


Do you have some doubts about your contribution ?

My greatest learning has been that life is the biggest and best gamble of all, we make our moves based on our understanding and gut feeling, yet let me clear some of your doubts.

What if the money doesnt go towards buying the air ticket?

You are welcome to buy the air ticket on  http://www.spirit.com/Default.aspx

from Gautemala city to Fort Lauderdale (USA)no check in baggage reqd.

OR

from San Salvador  to Fort Lauderdale ( USA)  no check in baggage   no check in baggage required.

( Why only a one way ticket: I have a return ticket booked from New York on 15th May 2015 which can be revised based on my travels)

My details as on passport are as follows:

First Name : Swraj

Middle Name: Hanmanta

Last Name: Khare

Nationality : Indian

Passport No: H9754655

email id: rmb572@hotmail.com

mobile no: Don´t possess a no ( you are free to use any mobile number for completing the booking process)

Address: Due to my present period of being in transit, you ar free to use any address for the booking process)

Hope this satisfies your primary doubt.

What about the cost of travelling across all the places from east cost to west coast, why hasn´t it been provisioned for ?

My experience in 2014 of hitch hiking from Up State New York to Florida, then across to Texas, to move up to Montana and down till California enables me to be able to travel across to my present destinations.

Wait a minute isn´t hitch hiking illegal?

It is a myth, after doing extensive research and true experience, certain precautions are meant to be taken to be on the right side of the law.

Primarily being on the start of exits on Interstate highways, old state highways are open to hitchhiking, respecting the local town rules & police officers if they prohibit the same to walk out or bus out of the jurisdiction. In fact several good souls in uniform have driven me to the next feasible spot of hitching a ride. This has enabled me to keep a clean record so far.

What about shelter at night, where there is no couch surfers or local friends, what is my provision for it?

To seek accomodation in the local church or connect with locals for the best information, Alternatively on the interstates there are 24 hour´s Truck Stops with drivers lounge,  gas stations and cafe ( where the bottomless cup of coffee helps in staying awake till sun rise) to seek shelter at night.

What about the expenses of food or accomodations beyond 40 days ?

Well the idea is to connect with individuals or communities with organic farming, spiritual, other similar activities to volunteer in exchange for food and accomodation to spend more time in a place, like my past experience in 2014 of doing lawn work, oriental rug cleaning, picking organic potates, house sitting, pet sitting in exchange for food and accomodation. There by limiting my on land travel time and expenses to bare minimum.

What if there isn´t sufficient contribution to undertake the journey?

Money is only the means and not the end, hence there is deep faith in me to undertake the journey with the fire of intent and positivity, which has enabled me to sustain and travel inspite of running out of money twice in Mexico and Gautemala.

Although without your contributions and support, undertaking my journey would be an uphill task.

Well what do you get in return for your financial and intangible contributions?

For sharing this proposal on facebook, indiegogo, personal blogs, other social media platforms or contributing monetorily, you will get  online access to my google drive folder of several guided meditations, meditation music and techniques to enable them to do it at their own space. Please send a test mail on my google id: energyticgreen@gmail.com

For contributions above $100, over and above this you would be entitled to an energy healing session in person or a skype session ( based on location). Please refer to my website www.solarnomadic.com for details of the energy healing sessions. Please send me a short mail on energyticgreen@gmail.com for any queries in regards to the same.

story:
A digital book (TEZEN) has already been published through amazon relating an haitian folkloric story about a love story between a girl and a naiad. This story hides more than just a love story.

The hidden World: Myth of Tezens is the development of the story, a saga where you are about to discover the world of Tezens. Tragedy, love and power are three different crossing lines in a very suspenseful saga.

In order to make this dream come true, we are seeking funds for promotions (USD 1,500.00), illustrations (USD $3600) and printing (USD 4,500.00). 


The style - Story board

The comic book is about a story based on a folkloric assertion in Haiti. It seems there are intelligent creatures underneath. They have particular power, and according to traditional stories, those creatures already shown up here in Haiti. It seems some of Haitians have been driven to the life underneath in order to get knowledge and wisdom. 

That is this concept idea in which the comic book is taking birth. 

As you can see it, we want to have a monochromatic book. That will definitely grab attention and facilitate the reading, while too much color tends to distract people from the reality. 

It is a full fiction story but many facts are in line with Haiti's History and even the world history. Economists, ethnologists, illustrators will love this story. This book wants to confront mysticism and science not in furious fight. It's a pasionate book written by an Haitian who loves his country (Cleeford Pavilus) and illustrated by two famous haitian artists (Chevelin Pierre and Kendy Joseph) from Chevelin Illustration. 


First book of 24 pages of a remarkable saga, this book is about to introduce the World that we were not aware of the existence. It drowns you through incredible plots and marvelous world. 


The team

We are three working on this project. Chevelin Pierre and Kendy Joseph are two illustrators who are giving shape to the scenario that Cleeford Pavilus has in mind. They are in harmony three of them. That is a very great team. 

Cleeford Pavilus wrotes for them in the past. Bèl ti machann ("Pretty Hawker"), Nou t'ap peche and Tezen are some examples of books that Cleeford already wrote with these famous illustrators.

story:
Bruno a ten year old hard core gamer, is transported to the land of Damu where he meets Moonü, a most peculiar inhabitant of this realm, they will have to repair the damage caused by Bruno’s technological intrusion on that fragile ecosystem. They will have a great adventure, where they’ll meet fantastic creatures, they’ll forge an unbreakable friendship on their way to restoring balance the realm of Damu and Bruno’s life.





Moonü came about with my son’s Taddeo’s birth. He taught me to enjoy nature, and the value of life. that is why sharing this story is so important to me. It’s a gift to him and to all of us: There is more to life around us.

With more than ten years of experience in animation projects, Miguel Ángel is an artist, production designer, and art director for Motion Pictures and Television. He has worked in many animation studios, advertising firms, and production houses. He became a co-founder of Qi Studios in 2014 along with Eduardo Pichardo.





Since we love the unique effect of 2D animation, we will use this resource for Moonü, every Keyframe will be made drawing by drawing, following old school methods. We want to preserve this great craft.


The App will be made as an interactive comic book that will have animated panels, sound and different levels of user story interaction.

The App will have the necessary adjustments for content enjoyment:

Video options.

Audio options. (Language, subtitles)

In-App purchase availability of further releases and additional downloadable content.

Every story will consist of 15 pages, every page will have one or more animated interactive panels.

Users will be able to select a panel to share on different social networks.




Kids of all ages who want to live an adventure

We want to convey the importance of caring for nature as well as the enviroment, this will be accomplished through an immersive manner supported by a fun plot which as a value added will promote teamwork.


Three Tablet operating systems:

-iPad- iPad 3 and newer models

-Android tablets 

-Windows 8 RT based table


Qi Studio is a startup company focused on generating new original content in traditional and digital 2d animation, for feature films, television and advertising. We are a group of artists who live to create quality propositive content that connects with the public.

We want to provide viewers with the best entertainment experience, and memorable content. We love what we do. We believe in our projects.

















https://twitter.com/moonucomic

https://www.facebook.com/moonucomic

https://www.facebook.com/qistudioanimation

story:
HELLO!

Duncan Weller here.  I'm about to complete my first novel, a very cool 'Graphic Illustrated Science Fiction Novel' called “Flight of the Silk."  It will be about 220 pages long and contain 85 original illustrations.  This will be my 7th book!  

To make it special, I thought I would give everyone out there the opportunity to participate in its creation and get something unique out of the process.  I've never crowdfunded before, and I may never again, so let's give it a shot!  

Everyone who participates will get their perk, regardless if the funding goal is met or not. I'm looking to raise $5000 towards the initial printing run.

This campaign will help create the first pressing that will be a hand-numbered, signed, special limited edition of "Flight of the Silk" with an original cartoon drawing in each book. 

THE STORY

Shot through deep space a tiny green globe explodes into the vicinity of a deep space probe. The probe, a Telennica, collects the green globe and returns it to the Silk planet Terrat for examination. The Silk discover a message within the globe and it is a plea for help from a mysterious alien species. 

The aliens live in another part of the galaxy and are running out of food. If no one helps, these aliens could all die. But the possibility of traveling through deep space is considered impossible and suicidal for anyone brave enough to attempt the trip. This is the first time the Silk (two species called Gilks and Gams) have encountered intelligent alien life, so it's a thrill for some, but freaks out others.

Doubts surface about the alien’s true intentions. Naysayers dream up fearful fates for those they think crazy enough to make the journey. However, a young Gilk apprentice-scientist named Rit makes a strong plea to at least entertain the idea of saving the aliens. Rit pleads with the elders to open Science Camp and explore the possibility of making special seeds and a vastly improved spaceship. When it looks like it just might be possible, they vote to take a chance, relying on their courage and charity even when they don't have enough knowledge or reason to save the aliens. They build the spaceship in order to fly into the unknown and develop fast growing plants to grow food on the alien planet should they survive the journey.

The journey is made treacherous by a number of obstacles in deep space and more complicated when a crew member gives into fear. Will they all survive the journey? Will they be in time to save the aliens?  


BIO

For those who don't know me, here's a short bio:

Duncan Weller is an award-winning Canadian author of children’s picture books, adult short story fiction and poetry. As the illustrator of his own stories he has the freedom to play with ideas and imagery like few others. Inspired by research and travel, Duncan’s experiences feed his imagination allowing him to better express the humanist themes of his work. As a visual artist he shows his work regularly. For more information please go to: www.duncanweller.com. 

Perks

This is the cover painting. It's acrylic on canvas. It's huge - 6.5 X 4.5 Feet! If you purchase this painting and you live nearby I will have it delivered, stretched. If this painting needs to be mailed, it will be delivered rolled. The canvas can be easily stretched again over stretcher bars at any picture frame shop.

a plea for help from a mysterious alien species. 

The aliens live in another part of the galaxy and are running out of food. If no one helps, these aliens could all die. But the possibility of traveling through deep space is considered impossible and suicidal for anyone brave enough to attempt the trip. This is the first time the Silk (two species called Gilks and Gams) have encountered intelligent alien life, so it's a thrill for some, but freaks out others.


Doubts surface about the alien’s true intentions. Naysayers dream up fearful fates for those they think crazy enough to make the journey. However, a young Gilk apprentice-scientist named Rit makes a strong plea to at least entertain the idea of saving the aliens. Rit pleads with the elders to open Science Camp and explore the possibility of making special seeds and a vastly improved spaceship. When it looks like it just might be possible, they vote to take a chance, relying on their courage and charity even when they don't have enough knowledge or reason to save the aliens. They build the spaceship in order to fly into the unknown and develop fast growing plants to grow food on the alien planet should they survive the journey.





The journey is made treacherous by a number of obstacles in deep space and more complicated when a crew member gives into fear. Will they all survive the journey? Will they be in time to save the
aliens?  




BIO
For those who don't know me, here's a
short bio:
Duncan
Weller is an award-winning Canadian author of children’s picture books, adult short story fiction and poetry. As the illustrator of his own stories he has
the freedom to play with ideas and imagery like few others. Inspired by
research and travel, Duncan’s experiences feed his imagination allowing
him to better express the humanist themes of his work. As a visual artist he
shows his work regularly. For more information please go to: www.duncanweller.com. 

Perks



This is the cover painting. It's acrylic on canvas. It's huge - 6.5 X 4.5 Feet! If you purchase this painting and you live nearby I will have it delivered, stretched. If this painting needs to be mailed, it will be delivered rolled. The canvas can be easily stretched again over stretcher bars at any picture frame shop.

story:
Who Are We?

Time Spanners was created by John Vourlis, a graduate of USC Film School and a published author of short stories (including A Case of Insomnia in the Sherlock Holmes’ anthology Shadows Over Baker Street) who worked in Hollywood for many years; Jaime Lombardo, a successful graphic artist and illustrator; and Brendan Kelly, an accomplished artist, actor, musician, and author of his own cool comic (The Bastard Bartender vs The Fearsome Fry-Cook).

These three amigos crowdfunded issue 1 of Time Spanners, to great success. Now we are ready to start and issue 2!

What We Need & What You Get

If you're not familiar with Indiegogo or crowdfunding in general, here's a brief overview: 

For the next 45 days, you'll be able to make pledges to help support the creation of Issue #1 of Time Spanners, ranging from $1 to whatever you can afford. You can select one of the perks on the right, corresponding to the amount you wish to donate. This means you're not only helping us out, you are also receiving some cool stuff in return! 

Our goal is to raise $2500 to finish Issue #2 of Time Spanners. We have the cover of issue 2 finished, and you can see it here. Our dream is to turn the entire story into a graphic novel composed of 10 or 12 issues of the comic. John has already written the script for issue 2, and the money we’re raising here will go towards paying an artist to pencil the pages as well as to pay Brendan to ink, color, and letter Issue #2. Anything we raise above the $2500 we’re seeking will go toward starting Issue #3 and whatever future issues possible.

We have chosen a Flexible Funding program so that whatever money you donate will go directly to completion of Issue #2 (and any potential future issues if we raise more), whether we reach our goal of $2500 or not.

Indiegogo's platform fee on all funds raised is 5%. Fees are deducted from the funds we actually raise (not the goal we set). In addition Credit Card processors will charge us (not you) a processing fee, based on several factors, including the funding type and currency you choose, and the country in which your bank is located. Flexible funding campaigns can accept contributions through PayPal, credit card, or both.

The Impact

Without your help, we won’t be able to realize our dream of turning Time Spanners into a graphic novel.  It takes time, no pun intended, and lots and lots of effort to draw each panel of a comic book, and we’re looking at 10 to 12 issues before we are finished. Time that we all have to take away from our own regular jobs. You can see a small portion of the detailed work that goes into one such panel (of at least 22 needed) in the video. 

As artists, we ultimately rely on the public’s support, one way or another. In the bad old days, we’d also have had to pitch this to comic book companies instead of Hollywood producers, to get them to publish our comic, but in this day and age of crowdfunding, we don’t need those guys. All we need is you!

So if you like what we’re trying to do here, if you’re as excited about it as we are, then by making a pledge, you can help us create a comic book. Your donation will make you a comic book producer just like Marvel or DC! How cool is that!? 

And with so many avenues out there to sell the comic, including a dozen local comic book shops in the Cleveland area that carry Time Spanners, including Comic Heaven, Comics and Friends, Nine Realms, Mac’s Backs and Imaginary Worlds, as well as websites like Comixology, Indyplanet, and DriveThru on the internet, you will be able to point to Time Spanners and say, “I helped get that comic made!”

How You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute much, if anything—as starving artists ourselves, we understand that.  That’s why we’ve made it possible for you to pledge as little as $5 to get a reward (in our case, a digital download of Issue #1). For those of you who can’t even do $1, we ask you to help us get the word out and make some noise about our campaign via email, Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, or plain old word of mouth. You can even use the Indiegogo share tools to help!

If you can make a pledge, you will help us realize our dream and get a reward too! That’s all there is to it.

story:
Short Summary

Hope Flood (hopeflood.com) is one of the top comediennes in the industry with her commitment and dedication to comedians  as well as her numerous ventures to keep them upwardly mobile in the entertainment business. Hope has had a successful career in comedy for over 27 years. Surviving in any business for 27 years is an accomplishment within itself, especially in the "male-dominated" business of comedy. Hope has accumulated a wealth of knowledge and she has paved the way for up and coming comics and has been inspired to pass her experience on to the next generation of emerging comedians.

This inspiration is what gave birth to the Females In Comedy Association (FICA).

FICA is a group designed for the comediennes to develop, refine and build on their craft as they learn how to break into or to stay in the business. FICA’s sole purpose is for comediennes to network, mentor, and collaborate with one another as they learn to implement the skills of success.  This group has spread world-wide and gained the attention of many comediennes all over the globe from the novice to the established seasoned professional. The only requirement is that you must be a Female Comedian who is open to learning and growing.

In 2012 she did the first ever all female  COMEDY CONVENTION

Although the convention was originally branded as the Females in Comedy Convention, it is the vision of founder Hope Flood to include ALL COMEDIANS regardless of gender.

In 2014 it was re-branded and is now call the "COMICS ROCK CONVENTION" (CRC)

The CRC  will bring together comedians for all across the US and Canada for FIVE days of educational and career-advancing opportunities. With intensive and accelerated workshops, seminars and information sessions, industry attended showcases, a variety of networking events and they get to Showcase at some of LA"s mainstream comedy clubs.

WHAT WE NEED

We need to raise $10,000 by April to cover the expenses of the Convention production. Needless to say producing a convention of this magnitude is no small feat, and there are "large expenses" involved. One of CRC’s main goals is to be able to allow all comedians who wish to take advantage of this opportunity to participate regardless of their ability to pay.  Your donation would help us provide scholarships for  comedians from all over the nation, and  to introduce them into the Hollywood atmosphere. We'll be educating them on how to apply for comedy jobs, how to find an agent, how to write comedy, we guide people on why they should be in comedy and show them the value of learning more about the professional comedy scene.

We would like to provide partial scholarships based on the financial needs of the comedians so we can provide professional support for as many as possible. Also finding sponsors has been a challenge we also want to cover paying staff, advertising/marketing, paying for the venues, deposits, key note speakers, accommodations such as hotel rooms, airfare, etc.

FICA supplemented the fees of 50% of the women who attended the 2012/2013 conventions.

Details of the convention please go to: www.comicsrockconvention.com

If you know of any comedians that you feel can benefit from this convention please feel free to have them check out our website. Registration is still available until April 2017.
 

THE IMPACT

Your contributions will support live stand-up comedy and keep the laughter alive. With all the stress and challenges that life can present us with, laughter is healing and the best medicine that can be prescribed.

In addition a portion of this fundraising campaign funds will also go to S.O.Y. SAVE OUR YOUTH (www.saveouryouthok.com) A non-profit organization that is bringing awareness to Educate, Empower,and Equip our communities with available resources to Prevent and End Sexual,Physical and Verbal Child Abuse.

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

  1. Share this campaign with all your friends, family,co-workers, neighbors,comedy lovers, and supporters of the arts and live entertainment etc.
  2. No contribution is too big or too small
  3. Some of your donations may be tax deductible
  4. If you would like to be a sponsor or vendor of the 2017 COMICS ROCK CONVENTION PLEASE email:info@comicsrockconvention.com

WE THANK YOU FOR YOUR TIME

story:
Bio

Hi! I'm Karen. I'm a low income, disabled Filipina illustrator and most of my livelihood comes from my art. I sell my art books at queer book stores and do conventions throughout the year. I've made 2 wlw coloring books and have plans to make comics in the future, but the costs for printing can get rough as they come out of my very limited pockets. This is where you come in.

I've set the funds at 500 at bare minimum, but you are welcome to donate more. I'll love you very much if you help me out or at least share!

 

What You Get

500 is the minimum I set, which is enough for 3 limited 100 print runs of my books, plus new prints for one convention. If I get more somehow, I'll use it for my website costs, as well as new supplies, whether it be new paper or new software. Anyway, here are your perks:

1 Dollar: Thank You Tier

Donate 1 dollar and you have my eternal gratitude! Seriously, I appreciate every one who cares enough to give even a little bit. So thanks!

2 Dollars: Kissing Girls Tier

Donate 2 dollars and you'll have my gratefulness, and a digital PDF of Kissing Girls Coloring Book, the first book I've made. It's got 16 pages of girls kissing girls. Show your friends! Shock your grandma!

5 dollars: Wow, A Bunch of Art Books Tier!

Donate 5 dollars and you get my thanks, The Kissing Girls Coloring Book PDF, and my two other books, Wolf and Red Shroud. Wolf is a watercolor story featuring a retelling of Red Riding Hood; Red Shroud is a poetry book featuring trippy illustrations. That's 11 dollars worth of PDFs for under half the price!

25 Dollars: All That and a Drawing Tier!


Donate 25 and you get everything prior and a black and white coloring book-style line drawing of the subject of  your choice just for you! I'll draw anything within reason, even pornography. Wow!

50: Make it Color Tier

 

Donate 50 and you get what you get at 25, only it will be in full color! Limit one character per person, and no background.

What If the Full Amount Isn't Raised?

If the full amount isn't raise, you'll still get your perks, and I'll work with what I've received. I'll still be very grateful. If I happen to make more, I'll be able to do more!

Other Places To Find Me:

http://sleepran.tumblr.com
http://karenkayellamas.com
http://twitter.com/sleeprann

That's it! Thank you!

story:
THE SOUL OF A HERO:

SEASON 2

 

 

The Quick Pitch!

I’m DL Maffett, a full-time crime fighter and part-time independent comic book creator. My current project The Soul of a Hero Season 2 The Soul of a Hero is a FREE ongoing online comic book series that you can enjoy anytime by visiting www.SoulofaHero.com or Webtoons! I have a passion for comics, art, design, illustration and bringing creatives together work on projects! So much so, that I recently completed art school for the purpose of learning from industry professionals on how to make The Soul of a Hero a better comic book series!  

My crowdfunding campaign is to help me make season two of my comic book series come to life. It’s important to me because I want to create new content for traditional comic book fans as well as those who just want to experience something new and fun. I’ve worked hard on learning my craft and now it’s time to share my story with the world! If you love new comics or just love me and want to see me succeed or both you are sure to enjoy The Soul of a Hero, a 1970s sploitation comic with Kung Fu Action and a superhero kick! Support my crowdfunding campaign today! 

Dynamic New Art!

 

What We Need & What You Get

The Soul of Hero is a FREE online comic book series that has new content weekly, but the print version of the full comic book or digital copies can be purchased online at www.SoulofaHero.com

I am attempting to raise $5,000 to help in the production for this season. It is my goal to get 100 people to donate $50 to this project.  If you feel inclined to do more I greatly appreciate it if you can only do less, my gratitude is the same! The money raised will help pay for contracted and commissioned artists and writers, art supplies, website maintenance, printing, and marketing. Though I am an independent content creator, I am an industry professional. I have worked for various clients and other comic projects making every deadline and producing industry creative standard work. Even if we don't make our financial goal this project WILL move forward! All funds earned will go directly to the production and paying the creatives who are contracted to assist. 

I believe in delivering on any promise made. And doing so I have already invested in the perks that donation partners will receive. Supporters will be T-shirts, posters, custom illustrations, and of course my endearing and sincere gratitude as well as the feeling that you supported my dream!

The Impact

I’ve created a crew of creatives from around the world including, the United States, the United Kingdom, Italy, South Korea, and Nigeria. The Soul of a Hero Season One’s crowdfunding funding was partially successful and we were able to produce the series and deliver content. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Can't afford to donate, you can help by approaching others to do so. Please share the link and tell them how you know this guy who created a cool comic book that really believes in himself and needs your help to get it out and published! You can also visit the www.SoulofaHero.com and purchase items from the online store.

story:
Hear Our Tale

My name is Ryan Alves, me and Jeff Lewinski make up the team (along with our contributors) bringing CARGO to life. We both live and work in Providence, RI, making comics and other things when we find the time. Recently, we've dedicated our cumulative energies toward putting the first issue of our space truckin' comics anthology out into the world.

Image Credit: Sara Dunn

CARGO started a handful of years ago as a "fun" project Jeff and I planned to whip up wherein some wily space truckers are moving something outside their depth and mess it up. Over the course of the next year I started to talk to local artists in the Providence/ Boston area about our gestating idea and got a resoundingly positive response. After doing a small, solo, preliminary issue (which both the digital pdf and physical copies will be available here!) I started to ask peers more seriously about contributing and it was then that our small idea morphed into something more universal, and exciting.

Image Credit: Walker Mettling

Image Credit: Caroline McClain

Image Credit: Jeremy Ferris

There have been setbacks, but after two years and some bumps in the road, CARGO #1 is lookin' good and ready for print. The proofs we've received look amazing, and we couldn't be more excited to get it in your hands.  

Image Credit: Ryan Alves

What We Need & What You Get

Why $1,800?

With printing a book this size (8.5''x 11'') at full color on good paper, things tend to add up quickly. We're hoping to get 130 copies printed in total. Each of the ten creators would get three copies, leaving 100 for backers and shops down the line. Printing CARGO #1 alone adds up to $1,500, and printing the zero issue, mini comics, and stickers will be another $300.  

Even if we don't make our goal of $1800, every backers' order will be fulfilled.

Deep Impact

While getting pages in, designing the cover/ logo/ curation/ orientation of the book, and talking with printers/ feeling out alternative methods for printing has at times been as laborious as it is rewarding, we feel our contribution to the ever expanding world(s) of science fiction is ultimately a good and worthwhile one and we hope that some people out there will as well.  Every contributor to CARGO exceeds the parameters in their own unique way, making this book really something special. This is mine and Jeff's first time with a project this size and if all goes to plan we'll be able to put out a second issue in the coming months.

CARGO started a handful of years ago as a "fun" project Jeff and I planned to whip up wherein some wily space truckers are moving something outside their depth and mess it up. Over the course of the next year I started to talk to local artists in the Providence/ Boston area about our gestating idea and got a resoundingly positive response. After doing a small, solo, preliminary issue (which both the digital pdf and physical copies will be available here!) I started to ask peers more seriously about contributing and it was then that our small idea morphed into something more universal, and exciting.
Image Credit: Walker Mettling

Image Credit: Caroline McClain

Image Credit: Jeremy Ferris

There have been setbacks, but after two years and some bumps in the road, CARGO #1 is lookin' good and ready for print. The proofs we've received look amazing, and we couldn't be more excited to get it in your hands.  
Image Credit: Ryan Alves


What We Need & What You Get
Why $1,800?
With printing a book this size (8.5''x 11'') at full color on good paper, things tend to add up quickly. We're hoping to get 130 copies printed in total. Each of the ten creators would get three copies, leaving 100 for backers and shops down the line. Printing CARGO #1 alone adds up to $1,500, and printing the zero issue, mini comics, and stickers will be another $300.  
Even if we don't make our goal of $1800, every backers' order will be fulfilled.


Deep Impact
While getting pages in, designing the cover/ logo/ curation/ orientation of the book, and talking with printers/ feeling out alternative methods for printing has at times been as laborious as it is rewarding, we feel our contribution to the ever expanding world(s) of science fiction is ultimately a good and worthwhile one and we hope that some people out there will as well.  Every contributor to CARGO exceeds the parameters in their own unique way, making this book really something special. This is mine and Jeff's first time with a project this size and if all goes to plan we'll be able to put out a second issue in the coming months.

story:
What is 180Dayz all about?

I create comics about teaching and issues in education because I know firsthand as a teacher that anyone working in our field or with kids in general needs a good laugh, and honestly, there probably isn't anything more funny than what goes on in education these days. My goal is to bring you, my fellow colleagues, a bit of stress relief and also enlighten the general public as to what is really happening in the world of education. 

Wait, I thought you were a rich and famous cartoonist... (aka, didn't I see your comic in my union paper?) So why do you want my money?

Contrary to what some may imagine, my work for 180Dayz has been up to this point pro bono. Besides the tremendous time commitment, believe it or not there are some costs associated with running the 180Dayz site (i.e. web-hosting, the mocha double lattes needed to fuel me through a day of teaching and then working on a comic at night, etc.). I usually absorb these costs, but I've recently come to a point where I want to test the moxie of what 180Dayz does. Is it fulfilling a strong of enough need that people would be willing to open up their wallets and support it? Thus, I am doing a bit of a test here. My goal is to raise at least $100 during this short campaign to covering webhosting and associated costs (I know, I know, it says the goal is $500 but that is because Indiegogo has that set as minimum amount, so I can't set it any lower than that, but trust me $100 bucks is my goal, I'm not a greedy bast@rd, lol!)  If this mini-campaign proves successful (aka it raises $100) then I will move forward with some more substantial projects and product releases that I am sure a few of my fans have been waiting for. It is my hope that such will forge a eventual self-sufficient future for 180Dayz and eliminate the need for me begging for money, ooops, I mean crowdfunding. (Some of you have already told me what you want from 180Dayz, but if there is a 180Dayz product you want to see first holla at me at 180dayzcomics@gmail.com and let me know, and if this goes well then I will move forward with some of those ideas).


So what do I get out of this?

Well first and foremost, you keep the 180Dayz site and comics alive, possibly saving thousands if not millions of teachers from a nervous breakdown. Besides that, I do have different levels of rewards for each contribution amount as you will see on the funding page. 


What else can I do to support 180Dayz?

A huge help is to continue to spread the word about 180Dayz. 

Let others know about this campaign through use of the Indiegogo share tools.

Tell others about 180Dayz.com and encourage them to  SUBSCRIBE to the site.

Like the 180Dayz facebook page. 180Dayz Facebook Page Link. Like it!

Do all of the above and you are my hero!!!!!!!!! :)

story:
Since we are now signed on by the wonderful Outpouring Comics, this time we will only be featuring a couple key incentives to all backers. Issues of the comic will be made available worldwide through outpouringcomics.com, and PDF copies on plenty of online web stores.


This campaign is for any of our fans who want to be immortalized IN the comic itself. Do you want to die in the pages of a comic?


Straight forward, you will die, but first be in at least a page to 2 pages of the comic. We will use your likeness and possibly your name. Each tier will also include a copy of the comic once released, and shipping.

story:
It's not Nostalgia, it's a window into a Parallel Universe!

I bet you remember those magical 80's cartoons: Thundercats, Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles, He-Man, Silverhawks, the list goes on. I bet you remember the toys as well, they all had a special vehicle, a lair, a playset. I bet you remember the smell of your warm TV screen, of your plastic action figures, of your favorite worn out comic book. That is the feeling MASTER OF THE LORDS is going after, the smell of your childhood, even if you didn't grow up in the 80's.

Imagine there was another cartoon, another comic, another toyline you knew nothing about, but it combined all the cheesyness and awesomeness of all the cartoons you love, even if it was just a ploy to sell toys, who cares? It had Rapping Astronaut Dinosaurs, Borderline Offensively Dressed Barbarians, Street Tough Extreme Sports Aficionado Mutants, and a Planet full of Ninjas!

This Cartoon did exist, it just didn't in our Universe, but don't worry, we are bringing it here, in the form of a 60 PAGE GRAPHIC NOVEL. With your help we can bring the awesomeness of MASTER OF THE LORDS to this dimension!

But don't just take our word for it, you can read the entire first chapter for free HERE.


And while you are at it, you can listen to a 3 track Mini Soundtrack by ANCIENT ORDER OF THE DROIDS (they are also from another dimension) which will be available as one of the perks for this campaign.



About Us...

My name is Gerardo Preciado, I'm a comic book writer, you may be familiar with some of the stories from my previous blog, a couple of them went viral (Batman: The Deal, Superman: God's End). Recently I also had the opportunity to debut in print with Grimm Tales of Terror # 9 (Zenescope), a love letter to 80's slasher films.



Last year, my super friend (and amazing artist) David Marquez (Warriors of Panlan, Annkidu) and I decided to create a new webcomics blog called OLD SKULL COMICS to tell stories that we would love to read ourselves, and most importantly, make them available online for free to everyone. You can see more of David's work on his Facebook Page.


We already have uploaded a short Sci-i/Horror story called 'LUNATIK', and as we mentioned before, the complete first chapter from 'MASTER OF THE LORDS' is available now, with more content coming very soon.

Variant Cover for MASTER OF THE LORDS: Chapter One by Co-Creator David Marquez

Why we need you

All the money raised thru this campaign will go to the artists illustrating the comic (I'm writing it myself, with character designs by David), as well as the actual manufacturing of the graphic novel and the rewards. David and I are not actually making a dime on this project, we just want to make it because we love it, and we think you'll love it too.

We are working with an amazing art team led by Luis Rivera, who magically capures the feeling of a lost 80's cartoon.

Perky Perks

Our main perk is of course, a MASTER OF THE LORDS Graphic Novel in Hard Cover format, featuring 60 pages of story, plus concept art, and as many cool things as we can throw in it!. It will also be available in a HI RESOLUTION PDF.

But it doesn't stop there, we have the aforementioned 3 Track Mp3 Mini Soundtrack by ANCIENT ORDER OF THE DROIDS as well as Limited Edition T-Shirts, Coloring Books, Stickers, Buttons, Sketches and Original Art (We will be unveiling the final designs throughout the course of the campaign).



PLUS we have Early Bird Levels, the first people who support us on this levels will get an Extremely Limited Edition ANCIENT ORDER OF THE DROIDS 3 Track Mini Soundtrack on CASSETTE at no extra charge!

We cannot guarantee that you will look as cool as Don Johnson on our Limited Edition T-Shirt, but you will definitely look better than you look now!  Also, you should probably not wear a gun, unless you are an 80's cop or something.

One of the four Original 11"x17" Pencil  Art Covers from MASTER OF THE LORDS by David Marquez available as one of our rewards!


Finally

We would like to sincerely thank you for taking the time to read this. Even if you are unable to donate at this time, you can help us by spreading the word about this project, tell your friends, tell your grandma, tell your unbearable boss! Tweet, Share, Like, Say a Prayer and don't forget tu use the hashtags #MasterOfTheLords, #ObeyYourMaster and #OldSkullComics!

story:
Short Summary

Mr. Mark Twain is back with his one man show! This June at the new Sacred Fools space in Los Angeles California as part of the Hollywood Fringe Festival, Mr. Mark Twain will be shooting out the lights with stories, observations, and general nonsense (with extra nonsense on the side). If he fools around long enough, he may even say something worth repeating.

What We Need & What You Get

While Mr. Mark Twain isn't a hard man to accommodate we will need a few items to make sure the show runs smoothly. We need money for:

  • Theater rental (the church community room is booked)
  • Insurance (for all the fire breathing)
  • Festival registrations (our names in the programs!)
  • Oooh! We should rent a popcorn machine!
  • Marketing (mostly balloons and staged "incidents")
  • White suit cleaning
  • Horse supplies
  • Just heard from the producers. No popcorn machine.
  • Cigars, mustaches, spirit gum, and reburial fees (he can't stay forever!)
  • The Tech Folks (those lights don't turn on and off all by themselves...unless there's a ghost...uh oh...)
  • What you get: All sorts of prizes and temptations but mostly, you get that warm, happy feeling inside knowing you put a literary master back on stage in front of the people. 106 years ago Mark Twain was one of our boldest truth tellers. What would he say if he were here today? Let's find out together!

    TICKET RULES! With every donation of $5 or more, you get a ticket to the show. But look here! Even though your name will be at the door of the show you chose you can't be late!  When the doors open, we're going. And these seats are not reserved. They're completely unreserved. They'll talk back, spread rumors. Wild seats.  Dangerous, wild seats at Mr. Mark Twain's show.

Risks & Challenges

Risks and challenges? This whole thing is risk and challenges. We may all look back at this in July and say "Well, it was a nice idea but Mr. Mark Twain is going back into the ground." But let's give Mr. Mark Twain shot and see what happens.

In fact, let's give him a couple of shots, in close succession. Whiskey!

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Tell everyone you know to vote this year. Seriously!
  • Come see the show. (Too on the nose?)
  • Share Mr. Mark Twain with all your friends. Let's get together a room full of rambunctious people looking for some truthful fun. Or some funful truth. Fruth. Trun? Wordsmithery! Nonsense! M'josha!

And remember: If it looks like a duck, walks like a duck, and quacks like a duck, it's a duck.*

*Unless it's one of them duck-shaped chew ducks for kittens. Then that's no duck at all. That's just an ol' cat toy.

story:
With your support we will be able to publish our first 500 books and present it on " Comic Con San Diego 2016"


The story is based on medieval poem written by Georgian poet Rustaveli. Because of its importance UNESCO announced year 2016 as the year of its memory. Throughout the centuries this poem has been translated into more then 40 languages, but this will be first time the world will experience this wonderful story as a 300 page graphic novel. 

The story offers a very unique persppective on the medieval oriental world. Values such as, gender equality, freedom of personal choice, religious tolerance and the role of the secular state are presented as an organic part of oriental society.

Taking place in the fictional settings of exotic India and Arabia, the poem is an epic, chivalric romance it explores about the friendship of two heroes, Avtandil and prince Tariel, and their quest to find the object of prince Tariel’s love, princess Nestan-Darejan. These idealized heroes and devoted friends are united by courtly love, generosity, sincerity, dedication, and proclaim equality between men and women, which is a recurring theme through the novel.

By glorifying courtly love, the author strongly condemns forced marriages. The poem also expresses an admiration for women and demands for gender equality. This cult of woman celebrates her honor and freedom to choose her own husband. Princess Nestan is seen as the model of a noble woman who puts reason above passion. In equal rights, women can develop a sincere friendship with the opposite sex without love and desire and Asmat’s character is dedicated to prince Tariel. Consistent with its expressions of equality, tolerance and respect for individual rights, the poem also condemns slavery.

At its essence, the poem is an expression of joyful life. The success of the three heroes in the liberation of princess Nestan from captivity shows that justice can exist on the earth, and with enough courage and perseverance one can find happiness.

PLEASE CLICK THE LINK BELOW TO READ MORE ABOUT THE STORY: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Knight_in_the_Panther's_Skin#Story

Risks and challenges

I am fully concentrated on this project. I wrote the script and now I am creating the artwork together with my team. Next stage would be to hire an editor who will polish the dialogs before it goes in print.

We foresee no problems in the publication. We plan to have the book out by the end of 2016.

story:
Greetings! 

My name is Timothy Lee Olson the writer and creator of Melvin.

I know you want to read the best action comic around, and I believe I've created that comic book! The hero is a mercenary named Melvin who must traverse dangerous terrains and fight even more dangerous tyrants on an alien world if he hopes to save a princess from a murderous cult. Melvin will have at least 27 action-packed pages drawn by newcomer Sherwin Caayao Saynes with an Original Cover done by Vic King. Variant Covers done by Sherwin Caayao Saynes and Rob Ewing.

 

The original cover was done by Vic King and Billy Bacsko

 

Rob Ewing cover

Sherwin Cover

Dillard cover

We're hoping to raise at least $2000 to help towards completing the production of the book, get the comic printed in as best quality possible, and pay for some extra merchandise like the pins, trading card, and maybe some bonus goodies.

 

This year MELVIN is going to assault your senses and kick you hard in the teeth, but you'll still come back smiling for more! MELVIN kicks ass and takes names in the same spirit as action-packed sci-fi & fantasy flicks of the 80s and honors those types of stories as it's the main inspiration.

 

 

Stretch goals

 

Card set available at $3000

 

 

 

 

 

 

Team

 

Timothy Lee Olson

Creator, Storyboard Artist, and Writer of Melvin and Death Corp (available on webtoons)  

 

Sherwin Caayao Saynes

Artist and Inker on Melvin

Others who were a part of the project

 

Vic King

Indie artist that rose from fan art twitter to contribute to numerous indie comics including variant covers and now a successfully funded indie comic of his own. Asyl

story:
Adam & Eternity Project Summary

As an up-and-coming comic creator, it is hard to make a mark in the industry with so much creative talent already out there. However, "Adam & Eternity" means a great deal to me personally, and hopefully to you. I designed/created this journey to reflect the current times we live in, the often traumatizing, stressful anxieties most of us face when we are confronted with the question, "Who am I?" Struggling to find our identity/place in this world is something I have spent most of my life trying to understand. I always found the best solution to these questions is through creating stories. Adam & Eternity will take place in a broken/apocalyptic realm known as Earth. Adam, our protagonist, will journey to known/unknown & mythological places to slowly begin to piece together what it was that both brought us together and eventually destroyed us.

Each chapter will answer a specific question, concluding in a profound lesson I learned about myself. I plan to breakdown high-concept philosophies and make them digestible, entertaining, and beautifully conceptualized material onto jaw-dropping comic pages.

Adam & Eternity will be introducing my artist and collaborator, Oscar Dominic Armendariz Pinto, but you can call him Dom. Dominic is an Amateur Mexican Comic Book Artist. He has been spending the last year and a half as a professional/full-time comic book artist! Dom studied architecture here in Mexico, but in the end, his love for comics oriented him to this profession.

Dom loves to try different styles, but in the end, his excellence drawing incredibly detailed backgrounds with a more anime-ish character are the approach we found both perfect and eye-catching for this project.

Our Colorist, Jake “JaSketch” Gustafson, is an up and coming Comic Book Colorist, Illustrator, and Character Designer. His love for animation and comics are what inspired him to get into the creative field.

Jake has a great love for wild colors, heavily inspired by works such as Bryan Lee O'Malley's Scott Pilgrim (Colored run), Tyson Hesse’s "Diesel", and JoJo’s "Bizarre Adventure". Adam & Eternity will be no exception in addition to these great works.

Both Robby, Dom, and Jake want to say thank you for your attention, we hope for your continued support with Adam & Eternity. 

Series Synopsis: 

Logline: An impossible creation learns to become human through a spectacularly mythological, but grounded journey. Once finishing this unlikely journey of discovery, it is then given a choice to decide the fate of the broken universe he was born into.

Synopsis: Adam awakes in a womb between dimensions. Unaware of how he was propelled into existence, Adam bursts from his womb into a bleed of beautiful colors and light. He asks, “Who am I?” He explores this desolate and post-apocalyptic realm called Earth. He discovers what it means to become human, despite himself being the most powerful being to ever exist. How god became man, by learning from humanity. Its mistakes, its creations, its dreams, and hopes all kindle Adam's journey to discover how he can save this world. Or does he choose to leave it behind?
 

What We Need & What You Get

Let's Break It Down: 

  • We aim to produce our project into fully-printed Traditional Comics, concluding in a collected Trade Paperback. This is the primary reason for funding. 
  • We plan to use the money funded to enable this printing via Greko Printing (A Printing Press Associated with Comic Book/Graphic Novel Production)
  • Our initial goal (The Set Funding Goal) will be going directly to the printing press distribution and shipping costs.
  • Once & If we reach our initial goal, we aim to produce individual comics per issue. This will enable our stretch goal which will unlock more exclusive material such as:
    • Variant Cover Art
    • Pin-Ups 
    • More Pages in Trade Paperback

Perks (What You Recieve For Backing): 

  • Digital Copies of Issues One-Five
  • Trade Paperback
  • "Thank You's" in Trade Paperback
  • Pin-Ups
  • Variant Covers
  • Signed Material 
  • Behind-The-Scenes Material 
  • Exclusive Cover Art for Issue One
  • Skype Meetings w/ Team Discussing Creative Processes

Inevitable Preparation:

  • If we do not reach our desired "entire" goal, then we will still use the accrued money for our book to go to the printing press, and cover the rest in shipping & printing costs.

The Impact

This project means more than just "another" comic book or graphic novel. Adam & Eternity is a "Coming-of-Age" Story about Identity, Humanity, Love, Hope, Depression, Anxiety, Life, & Death. My team and I are trying to deliver a meta-physical, but grounded, journey into our fantastical world. We use allegories, metaphors, and some jaw-dropping imagery to propel the story to the pinnacle of storytelling: Comic Books.

This Project is Me, Dom, & Jake. This is us, modern creators, using our stories to help those trying to do the same. A Story that will help you get through the tough times and the best times. 

We successfully funded our first issue, and this campaign is meant to deliver the rest of our stunning story. Upon first pledging, you'll receive the first issue in Digital Format & Physical Copy. 

Risks & Challenges

There are always challenges when entering the world of illustration. From emotional/mental to the actual physical entryway into this amazing sphere. In this modern world "sharing" your campaign is the hardest part of getting the word out there. 

We will overcome this. We will personally put in the effort each day to produce amazing content that you, the backer, will receive. We just ask one thing from you, share the project you backed. Help us gain the support we need to spread this amazing story to its maximum potential. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Here are some excellent tools to help us overcome these challenges! 

  • Spread the word on your Social Media (Twitter, Facebook, Reddit, Instagram, Twitch, Etc.)
  • Make Some Noise! Flash some of that exclusive content on your pages. Get them excited about the project you backed. 
  • Share! Share! Share! Repost our link through Indiegogo's stellar toolset.
