story:
Short Summary

America is falling. One man loses everything due to government deception. How far will he go for justice and revenge?

  • I am the creator and artist of 'Truther'. I have felt compelled to write this story and share it with other freedom loving individuals. I am the only person writing and creating this graphic novel. No team. No bosses to please. It is the product of a lot of time spent researching, writing, and drawing. As a professional artist, I have drawn many projects before but have never written a single story until now; and it's flowing like honey!
  • The line between parody and real life is blurred. Truther is set in a fictional world that resembles our own, but is filled with real research and information that anyone can investigate for themselves. This project is important for me to share with you because we are living in a time where information, true of false, is used as a weapon. It seems all aspects of mainstream media and entertainment are self destructing under the woke agenda. We need  stories like this to relate to and find strength. 
  • If you support TRUTHER issue #1 I will have the means to continue my character's journey to the end. I already have all plot points and storylines written down as I fill the pages with art and dialogue. I have 37 pages completed and plan on making this graphic novel about 60+/- pages total. With the money raised I will be able to complete the book on schedule and deliver the best quality for backers. Your support will fuel the fire of patriotism for all people lucky enough to grace these pages. 

What We Need & What You Get

  • I need money to make this graphic novel the best quality for you.
  • I want to make the art and story to be something you're proud to share with others.
  • Money will go towards finishing the art for Issue #1, and possibly coloring every page, making sure paper weight is perfect, and maybe even creating a hard cover.

The Impact

  • Let's make this graphic novel so popular that no 'Normie' or Leftist can ignore it.
  • Wake up friends and family that are still in the dark. This story is sure to challenge the perception of what's happening to our country.  
  • Stop supporting the 'woke' agenda that seems to be in every aspect of mainstream entertainment. This story will give you hope, and someone to cheer for, as Alex's story unfolds.

Risks & Challenges

  • Being my first self-published work, I will need to research every aspect of creating, printing, and fulfilling orders for the first time.
  • Though the story is fully flushed out, I am in the middle of finishing the artwork. I will only be able to color it if a certain goal is met.
  • I would like to produce this graphic novel with local printers and shops only. I am a big believer in supporting small local shops. I have already reached out to those shops that will help me fulfill the orders of the comic, posters, stickers and even tote bags.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • If you can't support this project with money, feel free to show your support by sharing #Truther_comic on Instagram.
  • Feel free to mention TRUTHER on your own page, videos and/or livestreams!

Thank you for your support and interest. Let's make this graphic novel a success and let the leftist tears flow!

story:
OVERVIEW

UNSTITCHED is a 48-page story about a T.E.D.D.Y trying to keep the dreams and imagination of a little girl safe from The Darkness, who wants to corrupt it with fear. UNSTITCHED is a blend of Rise Of The Guardians, Toy Story, and Coraline.   

Childhood wonder is built on dreams, hope, and imagination with fear being what unstitches it. The Darkness is fear taken form but is held at bay for now by Eleanor's nightlight. It is up to a brand new T.E.D.D.Y (Terrifecally. Effective. Dreaming. Defender. Yeah) to protect her and her nightlight from the goons working for The Darkness trying to break the light and terrorize her without becoming UNSTITCHED in the process.  

Back Cover for both books and is a poster as well.

FIRST 48 HOURS BACKER RAFFLE (COMPLETED CONGRATS BACKER #17)

Backers in the first 48 hours will have their backer numbers put into a raffle. The winner will get a foil print based on the variant cover done by Jason Brubaker (Sithrah, Remind).

 

STRETCH GOALS

8K- Adding pages to the back for Concept and Fan Art

10K- UNSTITCHED Patch

15K- Print by a TBD Guest Artists

20K- Bounses to the team

 

 

CREATORS

Justin Dutton (writer/creator) 

Laura Rimazombati (artist) A.C.T on Webtoons

Eric Weathers (letters) Allegiance Arts Letterer/illustrator of Batte Brick Road 

PROGRESS SO FAR

ALL ART COMPLETE!!! ALL 48 PAGES DRAWN AND COLORED. We are starting to letter. 

Risks & Challenges

2020 has been crazy, with current political climate in the US, and Covid-19 but luckily the risks should not be too bad due to having the book nearly finished before launching. No worries about this campaign being a year late. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
COLLEGE OF THE DEAD GRADUATION DAY is here!

 

"Where College Costs You An Arm And A Leg!"

 

 

The script, pencils, inks, colors, letters and covers are all 100% done!  The ALL-NEW full color comic, 48 pages, ships June 2020!

 

Comic Book (Arm & A Leg Cover)

 

Comic Book (Graduation Day Cover)

 

Comic Book (Hot Torch Cover)

 

Comic Book ("College Bound" Cover By Artist Narwhal)

 

 

EXCLUSIVE NEW ART BOOK: (260 PAGES)

 

COLLEGE OF THE DEAD GRADUATION DAY ART BOOK — the original 252 art panels by JAVIER ARANDA from COLLEGE OF THE DEAD GRADUATION DAY presented in a pristine, dynamic format with NO LETTERING, ART ONLY. The ART BOOK is printed one panel per page in a high quality 260 page, 8½ inches by 8½ inches perfect bound format.

 

 

 

EXCLUSIVE NEW MAKING OF ASHCAN BOOK: (100 PAGES)

 

COLLEGE OF THE DEAD GRADUATION DAY ART BOOK 100 page 'making of' book that shows you the full script (with photo references) and full rough pencil layouts artist documenting how we made COLLEGE OF THE DEAD GRADUATION DAY!  A fascinating and educational look at professional comic book production, how we did it and how to do it.

 

 

This is AMAZING!  We've added a brilliant colorist to our original creative team to produce an ALL NEW, first-ever full color issue!   

 

Want to read it?   

 

Here's a look at the interior pages!  

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

GOT ANYTHING ELSE?

 

Heck YES!   The COLLEGE OF THE DEAD PREQUEL story takes place immediately prior to the events of COLLEGE OF THE DEAD GRADUATION DAY, it's by the same creative team and it's the first book that started the series.  It's 140 pages, perfect bound, printed in glorious black and white, with a color cover by JAVIER ARANDA and KYLE RITTER!   

 

College of the Dead - REVIEW from PROFESSOR GEEK !

 

EVEN MORE? 

 

ABSOLUTELY!    We produced a COLLEGE OF THE DEAD PREQUEL ASHCAN with 100 pages of full script complete with original reference photos for the comic book artist presented directly alongside the artist's rough storytellling pencil layouts.   This is EXACTLY HOW we made the prequel.  You will be amazed at how FASCINATING and EDUCATIONAL this book is!

 

WHAT ELSE?

We're also offering a COLLEGE OF THE DEAD PREQUEL ART BOOK — the original 252 art panels by JAVIER ARANDA from the black and white prequel comic book presented in a pristine, dynamic format with NO LETTERING, ART ONLY. The ART BOOK is printed one panel per page in a high quality 260 page, 8½  inches by 8½ inches perfect bound format.

 

        


 

Please support this campaign, and let others know!  Spread the word and share the link!

https://igg.me/at/cotdgd/

story:
MOON KNIGHT Vol. 7 #1 

by Jeff Lemire and Greg Smallwood 


Debuting April 13, 2016 (Shipping to Purchasers will begin on that date)

We are proud to announce the very first ever Bazinga Comics Exclusive Store Variant and just in time for the 40th Anniversary of this dark and enigmatic Marvel Superhero.

In 2014, legendary writer Warren Ellis breathed new life into Moon Knight and his popularity has been growing ever since. There is even talk of MK being developed as a Netflix Original Series alongside Daredevil, Jessica Jones and upcoming Luke Cage and Punisher series's.

Personally, I've loved Moon Knight since I first discovered the early 80's series by Doug Moench and Bill Sienkiewicz.

What better way for Bazinga Comics to celebrate our 4th year in business, but with an exclusive variant cover of my favorite hero.

When I learned of the upcoming new series by rising stars Jeff Lemire and Greg Smallwood, it seemed the stars had aligned to make this a reality. And with the help of the phenomenal artist Chris Stevens (whose art on other books can be seen in the Gallery section) and the fine folks at Marvel, we offer you this badass variant only available from Bazinga Comics.

So, we're offering you the chance to reserve your copy here early, and all around the country, so that we can afford to make it available and generate some excitement for this new Moon Knight series that promises to be ELECTRIC.


Other Ways You Can Help

Help spread the word by Sharing this campaign on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram and any other social media platform you are part of.

story:
Special LAST CHANCE to get GORE SHRIEK RESURRECTUS VOLUME #1

This special last minute campaign was designed to give YOU your FINAL opportunity to get in on the FIRST ISSUE of our 30th Anniversary special.
  • ALL NEW stories and art!!
  • 48 horror packed pages!!
  • Get YOUR NAME listed in the first issue credits!!

The reverse of the shirt displays the world famous first Gore Shriek™ cover image by Bruce Spaulding Fuller.
Not be available in any store or online. They are campaign exclusives!! M, L, XL, 2XL, 3XL and 4 XL.

story:
Our stories are for everyone who loves traveling, adventures and interesting historical events, lost treasures, caches, and forgotten secrets. We make:

It is an adventure series with the main character Archont Duval, a world-renowned archeologist and antiques shop owner who comes face-to-face with ancient tangled puzzles. Each comics is a mini detective story.

The strips are based on real historical events and facts. We have researched the stories thoroughly, providing a way for readers to both enjoy the plot of the story and dive into history. Very easy and pleasant reading, the adventures of Archont Duval and his team will inspire study of many eras of history and exotic locales in the world.


Here are some fragments of already finished comics:

A young Canadian turns up at the shop of Archont Duval. The stranger wishes to solve the mystery of his great grandfather's letters. All clues lead to Notre Dame. Archont and his young relatives accompany the stranger to Paris to find the hidden treasure.

The mayor of Venice receives strange anonymous letters. The Carnival is at stake. 


The books also function as travel guides to many places around the globe. Appropriate for any age, the travel guides feature colorful illustrations and interesting facts and details, making them handy while traveling as well as interesting to read at home.



If we are lucky to get more money, than we plan, there will be more stories soon:




Risks and challenges:

Shipping is always a challenge. To minimize the risk we will use postal service, which can provide a code for each parcel to track them if needed. All the postal expenses are already included in the pledge, so you don’t have to worry about the extra costs for delivery. 

All the stories for pack 1 are ready. Stories for pack 2 will be sent as soon as they are finished: PDFs – one for one; pack 2 printed – when all of them are ready (in 1 pack) – to minimize the postal expenses. 

For future personages there is a certain risk, that you don’t like your character at once. We will be offering you new variants till you like them. Even if no character of our next 5 stories will suit you, there will be next 5, 10, … we will find you the best match!

story:
The Short Version:

Hello there! 

I'm Christina "DZA" Marie from the blog "Dragons, Zombies & Aliens." I've been writing fantasy and sci-fi all my life, started getting published a few years ago, and have now finished writing a script for the first book of a graphic novel series called Sovadron. All I need now is an illustrator, and the funds to hire him. 

 

Sovadron: The Story

Lt. Shakairra Romazi isn’t sure who will kill her first: the enemy’s soldiers, or her own.

Her money is on the latter.

 

After barely surviving their country’s last war, Shakairra and her soldiers are pulled into another. Goblins have been kidnapping citizens and selling them into slavery. But when a foreign noble arrives to investigate the death of his sister, Shakairra learns that the greater threat is within her own ranks.

As the body count climbs and her allies diminish, Shakairra must place her trust--never in abundant supply--into four strangers to save her country. But they soon realize this conflict is greater than that. And before this is over, even the blood of gods will be spilled.

 

 

 

 

 

Dawn of War is the first book of an epic fantasy graphic novel series. If you like cover-to-cover action, diverse characters, and sword & sorcery with a twist, you’ll love the first installment of Christina “DZA” Marie’s new series.

Support Dawn of War to start the adventure today!

 

 

What We Need & What You Get

The main goal here is $10,000. That will be enough to hire artist John Hawkins to illustrate Sovadron, as well as do lettering and the cover art. It will also cover any unexpected fees, some marketing, and IndieGoGo's cut. 

Ideally we would get $20,000. This would not only be enough to illustrate book one of Sovadron, but it'd also generate some extra artwork and ensure that I will have book two written and ready for the artist by this time next year.

What do you get? You get an intense epic fantasy story with some amazing artwork! Perks include:

  • free copies (electronic and/or physical) of Sovadron
  • a free copy of some of my other works before they're released: the urban fantasy novella Minnesotan Witch and the collection Gary the Gecko's Guide to Getting Your Humans to Get Together, and Other Short Stories
  • amazing posters done by illustrator John Hawkins, signed by both of us 

And, if you donate enough, I'll even name a character after you in Book Two! (Whether or not that character survives...I promise nothing.)

 

The Impact

Obviously this project is personal to me because of all the family memories tied into it. Each of the five major characters are based on D&D characters, played by me, my dad, and my brother. But there's another reason this project is so close to my heart, and that is its commitment to diversity. 

I've always loved reading sci-fi and fantasy, and I've always hated its lack of diversity. We've gotten better over the years, but there's still an appallingly low number of women, people of color, people with disabilities, and the LGBTQ+ community. 

Over the course of this series, that's going to change. The more characters that get introduced as the series goes on, the more diverse Sovadron gets. 

 

Risks & Challenges

This is a flexible goal, but not because I have ten grand lying around in case things go south. (Boy, would that be awesome...)

I am determined to make Sovadron happen. Somewhere, somehow, I will find a way to get this graphic novel out there. I'm stubborn that way. 

By contributing to this campaign, however, you're going to make this road a lot smoother. And you get some exclusive benefits, too. Win-win!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Can't contribute? Then share this with your friends and family. Get the word out!

story:
Concepts On Demand

Hi I'm E. Clifton Wilson also known professionally as CLIF and I've worked as a designer for over 15 years and I'm proud to see how far we've come creatively and as a company. Over the years I've had a lot of job titles in the creative industry. Concept artist, 3D sculptor/toy designer, animator, HTML 5 ad designer, comic book illustrator, production designer. This campaign is special because we're in a position where we can produce good work not only for 3RD Sun Entertainment but for others who have ideas they want to see come to life. So we came up with the name Concepts on Demand as our service side of the company. Originally the push was just to produce a Set Walker action figure and sequel comic book to our series Hollow Bones then we realized our services are unique and we can help out other independents like writers who need illustration, or artists who need toy prototypes as well as corporations who need our services. So that idea you had to produce your own comic book toy or t-shirt, we can make it happen.

What We Need & What You Get

Of course we'd need lots of money to make a huge impact, that's where you come in. We believe our products and services are so good, we've got something for everyone. Some of our unique perks include POSTERS + COMIC BOOKS + CUSTOM ACTION FIGURES + WEAPONS PACKS + MINIATURE FIGURES & 3D PRINTS + T-SHIRTS + HATS  & lots of other stuff YOU CREATE. The Unique thing is we're designers for all types of businesses including indie comic makers so if you've GOT AN IDEA? WE CAN CREATE IT. Get custom comic books, toys and all the said stuff above along with custom commercials to help you sell your product. Each dollar goes toward filling perk orders and supplies to create new products.

The Impact

If your a collector who loves toys or a producer of films & shorts who needs models we're the guys who can turn your idea into an actual production quality product in comics magazines, action figures and tees. Use the products for presentations, trade shows or sell online on your own web store. I've sold products and designs for years for companies, and major ad agencies and independent comic book publishers. We've built a reputation of quality work and the ability to give the client what they asked for and better. We get it done faster and with results that take you from sketches to a full production quality product you can sell or keep for your own personal collection.

Risks & Challenges

Risks are clients who have short periods of time to get products done for presentations or whatever reason will need to give us a at least 3 months to get a good product in 3D Models and action figures for production quality pieces. However sample products can be available quicker to chart progress. On average you could expect 6-8 months for really difficult toy projects before final approval. Lighter projects like illustrations take less time as well as T-Shirts. We also are working on live streaming of illustrations to the client so critical input can be covered quickly eliminating all the redo and do-overs that waste precious time. We currently have a capacity to do short runs in the states of about 100 figures, a few thousand posters and t- shirts however we've built relationships with manufacturers to handle larger orders and ease production costs. We've got a step by step process to chart the progress of each project, even when there's design changes to be made we can still stay on course. We also have the option of 3D printing complete figures and accessories as well sculpting, mold, duplication process. This is Michigan home to some of the best tool and die manufacturers in the country we can create a mold designed to fit your needs. We've built relationships with injection molding manufacturers, and suppliers to help us meet the demand and keep projects on course.

Other Ways You Can Help

Don't forget to like and share with friends and thanks for your support everyone!!!

story:
What is "EXTRACTION!"?

EXTRACTION! Comix Reportage is an anthology of comics journalism. Over the course of 2 years, journalists and researchers teamed up with illustrators to document the horrific and often criminal activities of mining companies here in North America, and abroad.

EXTRACTION! includes:

  • Four stand-alone works of comics journalism, documenting the activities of Goldcorp in Guatemala (Gold), Cameco in the Northwest Territories (Uranium), Alcan in India (Aluminum/Bauxite), and Suncor and other investors in the Canadian Athabasca Tar Sands (Oil)
  • Features work from award-winning journalists: Dawn Paley ('Drug War Capitalism'), Tamara Herman ('We Call Them Intruders'), Sophie Toupin and Petr Cizek
  • Comics and illustrations from award-winning artists: Jeff Lemire, Phil Angers, Joe Ollmann, Alain Reno, Carlos Santos, Ruth Tait, and Stanley Wany
  • Each comic includes first-hand accounts of the impact these industries are having on local communities and their ecosystems.

The EXTRACTION! anthology is 130 pages, softcover, colour cover with black and white interior, printed in Canada.

OUR GOALS with this crowdfunder are to cover our initial costs, and start conversations with readers about the impact of the extraction economy. 

While we're at it, we want to connect with concerned individuals and organizations who can use engaging educational materials like these in their work. If you are an educator, librarian, or some other kind of community organizer, we'd love to hear from you!


Why Canadian Mining Companies?

Canada is home for 60% of the world’s publicly-traded mining companies.¹

Canadian companies currently hold the rights to thousands of mines and prospective mine sites worldwide. Development of mineral resources tends to come at the expense of local populations, who are not consulted about the projects, nor do they benefit from the resources extracted. Within Canada's borders, indigenous communities regularly suffer from community displacement and environmental devastation as a result of resource development.


    How Can A Comic Impact the Canadian Mining Industry?

    Knowingly and unknowingly, we all participate in extraction industries, whether it's the gas in our car tanks, the aluminum foil in our kitchens, or the nuclear energy providing power to our towns and cities. Here in Canada, for instance, we all  invest in Canadian mining companies through the Canada Pension Plan,² whether we like it or not!

    And yet, these companies participate in human rights violations and environmental devastation that we find detestable.

    So what can a book of comics do about that?

    • Comics are one of the fastest-growing sections of all American libraries.³ Comics can engage readers who might pass over more formal writing on a serious subject like mining and extraction industries.
    • "EXTRACTION!" speaks as much to the history of mining as to current events. This makes the book a great primer for anyone wishing to better understand the industry as a whole.
    • Getting "EXTRACTION!" into the hands of students, educators, and other concerned citizens strengthens the position of indigenous, environmental, and human rights activists who are fighting back. (Groups, campaigns, and other anti-mining activism take many forms. For a list of what's happening, visit the "Take Action" section of our Press Kit. Note: There is also a perk that lets you donate a book to your favourite organization!)
    • We believe in the power of comics to tell stories, open minds, and change lives. We are confident this anthology can accomplish that.

    Risks & Challenges

    Ad Astra Comix is a young publisher but we have a lot of experience with building support for our work and following through on promises to our backers. Our last project, "Drawing the Line!" successfully raised $9,100 over one month for the printing of our first full-length book.

    Funds raised for this project will go specifically towards the following:

    • Printing "EXTRACTION: Comix Reportage" locally, with a Canadian press.
    • Extensive outreach to schools, learning centres, and other community organizations, to use the book in their studies of journalism, the environment, Canadian politics, and the comics medium.
    • An advance on royalties for all contributors.
    • For certain rewards levels, we'll donate copies of the book to community libraries, non-profit organizations, educational centers and environmental groups across North America, Guatemala, and India.

    Other Ways You Can Help

    Ad Astra Comix is a collective of starving artists, so if you don't have a lot of money to contribute to this crowdfunder, we get that. BUT, if you really like what we're doing, there are plenty of other ways you can support us!

    • Talk to your teacher, library, or learning center about getting a copy of "EXTRACTION!" to learn more about Canadian mining
    • Share our project on social media! We are on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, Wordpress, and Tumblr.
    • E-mail us to get a digital copy of the book, and do a review for your blog, podcast, zine, or website!
    • Mention it to a friend the next time you're discussing the devastating impact of resource extraction!
    • Want to help, but not sure what to do? E-mail us for ideas.


    About Us
    Ad Astra Comix is a collective dedicated to creating and producing comics with social justice themes. Our three-member team has, between us, over 30 years of experience in activism across North America. We create, publish, and retail comics with social justice themes. We also host a website dedicated to reviewing and discussing the potential of comics to create social change.



    ¹ - MiningWatch.ca

    ² - For more information about this, visit our "Take Action" page

    ³ - Publisher's Weekly, 2013

Here in Canada, for instance, we all  invest in Canadian mining companies through the Canada Pension Plan,² whether we like it or not! 
And yet, these companies participate in human rights violations and environmental devastation that we find detestable. 
So what can a book of comics do about that?  Comics are one of the fastest-growing sections of all American libraries.³ Comics can engage readers who might pass over more formal writing on a serious subject like mining and extraction industries.
"EXTRACTION!" speaks as much to the history of mining as to current events. This makes the book a great primer for anyone wishing to better understand the industry as a whole. 
 Getting "EXTRACTION!" into the hands of students, educators, and other concerned citizens strengthens the position of indigenous, environmental,  and human rights activists who are fighting back. (Groups, campaigns, and other anti-mining activism take many forms. For a list of what's happening, visit the "Take Action" section of our Press Kit. Note: There is also a perk that lets you donate a book to your favourite organization!)
 We believe in the power of comics to tell stories, open minds, and change lives. We are confident this anthology can accomplish that. 
    Risks & Challenges  Ad Astra Comix is a young publisher but we have a lot of experience with building support for our work and following through on promises to our backers. Our last project, "Drawing the Line!" successfully raised $9,100 over one month for the printing of our first full-length book. 
Funds raised for this project will go specifically towards the following:   Printing "EXTRACTION: Comix Reportage" locally, with a Canadian press. Extensive outreach to schools, learning centres, and other community organizations, to use the book in their studies of journalism, the environment, Canadian politics, and the comics medium.
An advance on royalties for all contributors.

For certain rewards levels, we'll donate copies of the book to community libraries, non-profit organizations, educational centers and environmental groups across North America, Guatemala, and India.
    Other Ways You Can Help Ad Astra Comix is a collective of starving artists, so if you don't have a lot of money to contribute to this crowdfunder, we get that. BUT, if you really like what we're doing, there are plenty of other ways you can support us!  Talk to your teacher, library, or learning center about getting a copy of "EXTRACTION!" to learn more about Canadian mining
 Share our project on social media! We are on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, Wordpress, and Tumblr.

E-mail us to get a digital copy of the book, and do a review for your blog, podcast, zine, or website!
Mention it to a friend the next time you're discussing the devastating impact of resource extraction!
 Want to help, but not sure what to do? E-mail us for ideas. 
   About UsAd Astra Comix is a collective dedicated to creating and producing comics with social justice themes. Our three-member team has, between us, over 30 years of experience in activism across North America. We create, publish, and retail comics with social justice themes. We also host a website dedicated to reviewing and discussing the potential of comics to create social change.¹ - MiningWatch.ca² - For more information about this, visit our "Take Action" page³ - Publisher's Weekly, 2013

story:
THANK YOU!

Bode fans, friends and family!

These last few months have been an absolute roller-coaster ride. Around the world and back to Clarion Alley… To quote the Dead, “What a long strange trip it’s been.” I have been so fortunate and blessed to have met some of the coolest and most talented people on the planet. To have been given the gift of a life filled with art in abundance brings me to my knees in thanks everyday. Surely, somewhere in this vast, connected universe, Vaughn is smiling right now, I know it.

This has been a labor of love, and the good news is, we are nearly done! I have finished 65 of the 80 pages for the book, and we are currently in production on the cartoon and videogame. We have a small but mighty team of artists and animators that have been working on this project for years on a zero budget, but with love and dedication. I said it before… If we don’t reach our goal, we will still continue… Either way, the COBALT 60 CHRONICLES are coming, and now, thanks to this Indiegogo, everybody knows!

So, what’s next for Cobalt 60? Well, we keep on keeping on. Cobalt 60 is 50 years old this year… Perhaps it will take until his 60th? Smirks. Well, if that is what it takes, so be it. As an independent artist, this isn’t the first time we’ve been under-funded, ya know? We will ship the limited edition AR Comic in August for sure, and we’ve got a few more surprises up our sleeves in the coming months…. So stay tuned!

All my deepest thanks to my team, my family, my friends, and most of all to you, the fans!

--
Mark Bode
cobalt60bybode@gmail.com
www.cobalt60bybode.com

 

Ladies and Gentlemutants! We are in the last day of our Indiegogo, so please support if you can! Get the new Cobalt 60 Chronicles: Episode Zero signed physical comic book w/app for just $10, or the digital-only version for just $3! 

But what about the FREE stuff?

1. Get the new Cobalt 60 Mural App! Not in the Bay Area? Just print the supplied pic of the painting, point your Android at it, and watch the Queen shake her thang!
2. Graf and street artists… Submit your tag for use in the Radio City level of the game! 
3. Join our crew, and become a member of the Cobalt 60 Beta Test team. Help us make our digital releases solid for Bode fans worldwide!

http://cobalt60bybode.com/muralapp/

Thanks in advance… The future belongs to COBALT 60!



NEW REWARD... Lunch and a Tat with Bode!



Bode is well-known for his comics and murals... And, of, course, his tattoos! Come on down to the Sacred Rose tattoo parlor in San Francisco for an afternoon with Bode.

OPEN AUDITIONS NOW CLOSED

Good morning, my fellow mutants! I wanted y'all to know that we have found our Queen! That's right, the voice role of Cobalt's main squeeze has been selected, and the open audition is now officially closed. THANK YOU SO MUCH to all who entered!

COBALT 60 CHRONICLES
PRE-ORDERS SHIP IN AUGUST!

Cobalt 60 Chronicles: Episode Zero will be available this August! Pre-Order Now here on our IGG page... just $10.00! Digital only just $3.00!

Featuring art from both Vaughn Bode and Mark Bode, this expanded version of the original Cobalt 60 comic comes wrapped in an all-new two-page cover spread. A must-have for the Bode fan! Plus, each page of the comic triggers an interactive 3D animated scene on your iOS or Android device… allowing you to view the action from any angle!

PRE-ORDER NOW... SHIPPING IN AUGUST!
Cobalt 60 Chronicles: Episode Zero
Physical Comic book and iOS/Android app: $10 + Shipping
Digital Comic book and iOS/Android app: $3
Warning: Parental Advisory. Contains Explicit Content.


NEW REWARDS:


Your TAG In-Game!
Get your tag on one of the ruins inside of Cobalt's world. Also, includes a shout out in the credits! For consideration, send your submission to: cobalt60bybode@gmail.com

Bode Backer T-Shirts
Get this fine Tee, and show your your support! Also, includes a shout out in the credits!

 

Lunch and a Tat by Bode
Bode is well-known for his comics, murals... And, his tattoos! Come on down to the Sacred Rose tattoo parlor in San Francisco for an afternoon with Bode!
 

BODE NEWS:



Bode replaces Frazetta Tribute mural that got trashed by Vandals.
Mark will be replacing a Frazetta Tribute painting that he and James O'Barr did back in 2012, which vandals have since destroyed. If you are in the San Francisco area this Thursday & Friday, March 16 & 17, come on down to the Mission District say hello, or peep us out on Facebook Live!

 

BOLDER, DARKER, SEXIER... AND, AS USUAL...
COBALT IS VERY PISSED OFF! 

In the last comic, Cobalt was captured after an unprecedented blood bath of violence and carnage. Exposed and de-hooded, it was revealed that he was indeed the long-lost heir to the throne, much to the celebration of the Radio people. Yet, Cobalt was a terrible king... and felt strapped to the throne of the people he hates.

That’s where the new comic starts. This the first Cobalt 60 comic I have published in years, and the first ever Cobalt 60 animation ever created. This will be the 6th graphic novel in the series, an 80-page story of Cobalt after he bares an heir with Queen BBC and escapes his bondage back into the desert.

 

We've kept it PG-13 for display here on IndieGoGo, but believe me,  the Cobalt 60 Chronicles is chock full of violence, sex, and very bad behavior. It's Cobalt 60 in full effect, and definitely NSFW!

Read about the Bode Legacy, and Cobalt's History at the end of this page.

Cobalt 60 first appearance in Witzend #7, April 1, 1970 by Vaughn Bode

WHY INDIEGOGO? WHY NOW?

Independence. This project is near and dear to my heart. We are going to bring Cobalt out the exactly the way it’s supposed to be... Raw... Hard... the way my Dad imagined him. I’m crowdfunding this because it’s an incredible opportunity to connect with you, the fans. You get it. The Cobalt 60 Chronicles is an over-the-top, no-holds-barred tribute to Bode fans old and new.


HOW MUCH ASS WILL COBALT 60 KICK?

In 1967, Cobalt 60 was one of the first comics ever to feature ultra-violence, sex and a bleak look at our future, years ahead of influencing the films by George Miller, Ralph Bakshi, and Roger Corman and thousands of artists worldwide. In 2017, we are going to bring it even harder… More carnage... More sex and lust… More betrayal… More mutants… All brought to life with modern animation techniques, including motion capture and photogrammetry.



PLUS... It’s Cobalt’s 50th Anniversary, so we’ve lined up lots of cool rewards exclusive to this campaign.  We have terrific print sets, truly collectible comics, blasts from the past and other surprises from the Bode archives... Many of them very limited. All of them are authentically rare, and all signed by Bode!


OUR REWARDS!

Think of your pledge as a pre-purchase. We’ve put together a bunch of rewards that we hope you'll love. And any of our rewards make a great gift for the Bode fan in your fam-bam! Check ‘em out! All rewards include FREE domestic (US) shipping! A nominal charge applies to rewards shipped outside of the US.

 

FAN FUND THE COBALT 60 CHRONICLES!

This is your chance to influence the kind of kick ass, take-no-prisoners Cobalt stories you wanna see. I want you to be our financiers. In return, we’ll make a cartoon and graphic novel that we can all be proud of. We believe fan funding is the best way to bring the Cobalt 60 Chronicles to life. This has been a long train coming, and if it wasn't for you, the fans, we would never have made it this far. Now, we need your help to get up this hill!

All of the assets have been built for the cartoon, and I have completed 65 of the 80 pages for the graphic novel. We already lined up the crew for finishing the cartoon pilot, the programming team for the Augmented Reality, and the print shop that is going to knock out the books. We are ready to rock through this final stage! We will start shipping rewards immediately upon completion of the campaign.  

Thank you so much for helping to make this happen. Please pledge now! If you can’t, that’s cool... But, maybe you can help by sharing on Facebook and Instagram? Got a Bode fan in your life? Let ‘em know! Every little bit helps!

WHERE WILL THE MONEY GO?

Every penny raised will go towards making the Cobalt 60 Chronicles a reality. This covers everything... The creative talent, CGI team, stunt and voice performers, Augmented Reality programmers, printing services, supplies, fees and taxes. In other words, everything that it takes to make this happen in time for San Diego Comic-Con this July. We are calling in all our favors, and every one of our talented crew is willing to do whatever it takes to make this happen. This year. Now.

A portion of the money will go to fulfilling all the cool rewards we are offering and a percentage will go to taxes and IndieGoGo fees. Anything over our goal will go towards funding future Cobalt 60 related projects... See our Stretch Goals, below!


MEET THE TEAM!

  Mark & Molly Bode - Creator & Executive Producers
Mark Bodé is an American cartoonist. The son of underground comics legend Vaughn Bodé, Mark often produces works similar to the elder Bodé’s style. He is best known for his work on Cobalt-60, Miami Mice, and The Lizard of Oz. Bodé has also worked for Heavy Metal magazine and on The Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles. He is also a tattooist, and paints murals all over the world.

Molly Bode is a veteran Producer & Project Coordinator, and has handled the art licensing for the TMNT characters and the Bode work. She also has experience in special event production. Molly is the glue that has kept the Bode Estate up and running for all these years.

  Mark Butler - Animation Director & Mad Scientist
Mark is a veteran character animator, technical director, and motion capture specialist. Mark was a part of the Emmy-award winning animation team on NBC’s “Heroes”, and he has worked on a wide variety of games, broadcast TV, and live events, for clients such as DC Comics, Atari, Warner Bros., Disney and Sony. Can also draw funny rabbits.

  Ollie Teeba - Music & Sound Design
Ollie has been Djing Hip Hop, Funk, Soul and everything that falls in between since his teens. With 7 albums of original material and 2 ‘live session’ albums Ollie made the very well regarded DJ mix albums Fabric 26 and Herbal Blend for Solid Steel. Also Ollie’s ‘War of the Worlds’ DJ re-score was voted amongst the top 10 best mix sessions in the 25th anniversary of Solid Steel radio show.

  Jonny Cuba - Music & Sound Design
After meeting on college radio in the late 80's, Jonny Cuba & the Loop Professor realised they had similar tastes in hip-hop, films and all things funky, and formed DSP. Jonny Cuba has also co-produced material for The Herbaliser, and he also collaborates with Ollie Teeba as production team 'The Process'. He has had music featured on TV and in video games; EA's Knockout Kings , NBA Street & SEGA Extreme Sports. Heavy beats & tight, quotable rhymes are what Jonny is all about.

  Steve Chang - Programming
Steve’s been involved with many video game productions over the years, for clients such as Disney Mobile, Atari, Electronic Arts, and SearchCore. Steve is currently programming casino games when he’s not working on Cobalt 60 Augmented Reality app!

  Duy Tran - Technical Director
A veteran motion capture engineer, Duy has worked on a wide variety of projects in games and broadcast, for clients such as Epic Games, Fox Television, Paramount Studios, and Oculus. As a co-founder of Nansense Motion Capture, he has been instrumental in making finger and hand mocap a reality!  

  Digger Mesch - Producer
Digger is an American artist, toy sculptor, director, producer and writer. The award winning and controversial New York City artist founded the design house Art Asylum, and created the wildly popular MINIMATES toyline. Digger is also the creator of the recent IDW release of the successful "zombie animal" comic series; THE OTHER DEAD, now being translated for release worldwide.

  Louie Paretta - Audio Producer
An experienced Musician and Sound Designer, and long-time collaborator with Mark, Louie is our Vocal Producer and Recording Engineer, and does many of the secondary character voices in the cartoon, as well.

  Shane Rhein - Animator
A recent Digital Media Arts graduate of Northwestern University, Shane joined Secret File Animation last year, and has been animating characters non-stop ever since.

  Tiffany Chang - Animator
Tiffany is an artist with a background in traditional animation. Having worked on feature film including Insurgent, The Walk, and Goosebumps to name a few, she has gained a new appreciation for the 3D conversion process. When not drawing, she's probably dancing, playing with her pup, or eating tacos.

  Natasha Creger - Mocap Stunt Choreographer / Queen BBC
Natasha is an experienced actress, stunt performer and MMA fighter. On Cobalt 60, she is performing the moves for Queen BBC, as well choreographing all the fight scenes and stunts.

  Gerson Schillpake - Mocap Stunt Performer / Cobalt 60
Gerson is a coach and trainer, as well as a champion Brazilian Muy Thai fighter. He will be performing the moves and stunts for Cobalt 60.

  Hunter Jackson - Mocap Stunt Performer / Loper & Radio Men
One of the founders of GWAR, where he was better known as TECHNO DESTRUCTO, Hunter is an experience stage and stunt performer, and will be performing as the Loper and Radio Man in the Cobalt 60 animated series.


HOW DO I GET YOU TO SHUT UP AND TAKE MY MONEY?

To become a Cobalt 60 backer, just click on the pink BACK IT button at the top of this page, just to the right of our video. IndieGoGo will ask you for your pledge, which reward you want, and how you want to sign up. Signing up is a breeze and you can do it through Facebook if you want. 

IndieGoGo accepts Apple Pay, credit cards, debit cards, and ACH payments drawn directly from contributors’ bank accounts. Sadly, IndieGoGo no longer accepts PayPal.

Please add a link to our IndieGoGo page to your website or blog. Sharing this project with others will go a long way toward getting The Cobalt 60 Chronicles funded. Thanks in advance!



MORE COBALT? HELL, YEAH!

The stretch goals are easy… MORE COBALT!!! We are re-telling the entire 50 year saga in 12x10 animated cartoons, interwoven with the new series of graphic novels. The comic and cartoon are intertwined, I guess is the best way to describe it! Some of the tale will play out in the comic, and then pick back up in the next cartoon episode, with the AR bridging the two!

We are also in development on the first Cobalt 60 video game, using assets directly from the cartoon. The game will be available on iOS, Android, and VR-capable PCs running HTC Vive VR goggles.

When all the episodes are finished, we want to release a hardcover COBALT 60 OMNIBUS COLLECTOR'S EDITION, with a Blu-Ray/Digital Copy of the entire 2-hour cartoon, plus the Video Game, and exclusive Cobalt and Queen BBC statue. 

We have some other fun Bode apps on the horizon, as well… Bode Build-A-Broad app, anyone?

 

RISKS & CHALLENGES

Creating a cartoon pilot and an Augmented Reality graphic novel is a challenge, of course. It has taken us two years to get to this point, and whether we achieve our crowdfunding goal or not, the Cobalt 60 Chronicles will get produced. The real challenge is when. We have been doing this ourselves, slowly and out of pocket, but with great love and dedication, and that won't stop no matter what. Sadly, without funding, it will take years to finish.

The good news is, we are nearly done! We have already lined up the crew for finishing the cartoon, the programming team for the Augmented Reality, and the print shop that is going to knock out the books. We are ready to rock through this final stage. With your help, it will be out this summer!

Our goal is to have everything launch at the San Diego Comic-Con this July. Should we not meet our funding goal, that date will be pushed back, but if we hit our goal, you better believe we are gonna deliver! Plus, all of our rewards are standing by to ship. We will begin shipping immediately upon completion of the campaign.

Our production, printer and shipping partners are secured, our budgets are complete, our shipping supplies are ready, and our manpower is lined up. We just gotta ship and get to work so we can finish in time for San Diego.

And regarding rewards fulfillment, I have an extensive publishing background, and I am proud of of my ship on time (or reasonably on time) record (mostly thanks to Molly!). We will make sure all your rewards are delivered as promised, packed securely. We take every phase of our campaign, including shipping, quite seriously. 


THANK YOU SO MUCH!

I’d like to thank all the fans who have supported me over the years. I love meeting you guys at cons, at one of our showings, or on location when I am blasting the bricks. I’d like to thank all the readers and collectors who have supported me, as well as those newcomers to the Bode Worlds! Welcome aboard! 

 

LEGACY: 50 YEARS OF BODE STYLE

 

Vaughn Bode is touted as the very foundation of the hip hop style you see worldwide. The earliest graffiti writers of the NY city subway lines used our characters besides their groundbreaking pieces that started graffiti and the street art movement. Vaughn created such icons as Cheech Wizard, the Bode Lizard, Bode Broads and of course, Cobalt 60.

My fathers’ light in the adult comics scene burned bright in the 60’s and 70’s and like a comet he was gone off to ball the universe, and inspire tens of thousands of artists, movie makers and graffiti writers from the last 50 years. Vaughn created thousands of worlds populated by his unmistakable style and one of a kind characters. I have vigilantly carried on his vision into the mainstream subconscious of Pop Culture.

Vaughn Bodē first drew the character Cobalt 60 on a piece of scratch paper in 1959. Nearly ten years later, in 1968, he published a ten-page, black-and-white, pen-and-ink Cobalt 60 story for Ken Rudolph's sci-fi fanzine Shangri L'Affaires (a.k.a. Shaggy) #73. The story did not expound much on the character, instead concentrating on action and a thorough depiction of the story's setting.

Bodē wrote a prose follow-up of the story, with pencil illustrations, for Shaggy #74. Bodē won the 1969 Hugo Award for Best Fanzine Artist on the strength of Cobalt 60. In addition, the initial ten-page story was later republished in Witzend #7 (April 1970), in the Franco-Belgian comics magazine Metal Hurlant in 1980, and in Epic Illustrated #27 (Dec. 1984).


 


Cobalt 60-inspired paintings by James O'Barr, Rick Veitch and Larry Todd

 

 

DUST DEVIL: THE COBALT 60 SAGA

 

Cobalt 60 takes place in our post apocalyptic Mad-Max-like future, where man's genius has sterilized our tiny planet, and left a barren wasteland populated with what is left of mankind's dregs… Radio men and women and a plethora of mutant humans and animals deformed by years of exposure to the radioactive desert that is our future.

Cobalt is the heir to the human race. His family is considered the last of the genetic line in which no mutation is present. An evil mutated Prime Minister of Radio City, Strontium 90, assassinated Cobalt’s family in an attempt to wipe out the bloodline. Cobalt’s mother is tipped off before the murderous coup, and casts Cobalt into the desert as a child to be raised by the extradited and outcast mutants… Forced out of Radio City due to Strontium 90’s hatred, bigotry and racism.

Cobalt hides his face, concealing his identity with a hood, and strikes out against his own people to protect and defend his mutant brethren who raised him.

In the last comic, Cobalt was captured after an unprecedented blood bath of violence and carnage. Exposed and de-hooded, it was revealed that he was indeed the long-lost heir to the throne, much to the celebration of the Radio people. Yet, Cobalt was a terrible king... and felt strapped to the throne of the people he hates.

That’s where the new comic starts. This the first Cobalt 60 comic I have published in over 20 years, and the first ever Cobalt 60 animation ever created. This will be the 6th graphic novel in the series, an 80-page story of Cobalt after he bares an heir with Queen BBC and escapes his bondage back into the desert.

 

WHAT THE F.A.Q.?


Shipping Policy:

Free domestic (US) shipping. Worldwide shipping at a nominal charge, listed by item. Shipping charges may vary on unique items, if you have any shipping related questions, hit us at: cobalt60bybode@gmail.com

Upcoming Bode Appearances:

Angoulême International Comics Festival
Angoulême, France - January 26-29
Big Apple Comic-Con
New York, NY - March 11-12
Silicon Valley Comic-Con
San Jose, CA - April 21-23
San Diego Comic-Con
San Diego, CA - July 19-23

Will Bode sign my Reward?
Yes! Most of the rewards can be custom signed by Bode , and he'll be glad to dedicate it to whoever you choose.

Can I add other Reward Items to my existing pledge?
Yes! You can add any other Reward Item in addition to your pledge item at the time you make your pledge, or add another pledge later. Or, write us directly: cobalt60bybode@gmail.com

The reward I wanted to pledge for is no longer available. Help!
There are a limited number of many of our Reward Items, and some are one-of-a-kind. When they are gone, they are gone. However, we will be adding some very rare new items during the campaign, so be on the lookout!

When will I receive my backer survey?
In April, 2017.

When will my rewards ship?
We will begin shipping most items immediately when the campaign ends. Our plan is to have everything out the door and on the truck by the end of April, 2017. Please make sure your shipping info is correct! Some items will ship after production is complete. See individual items for estimated delivery.

Does Mark ever sleep?
Near the end of last year, Mark developed a slight case of vampyrism, and is now nocturnal.

Independence. This project is near and dear to my heart. We are going to bring Cobalt out the exactly the way it’s supposed to be... Raw... Hard... the way my Dad imagined him. I’m crowdfunding this because it’s an incredible opportunity to connect with you, the fans. You get it. The Cobalt 60 Chronicles is an over-the-top, no-holds-barred tribute to Bode fans old and new.

HOW MUCH ASS WILL COBALT 60 KICK?
In 1967, Cobalt 60 was one of the first comics ever to feature ultra-violence, sex and a bleak look at our future, years ahead of influencing the films by George Miller, Ralph Bakshi, and Roger Corman and thousands of artists worldwide. In 2017, we are going to bring it even harder… More carnage... More sex and lust… More betrayal… More mutants… All brought to life with modern animation techniques, including motion capture and photogrammetry.
PLUS... It’s Cobalt’s 50th Anniversary, so we’ve lined up lots of cool rewards exclusive to this campaign.  We have terrific print sets, truly collectible comics, blasts from the past and other surprises from the Bode archives... Many of them very limited. All of them are authentically rare, and all signed by Bode!

OUR REWARDS!
Think of your pledge as a pre-purchase. We’ve put together a bunch of rewards that we hope you'll love. And any of our rewards make a great gift for the Bode fan in your fam-bam! Check ‘em out! All rewards include FREE domestic (US) shipping! A nominal charge applies to rewards shipped outside of the US.

 
FAN FUND THE COBALT 60 CHRONICLES!
This is your chance to influence the kind of kick ass, take-no-prisoners Cobalt stories you wanna see. I want you to be our financiers. In return, we’ll make a cartoon and graphic novel that we can all be proud of. We believe fan funding is the best way to bring the Cobalt 60 Chronicles to life. This has been a long train coming, and if it wasn't for you, the fans, we would never have made it this far. Now, we need your help to get up this hill!All of the assets have been built for the cartoon, and I have completed 65 of the 80 pages for the graphic novel. We already lined up the crew for finishing the cartoon pilot, the programming team for the Augmented Reality, and the print shop that is going to knock out the books. We are ready to rock through this final stage! We will start shipping rewards immediately upon completion of the campaign.  Thank you so much for helping to make this happen. Please pledge now! If you can’t, that’s cool... But, maybe you can help by sharing on Facebook and Instagram? Got a Bode fan in your life? Let ‘em know! Every little bit helps!

WHERE WILL THE MONEY GO?
Every penny raised will go towards making the Cobalt 60 Chronicles a reality. This covers everything... The creative talent, CGI team, stunt and voice performers, Augmented Reality programmers, printing services, supplies, fees and taxes. In other words, everything that it takes to make this happen in time for San Diego Comic-Con this July. We are calling in all our favors, and every one of our talented crew is willing to do whatever it takes to make this happen. This year. Now.
A portion of the money will go to fulfilling all the cool rewards we are offering and a percentage will go to taxes and IndieGoGo fees. Anything over our goal will go towards funding future Cobalt 60 related projects... See our Stretch Goals, below!


MEET THE TEAM!
  Mark & Molly Bode - Creator & Executive Producers Mark Bodé is an American cartoonist. The son of underground comics legend Vaughn Bodé, Mark often produces works similar to the elder Bodé’s style. He is best known for his work on Cobalt-60, Miami Mice, and The Lizard of Oz. Bodé has also worked for Heavy Metal magazine and on The Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles. He is also a tattooist, and paints murals all over the world.
Molly Bode is a veteran Producer & Project Coordinator, and has handled the art licensing for the TMNT characters and the Bode work. She also has experience in special event production. Molly is the glue that has kept the Bode Estate up and running for all these years.
  Mark Butler - Animation Director & Mad ScientistMark is a veteran character animator, technical director, and motion capture specialist. Mark was a part of the Emmy-award winning animation team on NBC’s “Heroes”, and he has worked on a wide variety of games, broadcast TV, and live events, for clients such as DC Comics, Atari, Warner Bros., Disney and Sony. Can also draw funny rabbits.
  Ollie Teeba - Music & Sound DesignOllie has been Djing Hip Hop, Funk, Soul and everything that falls in between since his teens. With 7 albums of original material and 2 ‘live session’ albums Ollie made the very well regarded DJ mix albums Fabric 26 and Herbal Blend for Solid Steel. Also Ollie’s ‘War of the Worlds’ DJ re-score was voted amongst the top 10 best mix sessions in the 25th anniversary of Solid Steel radio show.
  Jonny Cuba - Music & Sound DesignAfter meeting on college radio in the late 80's, Jonny Cuba & the Loop Professor realised they had similar tastes in hip-hop, films and all things funky, and formed DSP. Jonny Cuba has also co-produced material for The Herbaliser, and he also collaborates with Ollie Teeba as production team 'The Process'. He has had music featured on TV and in video games; EA's Knockout Kings , NBA Street & SEGA Extreme Sports. Heavy beats & tight, quotable rhymes are what Jonny is all about.
  Steve Chang - ProgrammingSteve’s been involved with many video game productions over the years, for clients such as Disney Mobile, Atari, Electronic Arts, and SearchCore. Steve is currently programming casino games when he’s not working on Cobalt 60 Augmented Reality app!
  Duy Tran - Technical DirectorA veteran motion capture engineer, Duy has worked on a wide variety of projects in games and broadcast, for clients such as Epic Games, Fox Television, Paramount Studios, and Oculus. As a co-founder of Nansense Motion Capture, he has been instrumental in making finger and hand mocap a reality!  
  Digger Mesch - ProducerDigger is an American artist, toy sculptor, director, producer and writer. The award winning and controversial New York City artist founded the design house Art Asylum, and created the wildly popular MINIMATES toyline. Digger is also the creator of the recent IDW release of the successful "zombie animal" comic series; THE OTHER DEAD, now being translated for release worldwide.
  Louie Paretta - Audio ProducerAn experienced Musician and Sound Designer, and long-time collaborator with Mark, Louie is our Vocal Producer and Recording Engineer, and does many of the secondary character voices in the cartoon, as well.
  Shane Rhein - AnimatorA recent Digital Media Arts graduate of Northwestern University, Shane joined Secret File Animation last year, and has been animating characters non-stop ever since.
  Tiffany Chang - AnimatorTiffany is an artist with a background in traditional animation. Having worked on feature film including Insurgent, The Walk, and Goosebumps to name a few, she has gained a new appreciation for the 3D conversion process. When not drawing, she's probably dancing, playing with her pup, or eating tacos.
  Natasha Creger - Mocap Stunt Choreographer / Queen BBCNatasha is an experienced actress, stunt performer and MMA fighter. On Cobalt 60, she is performing the moves for Queen BBC, as well choreographing all the fight scenes and stunts.
  Gerson Schillpake - Mocap Stunt Performer / Cobalt 60Gerson is a coach and trainer, as well as a champion Brazilian Muy Thai fighter. He will be performing the moves and stunts for Cobalt 60.
  Hunter Jackson - Mocap Stunt Performer / Loper & Radio MenOne of the founders of GWAR, where he was better known as TECHNO DESTRUCTO, Hunter is an experience stage and stunt performer, and will be performing as the Loper and Radio Man in the Cobalt 60 animated series.


HOW DO I GET YOU TO SHUT UP AND TAKE MY MONEY?
To become a Cobalt 60 backer, just click on the pink BACK IT button at the top of this page, just to the right of our video. IndieGoGo will ask you for your pledge, which reward you want, and how you want to sign up. Signing up is a breeze and you can do it through Facebook if you want. 
IndieGoGo accepts Apple Pay, credit cards, debit cards, and ACH payments drawn directly from contributors’ bank accounts. Sadly, IndieGoGo no longer accepts PayPal.
Please add a link to our IndieGoGo page to your website or blog. Sharing this project with others will go a long way toward getting The Cobalt 60 Chronicles funded. Thanks in advance!


MORE COBALT? HELL, YEAH!
The stretch goals are easy… MORE COBALT!!! We are re-telling the entire 50 year saga in 12x10 animated cartoons, interwoven with the new series of graphic novels. The comic and cartoon are intertwined, I guess is the best way to describe it! Some of the tale will play out in the comic, and then pick back up in the next cartoon episode, with the AR bridging the two!
We are also in development on the first Cobalt 60 video game, using assets directly from the cartoon. The game will be available on iOS, Android, and VR-capable PCs running HTC Vive VR goggles.
When all the episodes are finished, we want to release a hardcover COBALT 60 OMNIBUS COLLECTOR'S EDITION, with a Blu-Ray/Digital Copy of the entire 2-hour cartoon, plus the Video Game, and exclusive Cobalt and Queen BBC statue. 
We have some other fun Bode apps on the horizon, as well… Bode Build-A-Broad app, anyone?

 
RISKS & CHALLENGES
Creating a cartoon pilot and an Augmented Reality graphic novel is a challenge, of course. It has taken us two years to get to this point, and whether we achieve our crowdfunding goal or not, the Cobalt 60 Chronicles will get produced. The real challenge is when. We have been doing this ourselves, slowly and out of pocket, but with great love and dedication, and that won't stop no matter what. Sadly, without funding, it will take years to finish.
The good news is, we are nearly done! We have already lined up the crew for finishing the cartoon, the programming team for the Augmented Reality, and the print shop that is going to knock out the books. We are ready to rock through this final stage. With your help, it will be out this summer!
Our goal is to have everything launch at the San Diego Comic-Con this July. Should we not meet our funding goal, that date will be pushed back, but if we hit our goal, you better believe we are gonna deliver! Plus, all of our rewards are standing by to ship. We will begin shipping immediately upon completion of the campaign.
Our production, printer and shipping partners are secured, our budgets are complete, our shipping supplies are ready, and our manpower is lined up. We just gotta ship and get to work so we can finish in time for San Diego.
And regarding rewards fulfillment, I have an extensive publishing background, and I am proud of of my ship on time (or reasonably on time) record (mostly thanks to Molly!). We will make sure all your rewards are delivered as promised, packed securely. We take every phase of our campaign, including shipping, quite seriously. 

THANK YOU SO MUCH!
I’d like to thank all the fans who have supported me over the years. I love meeting you guys at cons, at one of our showings, or on location when I am blasting the bricks. I’d like to thank all the readers and collectors who have supported me, as well as those newcomers to the Bode Worlds! Welcome aboard! 
 
LEGACY: 50 YEARS OF BODE STYLE
 
Vaughn Bode is touted as the very foundation of the hip hop style you see worldwide. The earliest graffiti writers of the NY city subway lines used our characters besides their groundbreaking pieces that started graffiti and the street art movement. Vaughn created such icons as Cheech Wizard, the Bode Lizard, Bode Broads and of course, Cobalt 60.


My fathers’ light in the adult comics scene burned bright in the 60’s and 70’s and like a comet he was gone off to ball the universe, and inspire tens of thousands of artists, movie makers and graffiti writers from the last 50 years. Vaughn created thousands of worlds populated by his unmistakable style and one of a kind characters. I have vigilantly carried on his vision into the mainstream subconscious of Pop Culture.


Vaughn Bodē first drew the character Cobalt 60 on a piece of scratch paper in 1959. Nearly ten years later, in 1968, he published a ten-page, black-and-white, pen-and-ink Cobalt 60 story for Ken Rudolph's sci-fi fanzine Shangri L'Affaires (a.k.a. Shaggy) #73. The story did not expound much on the character, instead concentrating on action and a thorough depiction of the story's setting.
Bodē wrote a prose follow-up of the story, with pencil illustrations, for Shaggy #74. Bodē won the 1969 Hugo Award for Best Fanzine Artist on the strength of Cobalt 60. In addition, the initial ten-page story was later republished in Witzend #7 (April 1970), in the Franco-Belgian comics magazine Metal Hurlant in 1980, and in Epic Illustrated #27 (Dec. 1984).
 
Cobalt 60-inspired paintings by James O'Barr, Rick Veitch and Larry Todd
 
 
DUST DEVIL: THE COBALT 60 SAGA
 
Cobalt 60 takes place in our post apocalyptic Mad-Max-like future, where man's genius has sterilized our tiny planet, and left a barren wasteland populated with what is left of mankind's dregs… Radio men and women and a plethora of mutant humans and animals deformed by years of exposure to the radioactive desert that is our future.

Cobalt is the heir to the human race. His family is considered the last of the genetic line in which no mutation is present. An evil mutated Prime Minister of Radio City, Strontium 90, assassinated Cobalt’s family in an attempt to wipe out the bloodline. Cobalt’s mother is tipped off before the murderous coup, and casts Cobalt into the desert as a child to be raised by the extradited and outcast mutants… Forced out of Radio City due to Strontium 90’s hatred, bigotry and racism.
Cobalt hides his face, concealing his identity with a hood, and strikes out against his own people to protect and defend his mutant brethren who raised him.
In the last comic, Cobalt was captured after an unprecedented blood bath of violence and carnage. Exposed and de-hooded, it was revealed that he was indeed the long-lost heir to the throne, much to the celebration of the Radio people. Yet, Cobalt was a terrible king... and felt strapped to the throne of the people he hates.

That’s where the new comic starts. This the first Cobalt 60 comic I have published in over 20 years, and the first ever Cobalt 60 animation ever created. This will be the 6th graphic novel in the series, an 80-page story of Cobalt after he bares an heir with Queen BBC and escapes his bondage back into the desert.


 
WHAT THE F.A.Q.?

Shipping Policy:

Free domestic (US) shipping. Worldwide shipping at a nominal charge, listed by item. Shipping charges may vary on unique items, if you have any shipping related questions, hit us at: cobalt60bybode@gmail.com
Upcoming Bode Appearances:Angoulême International Comics FestivalAngoulême, France - January 26-29Big Apple Comic-ConNew York, NY - March 11-12Silicon Valley Comic-ConSan Jose, CA - April 21-23San Diego Comic-ConSan Diego, CA - July 19-23
Will Bode sign my Reward?Yes! Most of the rewards can be custom signed by Bode , and he'll be glad to dedicate it to whoever you choose.
Can I add other Reward Items to my existing pledge?Yes! You can add any other Reward Item in addition to your pledge item at the time you make your pledge, or add another pledge later. Or, write us directly: cobalt60bybode@gmail.com
The reward I wanted to pledge for is no longer available. Help!There are a limited number of many of our Reward Items, and some are one-of-a-kind. When they are gone, they are gone. However, we will be adding some very rare new items during the campaign, so be on the lookout!
When will I receive my backer survey?In April, 2017.
When will my rewards ship?We will begin shipping most items immediately when the campaign ends. Our plan is to have everything out the door and on the truck by the end of April, 2017. Please make sure your shipping info is correct! Some items will ship after production is complete. See individual items for estimated delivery.
Does Mark ever sleep?Near the end of last year, Mark developed a slight case of vampyrism, and is now nocturnal.

story:
What is Thought Bubble Comics?

TBC is a manifestation of a dream by three long-time friends designed to function as a worker cooperative. It will be a comic book shop located in Union City, NJ.

What are you trying to accomplish?

Thought Bubble Comics (TBC) will be opening a comic shop in Union City, NJ in Spring 2017! We need your help to make our brick and mortar dreams a success. We want to build our shop to become a community staple and foster a relationship with the residents in the area.

We’ve noticed there aren’t many places where people can gather, socialize, read books and play games. As parents and residents ourselves, we wanted to create a place where they can have access to geek and pop culture.

We are comic book enthusiasts and want to encourage the imaginations and creativity of the neighborhood children. We plan to offer the following free or low-cost events in our shop:

  • art classes
  • access to 3D printing 
  • board game nights
  • movie nights
  • costume/cosplay events
  • and a myriad of other engaging activities!

TBC will also encourage academic achievement in the local students by offering a rewards program based on their grades and award them with free comic books when they reach certain tiers.

Where is your money going?

With your contribution we can make the brick and mortar dream a successful reality. The funding amount is a fraction of what we need to build the store to its full potential, we will be putting up the rest of the funding from our own resources.

Your donation will help us to cover the costs of our space rental, fixtures, board games and art supplies for the children. We look forward to reaching and even possibly surpassing our goal with your support. In the event that we surpass our goal, the extra funds will be used to cover additional supplies for the classes we offer.

Your contribution, no matter how small will help us provide the epic space for many people to enjoy comic books in their full glory!

What do I get?

We have a variety of perks available, from free comics to discount coupons to our shop. Even handmade one of a kind sets of coasters made by Soap + Ink are availeble as well as a ticket to the Heroes and Villains Fan Fest in Secaucus run by Stephen Amell (CW's Arrow) !

I can’t donate but I want to help!

We are extremely grateful that you want to help! Please share this with your friends and family to spread the word!

Please visit our store, we will announce the date of our grand opening and hope to see you there!

We can’t wait to share this journey of ours with you. Thank you from TBC !

story:
The Story

Three world champion MMA fighters must stop an escaped criminal from destroying their city.

 

 

The Team Behind "CAGEFIGHTERS FROM THE ROCK"

 

Mike Radich - Creator & Writer 

Mike Radich is a lifelong comic book fan and a 9-year veteran of the Mixed Martial Arts (MMA) media. Mike has interviewed some of the biggest names in the sport through his podcast "Really Random with Radich". Now, Mike unifies his love for MMA and his love for comic books in “CAGEFIGHTERS FROM THE ROCK”.

 

Martín Cóccolo - Artist 

Martín Cóccolo developed an early interest in art, especially in comics. After years of assisting artists and training, he decided to pursue a career of his own in the comic Industry. Starting on small, virtually unknown independent publishers, he managed to forge himself a path that would eventually lead him to work for APE Entertainment's "Helldorado", a work for which he was nominated for the prestigious Russ Manning Award for the most promising newcomer. He would then go on to work on IDW's "Magic: The Gathering" for many issues before being recruited by DC entertainment to work on Green Lantern and Sinestro alternatively.

 

 

The Perks And Giveaways

 

 

Are you wondering where our sample pages are? They are not ready yet because...

 

 

That's right, we want you as a character in our story! Just $100 USD gets you into the comic book. Take a look below at all our other perks for backing this project.

 

$100+ "The Main Event" Perk gets you:

* You will be a character in “CAGEFIGHTERS FROM THE ROCK”. We will draw you into one of the 12 issues of our story. (Depending on who you are in the story, you may appear multiple times during the series) [300 spots available for this perk]

* A single print copy of “CAGEFIGHTERS FROM THE ROCK” #1 (28 full color pages of story).  

* A Digital copy of all 12 issues of the series. 

* Your name in the "Thank You" section inside all 12 issues of the series. 

* The exclusive first look at the cover and first 4-page preview will be emailed to you.

 

$25+ "The Co-Main Event" Perk gets you:

* A character or place in “CAGEFIGHTERS FROM THE ROCK” named after you. Your first, last or both names will be given to a character or place in our story. [50 spots available for this perk]

* A single print copy of “CAGEFIGHTERS FROM THE ROCK” #1 (28 full color pages of story). Also, Digital copy available upon request. 

* Your name in the "Thank You" section inside all 12 issues of the series. 

* The exclusive first look at the cover and first 4-page preview will be emailed to you.

 

$5+ "The Under Card" Perk gets you:

* A single print copy of “CAGEFIGHTERS FROM THE ROCK” #1 (28 full color pages of story). Also, Digital copy available upon request. 

* Your name in the "Thank You" section inside all 12 issues of the series. 

* The exclusive first look at the cover and first 4-page preview will be emailed to you.

 

$1 "11th Hour Sale" Perk gets you:

Time is running out, and we need your help to bring "Cagefighters from the Rock" to life! During this sale you can get “CAGEFIGHTERS FROM THE ROCK” #1 (28 full color pages of story) for just $1. 

 

* A PDF file of “CAGEFIGHTERS FROM THE ROCK” #1 (28 pages of story). 

* The exclusive first look at the cover and first 4-page preview will be emailed to you

* Your name in the "Thank You" section inside all 12 issues of the series.

 

 

Stretch Goals

$15,000+ GOAL- All backers will receive their purchased copies of “CAGEFIGHTERS FROM THE ROCK” #1. Some of the backers at the $25 level will have a character or place named after them. Some of the backers at the $100 level will be characters in the story. 

$140,000 STRETCH GOAL - We will be fully funded! All 12 issue will be produced. All backers will receive their purchased copies of “CAGEFIGHTERS FROM THE ROCK” #1. All backers at the $25 level will have a character or place named after them. All backers at the $100 level will be characters in the story. 

 
 
 
 
Like us on Facebook for updates:
https://www.facebook.com/cagefighterscomic
 
 
 
 
 
We'll be posting more artwork as this campaign moves forward.
 
Thank you for your support, you have our sincerest gratitude.
