All 12 issue will be produced. All backers will receive their purchased copies of “CAGEFIGHTERS FROM THE ROCK” #1. All backers at the $25 level will have a character or place named after them. All backers at the $100 level will be characters in the story. 

   
 
Like us on Facebook for updates:https://www.facebook.com/cagefighterscomic

 
 
 
 
 
We'll be posting more artwork as this campaign moves forward.
 
Thank you for your support, you have our sincerest gratitude.

story:
Who We Are

Cirsova Publishing is an acclaimed publisher of science fiction and fantasy adventure whose flagship publication, Cirsova Magazine was a 2017 Hugo Awards finalist for Best Semi-Pro Zine.

Cirsova has published a dozen issues since 2016 and in 2019 published Duel Visions, an anthology of weird fiction by Misha Burnett and Louise Sorensen, and an illustrated edition of Leigh Brackett's Eric John Stark stories to celebrate the 70th Anniversary of Queen of the Martian Catacombs appearing in Planet Stories Magazine.

Michael Tierney has been involved in comics and the publishing industry since the 70s. Owner and proprietor of both The Comic Book Store and Collector's Edition, Michael was a Finalist for both the Star*Reach Comics Retailer of the Year Award in 1985 and the Will Eisner Spirit of the Comics Retailer of the Year Award in 1999, has been an Overstreet Comic Book Price Guide Advisor since the 1990s, and is a staple of Central Arkansas' comic scene.  A former journeyman printer and printing division manager, he's written, published, and at times even penciled, inked, and printed his own comics. He is currently writing, lettering, and coloring Edgar Rice Burroughs® Beyond the Farthest StarTM. His best-selling four volume Edgar Rice Burroughs 100 Year Art Chronology published by Chenault & Gray was released in 2018. Michael has been a regular contributor to Cirsova Heroic Fantasy and Science Fiction Magazine and recently published "Young Tarzan and the Mysterious She" expanded from a previously "lost" fragment by Edgar Rice Burroughs in the new Cirsova Magazine of Thrilling Adventure and Daring Suspense.

Michael Tierney's Wild Stars has been the work of a life-time. Michael has spent years telling the sprawling story of the galactic exodus of the first space-faring race of men before the dawn of history as we know it. He has expanded his world across zines, comic books and novels over the decades. Since 2018, however, the Wild Stars universe is in high gear, first with last year's publication of Wild Stars III: Time Warmageddon and now with Wild Stars IV: Wild Stars Rising.

Tierney revisits the roots of the Wild Stars universe while at the same time growing it in this new adventure that takes us back to the fall of Atlantis and the final exodus to the stars 75,000 years ago and to the future where immortals battle on the fringe of a galaxy-destroying black hole!

35th Anniversary Editions of Wild Stars

Cirsova Publishing is creating an all new standard edition of all previous Wild Stars books that will match the new release, Wild Star Rising.

Wild Stars: Book of Circles collects the early comics, Erlik (WS Vo1 1 #1) and First Marker (WS Vol 2 #1), placed chronologically within the 2001-2002 run of Wild Stars comics (WS Vol 3 #1-7)

Book of Circles tells the story of conflicting timelines and parallel worlds that culminate an alliance between a wolf-like alien race called the Brothan and alternate time-line fascists, the Artomiques, that aims to attack and destroy the earth by launching a comet at Jupiter to ignite it as a second sun. 

These comics feature artwork by Frank Brunner (Doctor Strange, Howard the Duck), David Brewer (Cable, Deadpool), Dave Simons (Ghost Rider), and Michael Tierney, plus the collected editions feature additional painted works by Mary Tierney. 

This new edition of the almost 300 page graphic novel will be printed in Cirsova Magazine's standard 8.5" x 11" format, and will fit nicely on the shelf between your collection of Cirsovas and the rest of the 35th Anniversary Wild Stars books.

Wild Stars II: Force Majeure wraps an 83,000 word novel around 38 pages of comics penciled by Armando Gil (Conan the King, Ka-Zar the Savage), along with 50 'flashback' illustrations by Dave Simons.

Seeking revenge for his defeat, Carthage kidnaps the First Marker's infant daughter and absconds with her through time! Erlik and Daestar aid Mark Mackavicka and Akara in their search through time for their missing daughter. Except to preserve the future and prevent a resurgence of the Brothan empire, they can't rescue Mark and Akara's daughter until she's already a grown woman!

This new edition of the novel / comic hybrid will be printed in Cirsova Magazine's standard 8.5" x 11" format.

 

Wild Stars III: Time Warmageddon continues the saga of the Wild Stars as former-President Bully Bravo seeks to solve the mysteries of distant suns going missing, only to be replaced by white dwarfs, and newly discovered planets showing the apparent signs of previous human colonization, all while pursued by an evil pirate queen and a rogue time-traveler trying to create a god.

This novella featured cover art by Timothy Lim (My Hero Magademia, Black Hops: USA GI, Street Fighter), and interior illustrations  and two variant covers by Mark Wheatley (Song of Giants: the Poetry of Pulp, The Flash, Blood of the Innocent).

This new edition will reprint this one-time Kickstarter-exclusive edition with new bonus content, including an additional epilogue on the whereabouts of Akara and the First Marker, two stories by Michael Tierney originally published in Cirsova Magazine, and the previously unpublished Wild Stars story, The Grimgrip.

Wild Stars IV: Wild Star Rising is both a prequel and sequel to the previous Wild Stars adventures. Looking back 75,000 years into the past to the last days of Atlantis and the final exodus to the Wild Stars led by the Ancient Warrior, Wild Star Rising unfolds the aeons-long plan to rescue the Ancient Warrior's long-lost beloved, Phaedra, from the heart of a black hole where she was imprisoned by another powerful immortal... A sailor from earth's distant past must join with the Ancient Warrior's Wild Stars companions to help them navigate the great gulfs of space, free Phaedra from her black-hole prison, and stop the extra-dimensional squids that could destroy the universe if they can meet up and mate!

This illustrated novel will be printed in Cirsova Magazine's 8.5" x 11" format, matching the previously released Time Warmageddon, the new 35th Anniversary Editions of Book of Circles and Force Majeure, and your collection of Cirsovas! 

This edition will also contain the first-ever extensive bio-glossary of Wild Stars universe, making it a must-have for old and new fans alike!

Why Crowdfund?

This Wild Stars 35th Anniversary Edition Set is a HUGE project. We need to raise money for proofs, and to pay our artists to make sure that this can happen!

In today's age of event-releases, it's important to create buzz for new titles. It's not just enough to have a title ready, printed, and dropped live on Amazon. Crowdfunding methods like IndieGoGo and Kickstarter are an integral part of getting the word out about new releases these days.

While we've used Kickstarter in the past to drum up support for the magazine and sell something akin to subscriptions, changes to the POD industry made it a less-than-viable option to sell Cirsova. 

In the case of a big project like Wild Stars, however, an IndieGoGo lets us offer several perks ala carte without having to create crazy tiers for combinations of items the way we would through Kickstarter.

In addition to getting Wild Stars Rising ready to go, we're doing additional edits on the new editions of Time Warmageddon and Force Majeure, plus enlarging over 300 pages of comics to create matching editions.

Plus, we'll be getting new art from the incredibly talented Mark Wheatley that will need to be laid out, for interiors and covers, and doing new layouts for old covers... It's a lot of work!

Risks & Challenges

As I said, this project is HUGE! 

Cirsova Publishing has typically prided itself on having everything ready to go and deliver as soon as the money clears, but with a project this big, we don't want to bite off more than we can chew, so we're giving ourselves a bit of lead-time to finish up.

When Wild Stars III shipped, we turned Michael's comic store into a fulfillment office, and over the course of 7 grueling hours, stuffed nearly 100 boxes with dozens of books, comics, zines, art prints, etc. It was exhausting! And our goal is gonna put us at sending out way more books than that, if we can help it!

A lot of the work is already done. Things are being laid out and finalized, with a few tweaks here and there and just a bit more work to do. What we really need is help to pay for it to make sure that we can keep doing awesome stuff like this! Money from this crowdfund will go towards the finishing touches, proof costs, and defraying art expense.

This time, we are also not offering shipping outside of the US. The sad reality is that with media mail rates, shipping costs jump from a couple bucks for domestic to anywhere from $30 to $60 for outside the US, and we don't want to be caught with our pants down because we guessed wrong on shipping costs.  We do care about our overseas fans and supporters, though, and want to make these items available to you! Unlike the 1st Edition of Time Warmageddon, we plan on keeping these in print and made available through normal distribution channels via Ingram Content or something along those lines. For anything else, hit us up after the crowdfund ends and we will try to work out an accurate quote on shipping and hook you up!

Stretch Goals, Freebies, & Add-Ons

 

Free For All!

We will be throwing in a couple of free Wild Stars stickers, featuring art by Frank Brunner.

$1500 - 2001-2002 Wild Stars Comics [add-on/$20 for set]

We still have a limited supply of Wild Stars Vol. 3 #s 1-7, with gorgeous full-color covers by Frank Brunner and interior art by  David Brewer and Dave Simons.

 $2000 - Erlik and First Marker [add-on/$10 each]

The comics that started it all, introducing the world to Erlik, the immortal son of the Ancient Warrior, and his battle against the traitor Carthage and the evil wolf-like aliens, the Brothan, and to Mark Mackavicka, the first modern man chosen to represent the people of Earth to the Wild Stars since their exodus 75,000 years in the past. 

$3000 - Wild Stars III Tim Lim Cover First Edition [Add-on]

The first printing of Wild Stars III: Time Warmageddon was a one-and-done. We printed enough copies for Kickstarter backers and a handful for Michael's stores. If you missed the Kickstarter but want to get your hands on a 1st printing of Time Warmageddon, you're in luck: Michael will make the small supply of these available for IndieGoGo backers.

$4000 - Wild Stars III Mark Wheatley Variant Cover First Edition [Add-on]

We will make the remaining supply of Wild Stars III with the giant spider boat variant covers available as an add-on.

$5000 - Wild Stars III Mark Wheatley Hard Cover [Add-on]

We will make the remaining supply of Wild Stars III hardcovers with the space squid virgin cover available as an add-on.

$6000 - Wild Stars 2002 Bonus Promo Poster [Free While Supplies Last!]

We will include a Wild Stars 2002 promo poster for Force Majeure free with your books while supplies last! Only 2000 of these were printed for distribution to retailers. So the ones that Michael saved and is giving away now may be the only surviving copies of this rarest of Wild Stars artifacts.

$7000 - Wild Stars III Red Grief Signed Art Print [Free While Supplies Last!]

We will offer a limited number of 4-color Mark Wheatley art prints of The Red Grief. These will be limited to 100 numbered prints; 80 of each will be available to IndieGoGo backers, while 20 of each will be held back for overseas fans. These will be included free with your books while supplies last!

$8000 - Wild Stars III Battle Signed Art Print [Free While Supplies Last!]

We will offer a limited number of 4-color Mark Wheatley art prints of the Battle of the Time Travelers. These will be limited to 100 numbered prints; 80 of each will be available to IndieGoGo backers, while 20 of each will be held back for overseas fans. These will be included free with your books!

$???? - The Multiversal Scribe

This self-published science fiction zine from the 70s includes original artwork and short fiction from Michael Tierney, including some of what would eventually find its way into the Wild Stars universe.

 

Retailer Orders

For interested retailers and resalers, we're offering discounts on bundles of 10 of each 35th Anniversary Edition book. 40% off SRP + free shipping & handling. 

 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Be sure to spread the word about Wild Stars! Tell your neighbor, tell your friend!
story_txt:
Who We Are
Cirsova Publishing is an acclaimed publisher of science fiction and fantasy adventure whose flagship publication, Cirsova Magazine was a 2017 Hugo Awards finalist for Best Semi-Pro Zine.
Cirsova has published a dozen issues since 2016 and in 2019 published Duel Visions, an anthology of weird fiction by Misha Burnett and Louise Sorensen, and an illustrated edition of Leigh Brackett's Eric John Stark stories to celebrate the 70th Anniversary of Queen of the Martian Catacombs appearing in Planet Stories Magazine.
Michael Tierney has been involved in comics and the publishing industry since the 70s. Owner and proprietor of both The Comic Book Store and Collector's Edition, Michael was a Finalist for both the Star*Reach Comics Retailer of the Year Award in 1985 and the Will Eisner Spirit of the Comics Retailer of the Year Award in 1999, has been an Overstreet Comic Book Price Guide Advisor since the 1990s, and is a staple of Central Arkansas' comic scene.  A former journeyman printer and printing division manager, he's written, published, and at times even penciled, inked, and printed his own comics. He is currently writing, lettering, and coloring Edgar Rice Burroughs® Beyond the Farthest StarTM. His best-selling four volume Edgar Rice Burroughs 100 Year Art Chronology published by Chenault & Gray was released in 2018. Michael has been a regular contributor to Cirsova Heroic Fantasy and Science Fiction Magazine and recently published "Young Tarzan and the Mysterious She" expanded from a previously "lost" fragment by Edgar Rice Burroughs in the new Cirsova Magazine of Thrilling Adventure and Daring Suspense.

story:
Short Summary


[Leah Morris in her tunnel-home]

The Rains of Ganymede is primarily a character driven science fiction story with elements of the western outlaw, action and heist stories. It is also a goal of mine to include natural, but depthful world-building to immerse the readers into the world our characters live and breath in. 

Over seven thousand years into the future the human race has survived and thrived, ultimately spreading throughout the solar system and harnessing its power. Planets have been terraformed, and in the most extreme of cases, shifted in their orbits making them ideal for human habitation. Earth was mostly vacated 6000 years ago in 'The Great Migration', left to recover from the early scars of humanity.

 There are massive sprawling space-stations above Jupiter that house malls, casinos and the greatest attractions to be seen in the new age, and beautiful floating cities in the clouds of Venus. 

But there are always things less than glamorous to be found:


[Orion and Mr. Matthews]

Ganymede, one of the moons of Jupiter, has become the hub of all of the criminals in the galaxy. A massive prison-moon comprised of five major sections: Two separate bases built for housing soldiers and higher ranking personnel, a prison complex known as 'the Blocks' that sits on top of massive underground mining operation, a max security colony built underground and a massive city for 'freed' prisoners known as 'the Parole Zone'. Everybody whose sentence in the blocks comes to an end makes their way to the parole zone, but from there they can never leave. Instead you live out your life, working and earning enough to get by under the guise of freedom.
Our story follows Leah Morris, a girl born outside of the prison who was brought in at a young age on account of her parent's crimes. At the first opportunity her mother left the blocks for the parole zone, leaving her family behind. Her father who had been forced to work in the mines eventually succumbed to a poisoned lung leaving Leah alone. Before she could be taken and put into general prison populous she escaped with barely more than the clothes on her back.

Stealing away into the sewers of the prison complex, she came upon a small group of others who suffered a similar fate as her. There she found the semblance of a family, but it never filled what Leah was missing.

Here she spent the next several years of her life, growing in age as much as she was growing in restlessness. Her resentment grew as well, for the people that imprisoned her as an innocent child, forced her father to poison himself and reduced her to a squatter in the sewers.

She grew to be more isolated as she aged, her mind set on further places and things.

They had always labeled her a criminal; now she wanted to show them what that truly meant. 

The Rains of Ganymede will follow Leah and a group of innocent, and less than innocent people, all trying to find their way to a life of freedom. They plan to pull a heist to get off the moon, or die trying.

 There are themes of the want for youth rebellion and the consequences of that, with a focus on strong characters and elaborately designed cities and worlds that evoke the feeling of a living and breathing universe. 

What We Need 

[Leah Morris and her late father Leon Morris]

My goal for this campaign is $1000. I have started the comic as I have stock left over from other projects I've done, but I am running low and the supplies are expensive. The cover isn't done as I'm missing the supplies I need.

I'm looking specifically for funding to help cover the cost of: Art supplies, the lettering cost and the printing cost. The shipping cost has been added to the indiegogo. If there is any money left over, or in the event the campaign exceeds its goal, the extra money will go towards completing the Rains of Ganymede #2, and making stretch goals for Rains #1. For example a potential variant cover, improving the print quality etc. 

 To help explain how much I need I'll explain my process. 

All of the tools I use are standard in manga making today. I use dip pens (G-pen for the characters, kabura pen for the backgrounds and a small maru pen for tiny detailing) as well as sumi paint brushes, manga grade white out, pilot ink and micron pens for drawing the borders. I use screen-tones to create the grey tones on the page. (I'll provide a description of screen-tones in the step by step explanation of my process) The only difference from my process and many manga artists is I do not draw my own speech bubbles, instead I pay out a letterer (Rob Jones in the UK, great guy) and leave it all to him. 

The Process

  1. I begin obviously with a story idea. I spend as much time as I need figuring out my themes, end goal and characters. When I have everything decided I plot the entire story out in bullet points, which gets me ready for the story-boarding stage.
     
  2. The story-board is the rough draft where I really work out the story as I go, and decide dialogue, panel and shot composition etc. I'll include images of the story-boards for the Rains of Ganymede as a reference. It is often in this stage that opportunities for foreshadowing are found, and themes are solidified. I typically do at least two revisions of the story-boards before moving on. 

    [Page #1 & #2 story-boards]
     
  3. After the story-boarding comes the final draft. I begin like most in pencil, laying everything out with near-final detail. Certain shots will change from the story-boards in this stage, and less frequently dialogue will be moved around or edited. All based on improving the page as much as possible.

    [Partial scan of page #1 of Rains]
     
  4.  After pencils comes the inks. I ink the characters first and the backgrounds second typically. Pretty standard stuff.


    [Work in progress of Leah Morris]
     
  5. Once I have inked everything, I erase the pencil and the screen-tone stage begins. This is one of the largest parts of the budget for the Rains of Ganymede. For those unaware, a screen-tone is an adhesive plastic film, very comparable to clear tape that has printed patterns on it, all grayscale to add shadow or sky effects etc. Anytime you see gray tones or gray patterns in manga you are looking at a screen-tone. They are roughly 5 dollars for one page of any given pattern, some cheaper, some more expensive. I'll show some examples of what screen-tones look like and how they work here:




    [Top to bottom: SE-105 screen-tone used for Mr. Matthew's skin tone, Mr. Matthews inked, Mr. Matthews with tones.]
     
  6. After screen-tones I finalize with whiteout and any extra inking, I correct any lines drawn outside the borders on the computer when I am tuning the black and white values of the scanned image. I'll also add certain effects that are too difficult to do by hand. Though its a goal of mine to do as much of my work traditionally as possible. I love the look and quality of the medium. From there the pages and a script are sent to Rob who adds dialogue and sound effects.

Cost Breakdown

Goal: $1000

Comic size: 25 pages + Color cover, Newsprint

  • Cost for supplies (Paper, ink, screen-tones, erasers, whiteout, paints etc.) ~ $200
  • Paying Rob (the letterer) ~ $300
  • Printing ~ $500 

These prices are rounded slightly for breathing room, but are fairly equivalent to what I have spent in the past. 

What You Get

  • Digital copy of A Prince's Chef for $1
  • Digital copy of the first chapter for $5
  • Physical copy of the first chapter for $10
  • Signed copy of the first chapter for $20
  • Physical copy of the first chapter with a blank variant cover and original sketch on it for $40
  • Signed copy of the first chapter with a blank variant cover and original sketch on it for $50
  • [IF YOU'RE FEELING OBSCENELY GENEROUS]
  • Original commissioned signed sketch for $100
  • Original commissioned signed drawing for $500
  • One original page of your choice from the final draft of the Rains of Ganymede #1 for $1000 [limit of 24 page 2 and the covers are not available.] 

Risks & Challenges

First and foremost this is my first indiegogo campaign, or crowdfunding campaign in general. I have help with the indiegogo in the form of my roommate, but besides that the story and production of the comic relies entirely upon me, which is a tremendous responsibility. I have never had a published comic before, though I have been submitting my stories to companies.

I may not have done any campaigns before, but this is not my first story. I have been writing for years, the Rains of Ganymede being my 14th project. I have been an artist for over a decade learning how to draw dynamic and distinct characters as well as learning one, two and three point perspective fluently, honing in on a style reminiscent of modern manga artists such as Takehiko Inoue and Takeshi Obata, but still unique to myself and my own artistic vision. In the last four years specifically I have worked very hard to understand the nuances of good storytelling, worldbuilding and character writing and I feel that the Rains of Ganymede is the culmination of all of that knowledge so far. 

Another challenge will be the coordination of shipping and managing the perks/rewards. An email has been set up specifically for this indiegogo rains.of.ganymede@gmail.com to field any questions anyone may have. My roommate is assisting in checking the email and organizing the shipping of the comics to those who donate. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Of course we would always appreciate you sharing the campaign to anyone who might enjoy the comic, and hope that you can help spread some positive words about the Rains of Ganymede. 

But overall I want to create stories that will exist much longer than me, that people can love and retell to others, sharing the joy of storytelling. So the biggest way you can help is by supporting and sharing the new stories being written that you love, whether or not my own comic is among them. 

Thank you very much!
story_txt:
Short Summary
[Leah Morris in her tunnel-home]
The Rains of Ganymede is primarily a character driven science fiction story with elements of the western outlaw, action and heist stories. It is also a goal of mine to include natural, but depthful world-building to immerse the readers into the world our characters live and breath in. 
Over seven thousand years into the future the human race has survived and thrived, ultimately spreading throughout the solar system and harnessing its power. Planets have been terraformed, and in the most extreme of cases, shifted in their orbits making them ideal for human habitation. Earth was mostly vacated 6000 years ago in 'The Great Migration', left to recover from the early scars of humanity.
 There are massive sprawling space-stations above Jupiter that house malls, casinos and the greatest attractions to be seen in the new age, and beautiful floating cities in the clouds of Venus. 
But there are always things less than glamorous to be found:
[Orion and Mr. Matthews]
Ganymede, one of the moons of Jupiter, has become the hub of all of the criminals in the galaxy. A massive prison-moon comprised of five major sections: Two separate bases built for housing soldiers and higher ranking personnel, a prison complex known as 'the Blocks' that sits on top of massive underground mining operation, a max security colony built underground and a massive city for 'freed' prisoners known as 'the Parole Zone'. Everybody whose sentence in the blocks comes to an end makes their way to the parole zone, but from there they can never leave. Instead you live out your life, working and earning enough to get by under the guise of freedom.Our story follows Leah Morris, a girl born outside of the prison who was brought in at a young age on account of her parent's crimes. At the first opportunity her mother left the blocks for the parole zone, leaving her family behind. Her father who had been forced to work in the mines eventually succumbed to a poisoned lung leaving Leah alone. Before she could be taken and put into general prison populous she escaped with barely more than the clothes on her back.

Stealing away into the sewers of the prison complex, she came upon a small group of others who suffered a similar fate as her. There she found the semblance of a family, but it never filled what Leah was missing.
Here she spent the next several years of her life, growing in age as much as she was growing in restlessness. Her resentment grew as well, for the people that imprisoned her as an innocent child, forced her father to poison himself and reduced her to a squatter in the sewers.
She grew to be more isolated as she aged, her mind set on further places and things.
They had always labeled her a criminal; now she wanted to show them what that truly meant. 
The Rains of Ganymede will follow Leah and a group of innocent, and less than innocent people, all trying to find their way to a life of freedom. They plan to pull a heist to get off the moon, or die trying.
 There are themes of the want for youth rebellion and the consequences of that, with a focus on strong characters and elaborately designed cities and worlds that evoke the feeling of a living and breathing universe. 

What We Need 

[Leah Morris and her late father Leon Morris]
My goal for this campaign is $1000. I have started the comic as I have stock left over from other projects I've done, but I am running low and the supplies are expensive. The cover isn't done as I'm missing the supplies I need.
I'm looking specifically for funding to help cover the cost of: Art supplies, the lettering cost and the printing cost. The shipping cost has been added to the indiegogo. If there is any money left over, or in the event the campaign exceeds its goal, the extra money will go towards completing the Rains of Ganymede #2, and making stretch goals for Rains #1. For example a potential variant cover, improving the print quality etc. 
 To help explain how much I need I'll explain my process. 
All of the tools I use are standard in manga making today. I use dip pens (G-pen for the characters, kabura pen for the backgrounds and a small maru pen for tiny detailing) as well as sumi paint brushes, manga grade white out, pilot ink and micron pens for drawing the borders. I use screen-tones to create the grey tones on the page. (I'll provide a description of screen-tones in the step by step explanation of my process) The only difference from my process and many manga artists is I do not draw my own speech bubbles, instead I pay out a letterer (Rob Jones in the UK, great guy) and leave it all to him. 
The Process

I begin obviously with a story idea. I spend as much time as I need figuring out my themes, end goal and characters. When I have everything decided I plot the entire story out in bullet points, which gets me ready for the story-boarding stage. 
The story-board is the rough draft where I really work out the story as I go, and decide dialogue, panel and shot composition etc. I'll include images of the story-boards for the Rains of Ganymede as a reference. It is often in this stage that opportunities for foreshadowing are found, and themes are solidified. I typically do at least two revisions of the story-boards before moving on. [Page #1 & #2 story-boards] 
After the story-boarding comes the final draft. I begin like most in pencil, laying everything out with near-final detail. Certain shots will change from the story-boards in this stage, and less frequently dialogue will be moved around or edited. All based on improving the page as much as possible.[Partial scan of page #1 of Rains] 
 After pencils comes the inks. I ink the characters first and the backgrounds second typically. Pretty standard stuff.[Work in progress of Leah Morris] 
Once I have inked everything, I erase the pencil and the screen-tone stage begins. This is one of the largest parts of the budget for the Rains of Ganymede. For those unaware, a screen-tone is an adhesive plastic film, very comparable to clear tape that has printed patterns on it, all grayscale to add shadow or sky effects etc. Anytime you see gray tones or gray patterns in manga you are looking at a screen-tone. They are roughly 5 dollars for one page of any given pattern, some cheaper, some more expensive. I'll show some examples of what screen-tones look like and how they work here:[Top to bottom: SE-105 screen-tone used for Mr. Matthew's skin tone, Mr. Matthews inked, Mr. Matthews with tones.] 
After screen-tones I finalize with whiteout and any extra inking, I correct any lines drawn outside the borders on the computer when I am tuning the black and white values of the scanned image. I'll also add certain effects that are too difficult to do by hand. Though its a goal of mine to do as much of my work traditionally as possible. I love the look and quality of the medium. From there the pages and a script are sent to Rob who adds dialogue and sound effects.

Cost Breakdown
Goal: $1000
Comic size: 25 pages + Color cover, Newsprint

Cost for supplies (Paper, ink, screen-tones, erasers, whiteout, paints etc.) ~ $200
Paying Rob (the letterer) ~ $300
Printing ~ $500 

These prices are rounded slightly for breathing room, but are fairly equivalent to what I have spent in the past. 
What You Get

Digital copy of A Prince's Chef for $1
Digital copy of the first chapter for $5
Physical copy of the first chapter for $10
Signed copy of the first chapter for $20
Physical copy of the first chapter with a blank variant cover and original sketch on it for $40
Signed copy of the first chapter with a blank variant cover and original sketch on it for $50
[IF YOU'RE FEELING OBSCENELY GENEROUS]
Original commissioned signed sketch for $100
Original commissioned signed drawing for $500
One original page of your choice from the final draft of the Rains of Ganymede #1 for $1000 [limit of 24 page 2 and the covers are not available.] 


Risks & Challenges
First and foremost this is my first indiegogo campaign, or crowdfunding campaign in general. I have help with the indiegogo in the form of my roommate, but besides that the story and production of the comic relies entirely upon me, which is a tremendous responsibility. I have never had a published comic before, though I have been submitting my stories to companies.
I may not have done any campaigns before, but this is not my first story. I have been writing for years, the Rains of Ganymede being my 14th project. I have been an artist for over a decade learning how to draw dynamic and distinct characters as well as learning one, two and three point perspective fluently, honing in on a style reminiscent of modern manga artists such as Takehiko Inoue and Takeshi Obata, but still unique to myself and my own artistic vision. In the last four years specifically I have worked very hard to understand the nuances of good storytelling, worldbuilding and character writing and I feel that the Rains of Ganymede is the culmination of all of that knowledge so far. 
Another challenge will be the coordination of shipping and managing the perks/rewards. An email has been set up specifically for this indiegogo rains.of.ganymede@gmail.com to field any questions anyone may have. My roommate is assisting in checking the email and organizing the shipping of the comics to those who donate. 

Other Ways You Can Help
Of course we would always appreciate you sharing the campaign to anyone who might enjoy the comic, and hope that you can help spread some positive words about the Rains of Ganymede. But overall I want to create stories that will exist much longer than me, that people can love and retell to others, sharing the joy of storytelling. So the biggest way you can help is by supporting and sharing the new stories being written that you love, whether or not my own comic is among them. Thank you very much!

story:
Short Summary:

At one time Puppy's life was much simpler. Nice home, caring owner and all the sleep a lazy dog could want. Day by day puppy grew older with his best friend. From one adventure to the next always up for it as long as his partner was there with him. However things don't always go the way we planned. His world shattered with everything he knew gone. Put into a new place with no hope or will to go forward. The shelter is hard, especially for an older dog. As days pass the people pass without a second glance saying “He's too old” and “I don't want a dog someone else dumped”. But with every closing door one will always be open, waiting for you. When it's found you must take that chance and walk through for you never know the adventures that lie ahead. And for puppy all it took was one child with the heart to embrace him.

 

 

 

Who we are!

Artist/Writer: Becca West

https://www.instagram.com/chewbecca_west/

Writer/Not allowed to draw: Wes Ward

 

Funding the Adventure!

This is where you come in! 

 

Things we need to finance-

  • Supplies... Oh so many supplies. Paints,Paper,Programs,Equipment, Etc
  • Perk funding. Local made dog treats, Limited Edition covers, Custom paintings, Etc, We are going to have lots of fun perks so this is going to be a big one.
  • Being able to live. If we do this, we are going to do it right. That means we are going to invest as much time as possible into the project. As great as that is, it means we would have to work less so we need to make sure us and pets have the funding needed to survive. 
  • Producing the physical book itself. We are hoping to self publish if possible with this amount that will be possible!


 

Impact 

Some things we hope to accomplish.

  • Show that all pets young and old are valuable. Age is just a number and you never know how special a pet can be until you get to bond with them.
  • Raise awareness for pet adoptions.
  • Get people more interested in the idea of adopting or fostering older pets

Challenges

Our number one challenge is financing this project. We are passionate about this graphic novel but passion isn't always enough. We need your help to make sure we have the funding to produce this piece of work. 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Share this on Facebook or Twitter!
  • Go volunteer at a local animal shelter.

story:
Hello Everyone,

I am the Author of Nubara which is a 3 book trilogy about Atlantis & the End Of The WORLD! 
My Illustrator & friends think this book series should have a Graphic Novel regarding the PREQUEL of how Nubara was created which I think sounds like a fantastic idea but it is costly & I have to pay artists for their work.  That being said the EBOOK is out and it selling 4-5 copies a day which means people are loving the story.  

Here's the breakdown:

  • To get started I think the amount of $3,500 should be more then enough to get this project started.  This is for research & to pay the illustrators which I plan on getting different ones from all around the world
  • For everyone who contributes you will be in the dedication and some of the highest contributors will be graphical drawn into a scene of the prequel itself which will be called "Nubara: Origins"
  • I will also supply those who contribute The E-Book Edition of Nubara available for Amazon Kindle :)
  • If I do not make this goal this project can & will take up to 3 years to complete by then Nubara wont be fresh on anyone's mind but all three novels will be out.

The Impact:

  • Nubara is already doing well but imagine if this reaches epic proportions. Lots of movies have been made from well know Kindle Books.  Do you really want to miss out on such an opportunity? 
  • The E Book is already doing so well, imagine how the print edition will be doing once released.
  • I believe in transparency which is why I am going to give updates when there are some to give.

Risks & Challenges

Finding an illustrator is one thing but life does get in the way which is why I need to find a few illustrators in case one can not fulfill my illustration needs for this graphic novel.

  • I have been working on Nubara Book 1 for 1 year, I said I was going to do it & I never gave up, I did it now I am working on Book 2 while working on another novel not related to the series. Plus I have a full time job on top of it. I have scarified lots to fulfill my dreams but to also help inspire those who have dreams but think they can not achieve it. YOU CAN. 
  • I will make sue I dedicate myself to this project 100%. A Graphic novel for this series will be a huge achievement. 

Other Ways "You" Can Help

If you can not contribute that is alright, but you can help get the word out there by sharing.   Help my dream of getting this GRAPHIC NOVEL out there into the hands of all. 

  • Share on Social Media, talk about it with your friends!
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
Hi, I'm Bruce Mutard and I want introduce you to the first book I've published under my new imprint, Fabilaux:




ART IS A LIE

I bet you didn't know that. 


What? Isn't Art about truth, embodied in an idealised beauty, cutting to the core of what it means to be human? 

Sorry Sister Wendy, but eat your rosary. 

Alright, it's an elitist, pompous, obscurantist and laughable grab-bag of theories desperately in search of relevance in a relativist world that's long since become deconstructed by post-structuralist, post-modern politically correct left of centre of the right-ness. Roger Scruton sez so. 

Nope. 

Perhaps it's a place where – to paraphrase Oscar Wilde – people like Sotheby, Christie and Leonard Joel know the price of everything and the value of nothing. At least Lucien Freud's estate can now afford to give all his bastards private education. 

Close, but no cigar. Or whiskey. 

Okay, it's knowing art when you see it, and that's when you like it, right? 

Sorry, all wrong. Everything you thought you knew about Art is a lie, but don't worry, the guide to true understanding of art is at hand. Carol Wood and Susan Butcher have spent the past nine years digging for the truth in all manner of cemeteries, crypts, tombs, archives, applying only the most relevant forensic techniques: alchemy, reading animal intestines, tea-leaf dialectics, coffee ground metaphysics, watching cartoons, reading comics and saturnalia. 

So with great diligence, skill, laughter and cups of tea, Carol and Sue have written and drawn these exposés:

Did you know Picasso only invented Cubism to get girls? 



Magritte was actually a failed mad scientist? 



That Marcel Duchamp was a serial art criminal: he misappropriated public property, produced pornography, played chess and got people to pay him for it. He was also French. 



Or that Frida Kahlo was really Betty Boop before the accident; Diego knew but Trotsky didn't. 



Butcher and Wood even show you how they make a comic by reanimating John Constable so they can kill him for THEIR art. 



Seriously though, this book collects the strips that have been published under the title Dead Or Alive in Artillery Magazine since 2006. 



In short, I wanted a collection of the strips, and as neither Artillery nor Carol and Sue could produce it, I put my money where my heart is and have published it 'artistically'. This is to say that I've ensured it's the best looking book I could produce, and making money is a secondary consideration. Yes, it has been PRINTED and ready to be shipped. But we will allow time for Carol and Sue to make the other perks that are on offer. For those who are familiar with the Dead or Alive strips, this book also contains five strips never before published, a introduction comic by me, a preface by Amelia Clipart and an index that is itself, mostly lies. Check out the gallery for full page previews!




So, pick up a book and a reward to your fancy to the right. There's the book, but also postcards, posters, novelties, original art, handmade figurines and a one off, hand-made Statue of Libertinism (formerly known as Liberty) before the International Art Restorers sanitised it (as seen in the strip within the book). Some things are better left to age disgracefully. 


G'wan, this is the best art education in comics form you can buy. I know it's the only one, but why quibble on detail. 


xBruce. 


Now about the artists:

Carol Wood and Susan are ex-pat Brits who've been out here since the sixties - the nineteen sixties that is. They met and discovered they were both madly in love with comics, cartoons, kids shows, cereal packet toys and all that good stuff, so started collecting and making comics themselves. For a number of years, they self-published their own comic magazine called POX, which was like what you would get if you mixed MAD, Beano, National Lampoon, those weird American Christian comics in a Meret Oppenheim's furry tea cup. It created quite a storm. For the past nine years they have been producing the strips you will soon hold in your hands. Carol also spends time making models and Sue likes tinkering with mechanical things that have no electronics in them, but might have electrics. They live in a town that has a lot of hot springs, which they scrupulously avoid, as then they would have to mix with yuppies and their ilk. But the bonus of the yuppies in town is that a lot of good stuff gets thrown into the town tip, where Carol and Sue have been spotted gleaning.

About the Publisher:
Fabilaux is the imprint of Bruce Mutard Impropriety Incorporealated, set up to publish comics and books that have niche audiences, and then put them together.  Bruce has written and drawn the graphic novels The Sacrifice, The Silence, A Mind of Love, The Bunker, and a host of short stories, illos, and so on. He also recently completed a Masters degree researching comics and created one to be encountered in a gallery space, not in print. He also writes and talks about comics a lot, sometimes for academic audiences, sometimes not. When not publishing, he is working on a new graphic novel, another comic project, and more besides. Like this.

He also writes and talks about comics a lot, sometimes for academic audiences, sometimes not. When not publishing, he is working on a new graphic novel, another comic project, and more besides. Like this.

story:
Making a comic is no cheap matter.

The money that we get from the campaign is going to buying better equipment (software, tablets, inks, etc.).  It's also going towards printing costs.  It may seem like a simple comic, but for us it's a dream come true.  We are doing something we have worked so hard to achieve and with your support we can make it more than a dream.   The indiegogo campaign allows us to not only make our comics, but also bring them out every month.  We will be selling on a consistent monthly base, and for everyone who buys issues one and two of our comics will get them more than a week before they ever go on sale.  We also have a lot of exclusives as well.  We have special signed covers of Issue's one and two for indiegogo only.  They will never be on sale at any time.  There is also an exclusive poster and much, much more.

Can't contribute, but still want to help! 

It's completely understandable if you can't contribute.  If you would like to help and be a part of getting the comics out to the masses, just simply spread the word.  Everything helps, whether it's contributing or just talking on social media we give you our thanks for looking at our campaign and helping us spread our dream.  We can't wait to start bringing these comics out to you and everyone else.  This could not be a possibility without the generosity and support of all of you.  From the bottom of our hearts we thank everyone of you!

media we give you our thanks for looking at our campaign and helping us spread
our dream.  We can't wait to start bringing these comics out to you and
everyone else.  This could not be a possibility without the generosity and
support of all of you.  From the bottom
of our hearts we thank everyone of you!

story:
Short Summary

Dibs is a full length romantic comedy feature film with a great cast and a lot of heart. 

http://www.imdb.com/title/tt3212948/?ref_=fn_al_tt_1

I wrote, produced and directed this movie and since it's nearly impossible to get your movie released these days, I decided to turn to the fine people of the internet for help. 

I'm not asking you for money to make the movie, it's already made! 

Simply watch the trailer and if you wanna see it, donate and we'll send you a copy, easy as that. 

Thanks!

What We Need & What You Get

I self financed this movie and it nearly destroyed me emotionally and financially. 

So hopefully, we can make some of the money back and maybe even enough to fund another one! 

It's up to you!

The Impact

People need to see this movie, it's funny and has a lot of heart. 

If we can get enough eyeballs on this movie it can really change the lives of the amazing first time actors who gave their all for us and help get them more work in the industry. 

Myself included, I've been dying to work more as a writer and a director and I feel like until the world gets a chance to see what I can do, my opportunities are very limited. 

Take a chance and watch our movie! Thanks!

story:
The project

Born To Be Different, Born To Save The World!"

#EatMyWheels

This gang of Superheroes, use their disabilities as their super powers.

Disabled children deserve to be represented in books and on TV in a positive way. Without sad music in the background accompanying their story.

Children with disabilities are funny, exciting, happy, sad, mischievious, rude, caring. Just like any other child.

I have created the Department Of Ability and am in the process of writing a comic, to be released in March 2015. I also hope to get it onto TV, so that ALL children, (not just ones with special needs) can watch enjoy, relate to, and realise that the child who lives down the street, is just the same as them. Just with a difference.

I NEED YOUR HELP!

MY INSPIRATION

The Department of Ability are Disabled Superheroes! I am a very proud father to 9 year old Emily, who has Spina Bifida and Hydrocephalus and uses a wheelchair to get around...she is, like the kids in the groups we move around in, strong, independent, funny and brilliant! However several years ago Emily and I noticed that there were no real, strong disabled characters for kids in comics or on T.V.....so I made my own. I have created and drawn them. This is all my artwork.


Who's involved

With the help of www.strongbones.org.uk the prospect of a printed Disabled Superhero comic is close! The characters and situations are totally accessible for ALL kids, it promises to be loud, strong and fun! The demand for this comic from parents groups, schools, celebs, and charities WORLDWIDE is such that I have had to give up full time employment to finish it and make it happen! Of course this means me and my family have to live whilst I draw, write and hopefully change the perception and views of our disabled kids through the comic, and hopefully TV!

Strongbones have been so supportive of this project, I have drawn several of their children, with their parent's permission, and included them in the story.


Strongbones are paying for the comic to be printed and distributed. I'm not being paid at all for creating the comic, but as the comic has gotten bigger and bigger from all of the interest I have got, I have had to give up my full time job to concerntrate on it. I was the sole earner, as my wife is the fulltime carer for Emily. Therefore I haven't got any income to support my family. However, my family and I are so passionate and believe in the project, we decided it was worth the risk.

Since the D.O.A has gone online via FB www.facebook.com/The-Department-of-Ability and TWITTER  https://twitter.com/DeptOfAbility the response to the idea has been incredible! From celebs to sportstars to charities, the premise and the message behind this has struck a chord worldwide! A few famous paralympians have even agreed to appear in the final showdown with the bad guys!

Emily and I have had various TV/news/magazine appearances, and hundreds of positive comments. Take a look at my website for up to date news of what has been happening. www.departmentofability.com

I am working on my own creating this with just a dog for company! The strongbones charity are going to print this when I finish it. One day, my dream is to turn this comic into an animation for all children able bodied and disabled, to enjoy. First I need to finish the comic. I have already started drawing and hope to have it finished by the beginning of 2016. The more time that I can spend on it, the quicker it will be.


How I will use the money raised.

The money raised will support me whilst I am at home drawing the comic. Previously I have tried to raise crowdfunding for a block funding, which has been unsuccessful. This time, I will be raising money bit by bit. This will allow me to relax about money, whilst I am beavering away at the comic. The will also help towards paying travel expenses for the charity event's, promotions and interviews that I have been invited to attend.I have already attended a lot, which has I have managed to pay the cost. However it's now getting really expensive as the project is becoming more and more popular.

It will mean that I can still pay our morgage, and we will not risk losing our home.

The Department Of Ability is such an exciting project for anyone to be involved in. It will put a smile on thousands of children's faces, especially Emily's!




This project is so important for so many children and families living with disability. Thank you


Risks and challenges

Strongbones are funding the printing and distribution of the comic. They have a set budget. Demand for the comic is now so high since all of the publicity we have received, more people want it to be available,so they are possibily looking into extra funding to increase publication.They are sorting out this side. By this time, the comic will be drawn and written, so I will have already finished my bit, though I will be helping to promote the comic as much as I can. I am also spending a lot of time promoting the cartoon, hoping for it to be transformed into a TV series, and have had a lot of positive comments about this idea. If the cartoon doesn't happen, and I am unable to support myself financially, I will go back to my old fulltime job, at a plumbers merchant, knowing that I had tried to change conceptions, and a lot of happy children would have seen the strongbones comic.

I have set up my own business a year ago, www.emilysdadsart.com where I draw individual personalised comics for people. However I have put this on hold for the moment, as my main priority is to finish this comic for the kids. Also www.amazingkidsart.co.uk which is a facebook community of parents who celebrate their kids art by posting it in our online gallery. This is a hobby.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share the Department Of Ability around as much as you can. We need to change perceptions. WE NEED TO CHANGE THE WORLD!

We now have Department Of Ability Fans on twitter, who have been amazing @DOA_fans

story:
HELLO, POTENTIAL INDIEGOGO BACKER!

Welcome to the campaign to fund...

ARTIFICE RE-ANIMATE - TIME WILL TELL!

Awaken to a world... Where personal identity shadows... In comparison to digital reflections...

 

  • Written by SMiRKtheALiEN & RaginMantis
  • Art by Vic King
  • Colors by Barbusco
  • Letters by SMiRKtheALiEN

 

​​Action-Packed Sci-Fi Fantasy, Dark Futurism, Large-Scale World Building, Character-Driven Mystery, Nightmarish Dystopian Dread, Ancient Civilisations, Philosophy, Quantum Blockchain Artificial Intelligence...
 

THE STORY...


After a chaotic incident at sea, Dany washes ashore the dystopian hellscape of Velrona...

The larger story begins unfolding as Dany confronts the surface of the worlds deeper mysteries, ancient secrets, and the insanity of unknown hyper-technologically advanced civilisations, as forces beyond his comprehension propel him on a collision course towards the ever-blurring grey areas between past and future...


STRETCH GOALS:

  • Card 1 - $5,000 USD
  • Card 2 - $10,000 USD
  • Card 3 - $15,000 USD
  • Card 4 - $20,000 USD
  • Foil Cover - $25,000 USD
  • Chromium cover - $50,000 USD
     





ABOUT US:


SMiRK here, production manager at Core Comics, self-aware pseudonym, co-writer of the book. Artifice Re-Animate - Time Will Tell is the first graphic novel instalment by Core Comics, One of three fully realized universes with many overlapping and intertwining character stories to tell...


The founding members of Core Comics have been crafting their graphic novel stories for the past 2-3 years. The first book Artifice Re-Animate - Time Will Tell, written by myself SMiRK & RaginMantis, with art by Vic King, colors by Barbusco Studios and contributions from members Warlock & T3, is the first initial phase of our greater overarching plans at Core Comics.

Our approach is one of symbiosis with the traditional crowd-funding comic book market. If our early efforts are successful, the effort is backed up with a potential long term vision, with plans to take things far into the unknown if we reach certain milestones along the road... 



The plan is to extend the reach of our physical product range as far as possible while contributing to further growth and expansion of the decentralized revolution known as blockchain and blockchain comics. All the while ensuring we stay faithful to the traditional market and deliver on our promises of providing the highest quality physical books in terms of story and art to our dedicated backers.

Our ultimate goal is to establish a virtual comic book shop within Decentraland’s growing ecosystem and gradually expanding our operations to utilize interoperability between blockchains and their applications.


Check out Core HQ here: https://bit.ly/VisitCoreHQ

Within the metaverse of Decentraland, Core Comics resides within our Core HQ building, which showcases our latest NFT artwork, provides a space to host our promotional events to engage our fan-base and communities, which we hope will become ongoing supporters of our vision and stories into the future, once the full scale of what we intend to accomplish is fully understood and realized.


Check out our YouTube channel: https://bit.ly/CoreComicsYouTube

Once we have achieved our initial crowdfunding targets and goals, we will soon begin initiating plans to create the blockchain comic book version of Artifice Re-Animate - Time Will Tell (More details coming soon) as we ramp up to full-scale production. Upon the full completion of the book's artwork, coloring and lettering, and finalized version of the NFT based blockchain comic book, we then move into the fulfilment and distribution phase for the physical books. Judging by how successful we are at achieving this process will determine how soon we begin embarking on producing the next IP "Crossbones and Cosmoses."



We've looked at expanding the product range early on into multiple different avenues, merchandise and smaller product creations for additional bonuses or add ons for the campaign, as well as utilizing the IP's as added layers of value within the NFT and blockchain market, a currently underutilized and undervalued approach within the landscape.

Our first edition Steelcards are more than just your average meme NFT. We believe the standard of quality we intend to provide for both the physical and digital blockchain versions of our products will come to be valued and appreciated as we continue producing and expanding what we have on offer.
 

Purchase our NFT's here: https://Rarible.com/CoreComics


WEBSITE:

We've got the back end of the core-comics.com website practically built and, from a functionality standpoint, it's ready to handle the first minting run and production of NFT/Blockchain comic books. All of our digital NFTs will integrate with the site.

The mobile-friendly site includes a comic book reader, with a visually aesthetic experience allowing readers to flip through pages as though they were actually reading a physical book. Customers also have the ability to link their digital wallet (meta-mask) to the site, which is where their comic book non-fungible tokens are accessed. It will also include a burn functionality akin to unwrapping the packaging of the product.

CONCLUSION:

​
We are truly passionate about blurring the lines between the digital world, the real world and the artistic world. We’ve got our fingers crossed that success in the early stages will be achieved. If that's the case, we'll be going full speed ahead with the next phases of the plan, all the while maintaining the quality of our NFT production whilst delivering on our promises and producing the highest standard blockchain and physical graphic novel books possible.
 

 

 

FROM ALL OF US A CORE COMICS, THANK YOU SO MUCH FOR CONSIDERING BACKING ARTIFICE RE-ANIMATE - TIME WILL TELL!

story:
*EVERY LAIR BOOK WILL BE SIGNED WITH A PERSONAL MESSAGE FROM CREATOR!

*EVERY BACKER RECEIVES PDF of Under The Flesh #1-3

 

LAIR tells the story of a faithless, off-duty New York City cop, in a rocky relationship, who gets more than what he bargained for when he somehow finds himself squaring off against a sadistic ruler to a hellish dimension.

If you're into creepily bizarre Stephen King movies, then you'll feel right at home with LAIR!

 

 

 

 

 

LAIR is a 66-page horror one-shot (printed with a "softbound" cover) unlike anything you've ever read from an emerging indie comic book writer

ANGELO - Brash off-duty cop who wears his heart on his sleeve.

VAYE - Snarky college student obsessed with Twitter, obscure vintage rock bands and gossip.

LIZZY - Mild-mannered graveyard shift doctor and single mother.

ANASTASIA - Caring woman of faith who found her way into the stubborn arms of Angelo.

KAGRAN (KAY-GRIN) - Fallen Angel Overseer of LAIR...

Story by Gilbert Deltrez

Art by Sebastian Navas

Colors by Davi Comodo

Letters by Deyvison Manes

 

***All international backers will receive an exclusive bonus pinup with their backing

 

STRETCH GOAL ---> 3k (UNLOCKED)

Every LAIR copy will be signed with personal message from creator G.Deltrez!

Every backer will receive free digital/PDF copies of Under The Flesh #1 - 3!

 

STRETCH GOAL ---> 5k (UNLOCKED!!!)

Every physical copy will be pre-packaged with this exclusive 11 x 17 poster!

story:
Editing and lettering is done for Infidel issue #1 Nuklear fans!

Working on covers and then off to the presses!


Who We Are at Nuklear Comix!

Nuklear Comix Universe is an independently owned, self-publishing comic house that is looking to bring our stories and characters out to the wider world! The NCU is the brainchild of US Army veteran Barry Edwards. Barry is a lifelong fan of comics and previously owned and operated Nuklear Comix Shop in Sumter, South Carolina. He is the creative mastermind providing initial character designs, story outlines, and the grand scheme of the larger, overarching Nuklear Comix Universe. Together with his lead writer Steven Staggs and lead artist Gene Magora, Mr. Edwards has assembled a mighty team of creative talent to help bring his vision out of his brain and into your hands.

The main focus of this IndieGogo Campaign is to help our creative team secure the funds we need to bring our first issue and promo materials to print so we can proceed with sales and move forward on the next issue of our launch title, INFIDEL!

Infidel is the story of a soldier, wounded and captured in Iraq and now back home in an America he no longer recognizes. Fueled by anger and an urgent call for justice, Infidel will stop at nothing to achieve his goals and dole out the justice he believes is sorely missed in the world.

The funds we seek are primarily for printing costs. Mr. Edwards is a family man and a veteran who works full-time as a construction super-intendent. So far all of the funds used to pay for the materials, scripts, and art produced have been coming straight from his own pockets and now he is seeking help to supplement production costs!

This campaign isn’t just in support of a single issue going to print, it is also a clarion call for all comic book fans and readers to get onboard and see the passion and talent behind this series. A successful funding campaign here means not only a successful print for our first issue, it also means establishing a firm foundation and a place in our expanding fanbase to help ensure the future of the Nuklear Comix Universe is a bright and long-lasting one!

What We Need & What You Get

To keep is simple, we need funds to take this first issue to print! Our modest goal of $2000 will all be going into covering the printing and binding costs for copies of the first issue as well as promo materials and branded merchandise such as posters and limited card prints! Even if we don’t reach our ultimate goal, every penny raised from this campaign will be going straight to the printing house to get this book out into the world as soon as possible!

Of course, we appreciate any and all efforts to support this dream and so our campaign will have THREE reward tiers for monetary donations!

Reward Tier 1 – Free Digital Issue!
$10 USD

 

Reward Tier 2– Signed First Issue!
$15 USD

 

Reward Tier 3– Full-Color Limited Card Print and Signed First Issue!
$30

 

The Impact

Your contribution, even the smallest amount, will help achieve not only the print run of this first issue, but it will also assist in accomplishing a life-long dream for our creative team. Barry Edwards, former comic shop owner knows the in’s and outs of the business. He has contacts in the local state-wide market in the form of other creatives, shop owners, con organizers, and local persons of importance. He’s not just interested in the creative side, he has a firm grasp on the business handling and how best to get our product out there.

Steven Staggs is a lifelong fan of all things comic book or superhero related. He received a degree in Creative Writing, has scripted a successful short horror film, writes every script and layout for every issue based on creative notes and suggestions, and dreams of seeing his name printed on the cover of a book people will love.

Gene Magora is an incredibly accomplished artist with a pedigree and track record a mile long. He has worked in the past on a wide array of comics, animation, and art projects. The man’s Instagram account is a polished, professional gallery of impeccable skill and he’s eager to prove himself further in our future issues.

 You are not just contributing to the printing of a single issue. You are launching a universe fueling the accomplishment of dreams!

Risks & Challenges

Self-publishing is always a challenge and in the current health and political climate of the world, its harder than ever to gather together to promote, produce, and complete publishing goals and book sales. We hear at Nuklear Comix are stepping up because we believe the tale we are telling through the eyes of this character is an important one that is more relevant than ever in these trying and shocking times. We are taking the risk and accepting the challenges because we BELIEVE in this world we’ve created, and we hope you will too!

Other Ways You Can Help

Money is important, but it isn’t everything! If you can’t provide support financially but you are still interested or passionate about the stories we want to tell, you can still provide support by spreading the word! We have active pages on Facebook and Instagram as well as a twitter account! Give us a like, share, and follow to keep up to date on the status of the book, future projects, and everything else going on in the Nuklear Comix Universe! We have major plans and big surprises planned over the next year and we would love to see your vocal support! So, check out our social media pages (just search Nuklear Comix Universe), share our campaign and our posts, and help us grow the NCU Army!
story_txt:
Editing and lettering is done for Infidel issue #1 Nuklear fans!Working on covers and then off to the presses!Who We Are at Nuklear Comix!
Nuklear Comix Universe is an independently owned, self-publishing comic house that is looking to bring our stories and characters out to the wider world! The NCU is the brainchild of US Army veteran Barry Edwards. Barry is a lifelong fan of comics and previously owned and operated Nuklear Comix Shop in Sumter, South Carolina. He is the creative mastermind providing initial character designs, story outlines, and the grand scheme of the larger, overarching Nuklear Comix Universe. Together with his lead writer Steven Staggs and lead artist Gene Magora, Mr. Edwards has assembled a mighty team of creative talent to help bring his vision out of his brain and into your hands.
The main focus of this IndieGogo Campaign is to help our creative team secure the funds we need to bring our first issue and promo materials to print so we can proceed with sales and move forward on the next issue of our launch title, INFIDEL!
Infidel is the story of a soldier, wounded and captured in Iraq and now back home in an America he no longer recognizes. Fueled by anger and an urgent call for justice, Infidel will stop at nothing to achieve his goals and dole out the justice he believes is sorely missed in the world.
The funds we seek are primarily for printing costs. Mr. Edwards is a family man and a veteran who works full-time as a construction super-intendent. So far all of the funds used to pay for the materials, scripts, and art produced have been coming straight from his own pockets and now he is seeking help to supplement production costs!
This campaign isn’t just in support of a single issue going to print, it is also a clarion call for all comic book fans and readers to get onboard and see the passion and talent behind this series. A successful funding campaign here means not only a successful print for our first issue, it also means establishing a firm foundation and a place in our expanding fanbase to help ensure the future of the Nuklear Comix Universe is a bright and long-lasting one!
What We Need & What You Get
To keep is simple, we need funds to take this first issue to print! Our modest goal of $2000 will all be going into covering the printing and binding costs for copies of the first issue as well as promo materials and branded merchandise such as posters and limited card prints! Even if we don’t reach our ultimate goal, every penny raised from this campaign will be going straight to the printing house to get this book out into the world as soon as possible!
Of course, we appreciate any and all efforts to support this dream and so our campaign will have THREE reward tiers for monetary donations!
Reward Tier 1 – Free Digital Issue!$10 USD
 
Reward Tier 2– Signed First Issue!$15 USD
 
Reward Tier 3– Full-Color Limited Card Print and Signed First Issue!$30

story:
Who am I, the team involved, and what Icepick is.

Todd Rayner - The Creator, writer, and artist for Icepick. I have worked on several independent comics as a digital colorist for Enterlight Studios, Arcana, Wave Entertainment, and Bluewater Productions.

Cover artists for this issue:

Todd Rayner - Standard Cover A

Damon Anthis - Variant Cover B

Icepick is a character whose story I have wanted to publish since I was a kid. Over the years I have revised and cleaned up the story to make it something more than just a kid wanting to make a comic book. It all started with issue 1, which I painstakingly funded and published myself. 

With your help I can publish issue 3 and also get out there to meet you the fans!

Why Crowd Funding?

There’s no middlemen. It's just you and me. The best thing about Icepick is that most of the creative work on the book is complete. I plan to start shipping the rewards within eight to ten weeks of closing this campaign. Without the middleman I can include various reward tiers, such as the variant cover, stickers, prints, sketch cards, and more!

​With your help I can produce many more covers, issues, and be able to get to a convention near you with all these awesome books. Every penny raised goes towards making Issue 3 of Icepick a reality. That covers everything from the creative side, printing, supplies, taxes, and fees. In other words, everything that it takes to make this happen is where the bulk of the money is going! All profits will go toward funding future stories and making sure I am at shows meeting and greeting you, the fans! 

Think of your pledge as a sneak peek or a pre-purchase. I’ve put together several rewards that I hope you'll love. Plus any of the rewards make a great gift for anyone in your family!

Risks & Challenges

When it comes to shipping on time and reward fulfillment, any project can have obstacles. Most of the perks (including possible Stretch Goal incentives) are standing by ready to print, as most of the creative work is complete. My printers are ready to go as soon as I give them the word! I have worked with these printers before and they deliver the top notch books and rewards you’ll be receiving, this you can count on. If there are any hiccups or delays I will be in constant communication with all backers during the entire process and update you in a timely manner.

I want to assure you that my top priority is making the best and highest quality products possible and having them delivered to you in a timely and undamaged manner. 

In conclusion, I’d like to thank all the readers, fans, and any collectors who have supported me over the last year. You’re the reason I keep going and you have been AMAZING!

Please pledge now! If you can’t pledge now, please share on Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram, as every bit helps!

story:
Hi,

I'm a writer/artist based in Manchester UK. I'm also an actor and playwright. A few years ago I created my own comic book series. With the help of a small independent company, I published a pilot issue, and now I would like to continue the story in a 100 page graphic novel. My aim is to create an entertaining and thought-provoking comic book series, which I will also be pitching as a television series and/or feature film. 
Two of my all-time acting heroes appear as major characters in Borderliners (after granting me permission). Knights of the realm, and living legends, Sir Roger Moore and Sir Ian McKellen!

‘BORDERLINERS: True Realities’ is a fast-moving 21st century espionage tale with more than a nod to TV’s 'The Prisoner', ‘Spooks’, and the Jason Bourne movie franchise, not to mention the mind-bending sci-fi stories of Philip K Dick (‘Blade Runner’, ‘Total Recall’, ‘Minority Report’, etc.), and the mind-blowing world of quantum physics. The grittily realistic graphic novel finds double-crossed government agents fighting to recover their sanity, and hit back against a corrupt department of M.I.5., whilst uncovering an incredible multi-universe spanning conspiracy. 

I have wanted to draw comic books since I was a kid growing up in Wigan, and over the past couple of decades I have had illustration work published in newspapers, magazines, and on television. But my dream has always been to create my own comic book series, and (hopefully) one day adapt it for tv or film. When I did the Borderliners pilot comic, I sent it out to some industry professionals, and was overwhelmed by the response. Here's what they said:

DEZ SKINN, legendary Marvel UK Comics editor, (second-in-command to Marvel Comics supremo STAN LEE), and creator of ‘Dr Who Magazine’, ‘Starburst’, and ‘House of Hammer’ read the comic:

“..In Brian’s case, I can’t wait for his second, third, and every issue of Borderliners that follows. It delivers a totally engrossing storyline enhanced by an admirable art style. Bring it on, Brian!”

Multi award-winning ‘Judge Dredd’, ‘Batman’, and ‘Luther Arkwright’ writer/artist BRYAN TALBOT (winner of the 2012 Costa biography award) said:

“..I’ve seen your work develop over many years, and you’ve now achieved a new level of confidence and visual flair”.

And LIAM SHARP (artist on Marvel’s ‘X-Men’) commented:

“The effort that’s gone into this is clear on every page. It’s a joy to read something that doesn’t treat the reader like an idiot.”

MIKE COLLINS, artist on Dr Who Magazine, Spider-Man, etc., agreed:

“It has a confident feel to the structure and dialogue – a sense you know where you’re going, and I’m keen to be along for the ride. I want to know what happens next! And that’s more than I can say about most mainstream stuff these days!”

What I need is enough pennies to keep me going for approximately 10 weeks of writing/drawing. I'm not greedy, so at £5 an hour (working 8 hours a day/5 days a week), that'd be £2000 in total. I will be publishing the book with a small independent company, so there will be an absolute minimum to be spent on admin/costs, etc. I will also buy all the paper, pens, ink, etc. I need.

Unique perks include:

Your name in the 'Thanks to' section of the book.

Copies of the book.

Invitation to the book launch/party.

Your likeness as a character in the book.

Special limited edition art prints.

Original pages of artwork.

Specially commissioned portraits.


If I don't reach the entire funding, I simply work faster for longer!


I am 100% confident that 'Borderliners' will be a success. With YOUR help, we can make it.

Thank You!!
