story:
Many of you who have been following me know that I have been working hard to defend my Trade Mark Sexy Astrology.  Freedom of Speech is important all of us & I have been told by many to plow through despite the fees my lawyer is charging to go to Trial in December.  It is a Federal case and next week in order to have my opinion heard in my deposition I am going to Penn Plaza NYC, to meet up with a court reporter to take my Statement via Teleconference.  Taking place in NYC, Florida and California simultaneously.  SO EXCiTiNG!!! And Scary.   I am too far into the woods to back out now!


I am continuing to raise money to defend my trademark Sexy Astrology, which was approved by the USPTO, last June 6th, 2014.  I am in the throws of a small legal battle after being approved by the United States Patent and Trademark Office.  A woman with a dissimilar mark has being suing me, to stop the use of Sexy Astrology—the name of my YouTube astrology show.  She also sent me a cease and desist letter.  We are nearing the end of the argument, and god willing she will settle.  Namely I will most likely write a statement saying:  “I will not ever use my trade mark SEXY ASTROLOGY to do compatibility readings or matchmaking between couples. And that SEXY ASTROLOGY is a straight astrology show for entertainment purposes only.”  It’s really a show about the astrological weather.

Last July 2014 when I began my first indiegogo campaign I successfully raised about 1700.00$ in just 6 days. I was moving to Ithaca for the year and was so happy for the turnout!  Thank you for your continued support.  A second indiegogo campaign in the spring 2015 yielded similar results!

I have been practicing doing monthly horoscopes for 7 years through my youtube comedy channel called SEXY ASTROLOGY.  No, I do not think I am sexy, but in the world of astrology the two words are easy to remember. And being that the show is grounded in comedy, my then husband and I came up with the idea after I had my 3rd child and the result was a small smash!  I have over 2 million video views and being that astrology is a topic which many take way too seriously—or  people just don't believe in it at all—I  thought how can I sell my advice better?  Make it SEXY, but the bottom line is keeping it simple only offer one or two simple ideas & keep it funny so people keep coming back!  I love helping people build self esteem & trust in themselves all while having a good laugh.  It's a self-help show, with a bent on comedy and art...Astrology is one of those topics, that needs to be televised...

The reason I am interested in keeping my Trade Mark is that in the last year someone else started using the term "Sexy Astrology" with their column. I thought, "oh no... guess I'll apply for a trade mark.”  The United State Patent andTrademark Office approved it as of June 6, 2014.  I am so excited! However I did not expect someone to file a notice of Opposition, and Cease and Desist letter, turning this into a federal case.  With a little more support (6000.00) I can successfully defend my mark, my lawyer is doing an excellent job so far.  I have a strong case and over the years, 400 pages of notes, from my monthly readings and a VERY different product from the person who is trying to take it down.  Intellectual property is important to all of us!  If I am able to secure my trademark I will be able to continue to use the name Sexy Astrology for my show, with out worrying if someone else will be capitalizing on my hard work.  And who knows? Possibly obtain a slot on CNN, for a season or two, Ok Cable Access, maybe the History Channel? O?  Bio?  As well I will be coming out with the Sexy Astrology T shirt and if all goes well there will be the coffee cup and tote!

story:
We are creating an original graphic novel on Robert Nesta Marley’s life, in english. We put inside, the light on all the aspects of THE most important Third World Star than ever as singer, musician, militant, philosopher, and humanist.From 1945 to 1981, we went through all the 20th century important moments that influenced his art and the world. We put in pictures, the essence itself of the origins of Robert Nesta’s creations and howit has reached the generations.This 48 pages album in color is the beginning of the artistic work to come. What most exciting than recreating the way of a young man from the ghetto of Jamaica rising to the international scenes? Showing how Robert Nesta Marley was an inspiring example for the Jamaican people…We drew these epic stories that you can read and see…There are still many untold stories today that we will tell you... A work in progress.... All pages of this album, designed, by now... Ready for 2015, the 60th anniversary of the Marley's birth ?

We are coming on Indigogo to finance the publishing, the promotion  and the edition of our first graphic novel… Colorisation, rights for the creators, translation in english…  like explain in our little film above. Actually, the pages are finished and we scan the last part of the book. We want to be ready to celebrate the Robert Nesta Marley’s birth anniversary. The major part of the team has worked on his own (last) financial resources. The reason we need 42.360 Us Dollars is to finish it. Today, you can participate at this big adventure. Come on, and join us in this beautful artistic experience.


Our rewards ? Illustrations, pdfs, videos or ex-libris will be offer to our generous donors.

Pledge $10 or more : Original ex-libris on pdf by web

Pledge $15 or more : an ex-libris on paper

Pledge $25 or more : A dedicated ex-libris on paper

Pledge $50 or more : A t-shirt and (limited edition) and an "E-pop-Art" Video

Pledge $100 or more : An album, dedicated

Pledge $500 or more : An album, with a signed and numbered web ex-lbris (limited edition)

Pledge $1,000 or more : An album collector, with a signed and numbered web ex-lbris (limited edition).

The only difficulties who can find on our way, would be if the World Wilde Web bugs...
The challenge ? Find the funds with the bakers of Indiegogo, to create this beautiful graphic novel. and than the anglophone (english word) public discovers our story.

(Please do not contact me regarding third-party promotional services. I am not interested. Any solicitation comments will be immediately deleted.)

Actually, the pages are finished and we scan the last part of the book. We want
to be ready to celebrate the Robert Nesta Marley’s birth anniversary. The major
part of the team has worked on his own (last) financial resources. The reason
we need 42.360 Us Dollars is to finish it. Today, you can participate at this big adventure.
Come on, and join us in this beautful artistic experience.

Our
rewards ? Illustrations, pdfs, videos or ex-libris will be offer to our
generous donors. 
Pledge $10 or more : Original ex-libris on pdf by web
Pledge $15 or more : an ex-libris on paper
Pledge $25 or more : A dedicated ex-libris on paper
Pledge $50 or more : A t-shirt and (limited edition) and an
"E-pop-Art" Video
Pledge $100 or more : An album, dedicated
Pledge $500 or more : An album,
with a signed and numbered web ex-lbris (limited edition)
Pledge $1,000 or more : An album collector, with
a signed and numbered web ex-lbris (limited edition).
The only difficulties who can find on our way, would be if the World Wilde Web bugs... The challenge ? Find the funds with the bakers of Indiegogo, to create this beautiful graphic novel. and than the anglophone (english word) public discovers our story.(Please do not contact me regarding third-party promotional services.
 I am not interested. Any solicitation comments will be immediately 
deleted.)

story:
Hello

I'm Nicole and I'm an actress/ writer with a background in production. I love comedy, and I'm working very hard on "Delicious&Dateless" -creating webisodes and a one woman show, that had a short test run at Edinburgh with Freestival 2014. It was amazing – to have full houses of 40/50 people who enjoyed the show, but sadly no reviewers made it! There were 2189 shows to compete with!  I'm excited to be offered slots at Brighton Fringe for a new shiny re-staged version -where I hope to get reviews, to enable staging it in London and beyond... 

Reaching out for your help with some fun perks towards  costs of: 
Director, Venue costs, Tech, Stagehands, Flyers & Posters, Publicity, PR, Flyerers,

About the show: 

It is a lot of fun. A fusion of physical theatre, character comedy with a hint of stand up. A revelatory reflection on turning 40. I'm happy in my own skin – yet unsure how the hell I've ended up on the shelf after making a commitment to living an adventurous life?! The hilarious re-strategising of my 30s as my BFFs all moved country, or to the country/ kingdom of the holy grail of marriage and children?!  The flattering fun of toy boys and having to explain that it is only normal in porn that a first kiss involves pulling hair!  Is it my avatar that is having all the fun?! How did those sultry moments of making eye contact go out of fashion!? A pity that romantic first boyfriend writing me weekly poetry didn't prepare me for these cyber-centric, tinder-tastic times - where the only reality is virtual, and the only connection is wi-fi!  If I can barely feel my finger ends anymore how does my heart stand a chance?  :0  

Audience comments:
Paul Maguire: "What a great show!  I've been coming to the fringe for the last 20yrs and your show was better than many I've seen, even from some Edinburgh veterans!" 
John Fleming: "Keenly observed, witty  social commentary"
Click here for "The Valentine's Conspiracy" & "It Takes Two to Tango"  https://www.youtube.com/nicoleharveyuk 
Further work: www.nicoleharvey.co.uk
GRATEFUL FOR  ANY SUPPORT 
THANK YOU  :) 
NICOLE

story:
Welcome to the Zombie Cat Apocalypse Indiegogo crowdfunding campaign:

 

Zombie Cat Apocalypse is an incredible story about the Eleventh Plague!

After an American reporter uncovers an Egyptian tomb that sat dormant for over 3000 years, the eleventh and final plague is released on mankind. 

This plague, the "Zombie Cat Apocalypse", spreads throughout the entire world. 

Can mankind defeat one of the plagues with all it’s amazing technological advancements or will this spell the end for everyone??

Find out as WE bring this fascinating story to life!

I originally wrote Zombie Cat Apocalypse as a :30 minute Movie Script but after crunching numbers, decided to turn it into a Graphic Novel / Comic Book first.

CURRENT PHASE:

It took me almost 2 years to complete writing the story.. Now, the novel and script is FINISHED!  It is written and I have contributed and  raised enough to have over 400 original works of art professionally designed that tell the entire story!

Now, we need to raise approximately $4,000 to have these wonderful pictures professionally colored and properly arranged and put together into a graphic novel that will be titled as "Volume 1 / Number 1".. This is the first of soon to be a series of graphic novels and short films.

I have secured an ePublisher who will make this dream a reality and publish the book on iBooks once we have the first book complete.

 

ABOUT ME:

I am a cat lover and a graduate of The University of Southern California, I studied creative writing under the tutelage of great writers such as TC Boyle (Author of Greasy Lake…). I found my passion when I was encouraged to take script writing at the number one film school in the US.

I am a very successful Real Estate Agent (CRS, ABR, GRI) in Las Vegas, where I reside with my beautiful family.. But my passion for writing has never stopped!

I enjoy cats, writing, sports and watching real estate values appreciate among other things :D

Thank you for sharing in my dreams and making Zombie Cat Apocalype the Graphic Novel a reality that will soon be an original film as well...

Phil

story:
Short Summary

My name is Michael de Wal and I'm currently living in Osaka, Japan. I've always been a fan of light novel, manga and anime and dreamed of making my own. I've only recently begun writing my own novel, which is currently at chapter 34. Normally I work a job making websites.

This is a love project in the works for many years, there is about 100 chapters worth of story on top of the 34 that are done to this date.

Currently the manga is already in the process of being made and even without this campaign succeeding the manga will get made. What this campaign helps with, is the quality and amount of pages per chapter. The artist I'm using charges 15 dollar a page and 20 for a colored one.

What We Need & What You Get

What I need is money to get the manga to the best quality and quantity (number of pages) possible. This ensures the best reader experience, you will also be able to experience this for free on my own website ad-free.

Depending on your donation you might be legible to help design some of the things that will end up in the manga itself.

The calculation of the goal is made by the following:

25 pages per chapter
15 dollar per page
12 months
1 chapter per month
25x15x12 = 4500 dollar.

The Impact

Your money will directly go to the manga artist I hired, none of it will enter my own pockets. The more is donated, the better the manga will be in the end.

Risks & Challenges

The current risk is that I need to ensure the manga stays up in quality, this means helping the artist out with my design ideas so he has a much easier time drawing.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you don't want to leave a donation, you can greatly support me by just reading the novel instead and eventually the manga itself.

Links

Main site - chapter list

Concept art

story:
Butch Schultz, a black market salesman comes to St. Paul to visit friends.  When one of them, Nate Boniface, is murdered Butch will look to find out who the culprit is along with Nate's wife Kitty.  They must untangle a web a deceit and corruption to solve it, all while trying to avoid the greatest detectives that are on the case!

 

“Can’t wait! Noir is one my favorite styles!”  KYLE HESTER actor and producer of the films “Zombie With a Shotgun” “The Chair” & “Preacher Six”

“Impressive work, I can see this working well as a cinematic piece or mini-series. I love a good noir.”   RUTH MARAMIS, writer and producer of the film “HEARTS WANT” 

“A dark, gritty, and intriguing story that makes you want to know more.”  ZERO SUPERVISION COMICS podcast. 

“The kind of story that grabs you by the throat and doesn’t let go. Crime Noir done right!” CHRISTIAN AND DAMON’S AMAZING NERD SHOW podcast. 

“Explosive, captivating and alluring crime noir. Nick Palodichuk delivers!”  THE GLEN THINKS STUFF PODCAST 

“Nick is such a talented force, his work is beautiful."  THE BROOK READING PODCAST

story:
Short Summary

 

CBA (formerly known as C’est Bon Anthology) has been around for more than a decade, publishing lots of great comics that move far outside of the commercial mainstream.  Over the years, CBA has featured comics by great artists like Anke Feuchtenberger, Olivier Schrauwen, David Mack, Mari Ahokoivu, Kolbeinn Karlsson and many more.

Since the beginning, the people behind CBA are C'est Bon Kultur (CBK), an association of art comics enthusiasts and creators based in Malmö, Sweden. We strive to publish comics that otherwise would be hard to find. Comics that bring something more than what appeals to the lowest common denominator, that challenge the notion of what comics storytelling can or should be.

Now the anthology has fallen on hard times (long story, you can read it at our website), but that shouldn’t stop us from publishing fantastic art comics, right? That is why we’re asking for your help!

We’re looking for donations to cover the costs of printing and distribution of our upcoming anthology, CBA vol 38|39: Fragments.

 

What's in Fragments?

 

The volume features comics by Marie Jacotey-Voyatzis, Martin López Lam, Stefan Petrini, Rakel Stammer, Diego Shim, Henrik Rogowski, Victor Expolio, Insulina Kid and Gonzalo de las Heras; and texts by Mattias Elftorp and Saskia Gullstrand with Johanna Rojola; in a more-than-a-hundred colorful pages issue. Both the cover and the issue is compiled by Christina Cromnow, one of the main members of the association who's currently working on her debut graphic novel.

Martin López Lam

 

Marie Jacotey-Voyatzis

 

Gonzalo de las Heras

Mattias Elftorp

 

All the comics in the volume are already finished. We only need to put the whole volume together and do some final editing before sending it to print.

 

What We Need & What You Get

 

We need € 2300 to cover the costs of printing and distribution of 500 copies of CBA vol 38|39: Fragments.

If you support the anthology, we have a plethora of goodies for you!

OrnaMental (€ 10)

You get a copy of CBA vol 38|39: Fragments

+ a pin or a patch

 

Official donor (€ 30)

-CBA vol 38|39: Fragments

-pin/patch

+ you get a subscription of CBA for 4 volumes (starting with vol 40) + a surprise treat from our archives

+ your name (or crowdfunder alias) in the next volume being sent to the printer after your donation

 

Archivist (€ 50)

-CBA vol 38|39: Fragments

-pin/patch

-4 volume subscription

-your name in the next volume

+ 5 anthology back issues (choose any 5 that are still in print)

 

Storyteller's delight (€ 80)

-CBA vol 38|39: Fragments

-pin/patch

-4 volume subscription

-your name in the next volume

-5 anthologies of your choice

+ one copy each of When the last story is told + Creation of a god

+ 1 of our "CBK Presents" hardcover graphic novel issues

 

Model (€ 130)

-CBA vol 38|39: Fragments

-pin/patch

-4 volume subscription

-your name in the next volume

-5 anthologies of your choice

-When the last story is told + Creation of a god

+ 2 "CBK Presents" hardcover graphic novel issues

+ a portrait drawn by one of our artists, to be published on the CBK website, that you can also use as profile picture on Facebook etc.

 

Sugar parent (€ 400)

-CBA vol 38|39: Fragments

-pin/patch

-4 volume subscription

-Your name in the next volume

-When the last story is told + Creation of a god

-digital portrait

+ all our available back issues, including "CBK Presents"

 

Sugar parent+ (€ 800)

-CBA vol 38|39: Fragments

-pin/patch

-4 volume subscription

-your name in the next volume

-When the last story is told + Creation of a god

-digital portrait

+ all our available back issues, signed by all current crew members

+ our eternal love (this one is actually more or less included in all levels)

 

Other Ways You Can Help

 

If you can’t contribute you can always help by spreading the word about our campaign!

-Share the link to this Indiegogo campaign. Use the #cbavol38|39 hash tag!

-Follow us on Facebook and Instagram, and check out our website!

-Tell your loved ones about all the great comics in our wonderful web shop!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Home to the all-new Dark Threads Universe, Smart Whimsy is an independent comic publisher committed to bringing our readers only the most compelling stories driven by rich, dynamic characters. The industry is rapidly changing, and as we enter a new era for comic books, we aim to lead the way with a renewed focus on character development and story. This is a chance to build a better comic book industry, and we intend to be part of this exciting adventure.

The Dark Threads Universe will debut with our 90 page graphic novel, Dark Threads: Surfgirl. It will introduce a number of characters and lay the groundwork for the expanded universe.

The year is 43 SE.

The Year is 43 SE It has been 43 years since the event that changed everything. An exotic particle ribbon swept out of deep space, irradiated the planet, and killed millions. A few of the survivors were changed, developing superpowers. They would become known as Suprahumans; a new species.

Humanity is, once again, not alone.

Following the Border Wall Bombings, the country is on edge. When cult hero, and Suprahuman vigilante, Sparrowhawk is arrested by the Suprahuman Tactical Action Command, protest break out in the streets of New Grimm City. Meanwhile, across the country, a crashed spaceship starts a runaway forest fire that threatens to kill thousands. Lanmé Noel is the latest descendent in a line a women granted the power of the loa La Sirene; the Haitian goddess of the sea.

While wearing the veve of La Sirene, Lanmé is able to draw on extra-dimensional energies giving her the power to control water and the weather. With the help of her friends Kenji Normura and Kimberly Walker, she adopted the superhero persona of Surfgirl to fight crime. But, the world was less than welcoming.

Now, with a fire threatening to destroy her home, she must face her destiny.

While wearing the veve of La Sirene, Lanmé is able to draw on extra-dimensional energies giving her the power to control water and the weather. With the help of her friends Kenji Normura and Kimberly Walker, she adopted the superhero persona of Surfgirl to fight crime. But, the world was less than welcoming.

Now, with a fire threatening to destroy her home, she must face her destiny.

Lanmé Noel aka Surfgirl

When Lanmé Noel turned sixteen, she inherited the veve of the loa La Sirene, the goddess of the sea from Haitian folklore. While wearing the veve, she gains the ability to draw on extra-dimensional energies to manipulate the atmosphere and control the weather. With the help of her friends Kenji Normura and Kimberly Walker, she adopts the superhero persona of Surfgirl to fight crime and stop a new breed of criminals with extraordinary abilities and new advanced technologies.​

Mia DeLuna aka Moonblink

Mia DeLuna is a 32-year-old professor of astrophysics at New Grimm University and the Suprahuman vigilante known as Moonblink. She has the ability to shoot exotic particles from her hands that immediately immobilize her targets. A highly trained martial artist, she uses her elite skills and unique abilities to watch over her city.​

Thomas Kelley aka Harvester

Thomas Kelley is a 46-year-old billionaire, a former playboy, and the creator of the Harvester suit. Originally designed for deep space asteroid mining, the suit transforms its wearer into a nearly unstoppable weapon. Driven by rage and the desire for revenge, Thomas steals the suit and uses it to target suprahumans and wreak havoc on his city.​

Colonel Starstrike aka Aaron Green

Aaron Green is a 53-year-old colonel in the United States Air-force and is the first to undergo a series of experimental genetic editing procedures designed to dramatically enhance speed, strength, and agility. Equipped with the latest in advance military technology, he is held up as a symbol of human exceptionalism and is put in charge of E.X.T.R.A., the Extraordinary Threat Response Agency.​

Mary Justice aka Agent Justice

Mary Justice is a 34-year-old agent for the F.B.I. who volunteered for, and underwent, a series of experimental genetic editing procedures designed to dramatically enhance her speed, strength, and agility. She became a symbol for the anti-suprahuman initiative, became known as Agent Justice, and was given command of S.T.A.C., the Suprahuman Tactical Action Command, an elite unit assembled to deal with suprahuman threats.​

Zia Kasparov aka Sparrowhawk

A former special operative in the Russian military, Zia Kasparov is a 27-year-old suprahuman with the ability to manipulate dark energies. Turned out by own her government, and rejected by the other nations of the world, she finds no safe harbor and becomes a stateless wanderer. As Sparrowhawk, she travels the globe fighting to stop injustice wherever she finds it.​

Evens Noel aka Annihilation

Evens Noel is a 57-year-old Haitian immigrant, a surgeon, and the father of Lanmé Noel, aka Surfgirl. While working in a trauma center during a disastrous fire, a cosmic entity of pure energy surges out from a dying patient and binds with him. In this new superform, he has the ability to fly and manipulate nuclear fire, but is no longer the man he once was.​

Ewan

Ewan is a pandoan time traveling bounty hunter from earth’s distance future. His species evolved on earth millions of years in the future, and are descended from Pando, currently the largest living organism, itself over 80,000 years old.​

 

First Edition of the Graphic Novel

Get a printed first edition copy of the all-new 90 page graphic novel, Surfgirl.

Digital Edition of the Graphic Novel

Get a digital (PDF) copy of the all-new graphic novel, Surfgirl.

Surfgirl T-Shirt in Heather Navy

This Surfgirl promotional t-shirt exclusively from Smart Whimsy features a beautiful design by artist Aleksey Rico. With shoulder-to-shoulder taping, this soft, lightweight tee is made from 100% combed and ring-spun cotton and cut to be flattering on both men and women.

Real Heroes Resist T-Shirt

Real Heroes Resist! Get your soft, lightweight tee made with 100% combed and ring-spun cotton with just the right amount of stretch. Side-seamed, and with shoulder-to-shoulder taping, this tee is comfortable and flattering for both men and women.

Suprahuman Resist T-Shirt

Get your very own Suprahuman Resist tee inspired by our upcoming graphic novel, Dark Threads: Surfgirl. This t-shirt is soft, lightweight, and perfect for both men and women. Made from 100% combed and ring-spun cotton, it is side-seamed and features shoulder-to-shoulder taping.

Bella Rachlin Art Prints

Get one of these beautiful full-size museum quality reproduction art prints featuring the artwork of Bella Rachlin.

 

Asche Adair - Author

Writer and founder of Smart Whimsy, Asche Adair as worked to assemble a international team of extraordinarily talent individuals to create the Dark Threads Universe.

Ariel Medel - Pencils

Ariel Medel is a comic book artist and illustrator of The Unbeatables, Agent 47: Birth Of The Hitman, and Xena: Warrior Princess. He has brought his talents to the Dark Threads Universe for the pencils on Dark Threads: Surfgirl.

Jagdish Kumar - Inks

Inker on G.I. Joe and Grimm Fairy Tales, Jagdish Kumar is joining the team to bring his skills to the Dark Threads Universe for the inks on Dark Threads: Surfgirl.

Bryan Valenza - Colors

Colorist behind Witchblade and Red Sonja & Vampirella meet Betty & Veronica, Bryan Valenza has joined the Smart Whimsy team bringing his coloring style to Dark Threads Universe.
story_txt:
Home to the all-new Dark Threads Universe, Smart Whimsy is an independent comic publisher committed to bringing our readers only the most compelling stories driven by rich, dynamic characters. The industry is rapidly changing, and as we enter a new era for comic books, we aim to lead the way with a renewed focus on character development and story. This is a chance to build a better comic book industry, and we intend to be part of this exciting adventure.
The Dark Threads Universe will debut with our 90 page graphic novel, Dark Threads: Surfgirl. It will introduce a number of characters and lay the groundwork for the expanded universe.

The year is 43 SE.
The Year is 43 SE It has been 43 years since the event that changed everything. An exotic particle ribbon swept out of deep space, irradiated the planet, and killed millions. A few of the survivors were changed, developing superpowers. They would become known as Suprahumans; a new species.
Humanity is, once again, not alone.
Following the Border Wall Bombings, the country is on edge. When cult hero, and Suprahuman vigilante, Sparrowhawk is arrested by the Suprahuman Tactical Action Command, protest break out in the streets of New Grimm City. Meanwhile, across the country, a crashed spaceship starts a runaway forest fire that threatens to kill thousands. Lanmé Noel is the latest descendent in a line a women granted the power of the loa La Sirene; the Haitian goddess of the sea. 
While wearing the veve of La Sirene, Lanmé is able to draw on extra-dimensional energies giving her the power to control water and the weather. With the help of her friends Kenji Normura and Kimberly Walker, she adopted the superhero persona of Surfgirl to fight crime. But, the world was less than welcoming.
Now, with a fire threatening to destroy her home, she must face her destiny.

While wearing the veve of La Sirene, Lanmé is able to draw on extra-dimensional energies giving her the power to control water and the weather. With the help of her friends Kenji Normura and Kimberly Walker, she adopted the superhero persona of Surfgirl to fight crime. But, the world was less than welcoming.

Now, with a fire threatening to destroy her home, she must face her destiny.


Lanmé Noel aka Surfgirl
When Lanmé Noel turned sixteen, she inherited the veve of the loa La Sirene, the goddess of the sea from Haitian folklore. While wearing the veve, she gains the ability to draw on extra-dimensional energies to manipulate the atmosphere and control the weather. With the help of her friends Kenji Normura and Kimberly Walker, she adopts the superhero persona of Surfgirl to fight crime and stop a new breed of criminals with extraordinary abilities and new advanced technologies.​

Mia DeLuna aka Moonblink
Mia DeLuna is a 32-year-old professor of astrophysics at New Grimm University and the Suprahuman vigilante known as Moonblink. She has the ability to shoot exotic particles from her hands that immediately immobilize her targets. A highly trained martial artist, she uses her elite skills and unique abilities to watch over her city.​

Thomas Kelley aka Harvester
Thomas Kelley is a 46-year-old billionaire, a former playboy, and the creator of the Harvester suit. Originally designed for deep space asteroid mining, the suit transforms its wearer into a nearly unstoppable weapon. Driven by rage and the desire for revenge, Thomas steals the suit and uses it to target suprahumans and wreak havoc on his city.​

Colonel Starstrike aka Aaron Green
Aaron Green is a 53-year-old colonel in the United States Air-force and is the first to undergo a series of experimental genetic editing procedures designed to dramatically enhance speed, strength, and agility. Equipped with the latest in advance military technology, he is held up as a symbol of human exceptionalism and is put in charge of E.X.T.R.A., the Extraordinary Threat Response Agency.​

Mary Justice aka Agent Justice
Mary Justice is a 34-year-old agent for the F.B.I. who volunteered for, and underwent, a series of experimental genetic editing procedures designed to dramatically enhance her speed, strength, and agility. She became a symbol for the anti-suprahuman initiative, became known as Agent Justice, and was given command of S.T.A.C., the Suprahuman Tactical Action Command, an elite unit assembled to deal with suprahuman threats.​

Zia Kasparov aka Sparrowhawk
A former special operative in the Russian military, Zia Kasparov is a 27-year-old suprahuman with the ability to manipulate dark energies. Turned out by own her government, and rejected by the other nations of the world, she finds no safe harbor and becomes a stateless wanderer. As Sparrowhawk, she travels the globe fighting to stop injustice wherever she finds it.​

Evens Noel aka Annihilation
Evens Noel is a 57-year-old Haitian immigrant, a surgeon, and the father of Lanmé Noel, aka Surfgirl. While working in a trauma center during a disastrous fire, a cosmic entity of pure energy surges out from a dying patient and binds with him. In this new superform, he has the ability to fly and manipulate nuclear fire, but is no longer the man he once was.​

Ewan
Ewan is a pandoan time traveling bounty hunter from earth’s distance future. His species evolved on earth millions of years in the future, and are descended from Pando, currently the largest living organism, itself over 80,000 years old.​

 


First Edition of the Graphic Novel
Get a printed first edition copy of the all-new 90 page graphic novel, Surfgirl.
Digital Edition of the Graphic Novel
Get a digital (PDF) copy of the all-new graphic novel, Surfgirl.
Surfgirl T-Shirt in Heather Navy
This Surfgirl promotional t-shirt exclusively from Smart Whimsy features a beautiful design by artist Aleksey Rico. With shoulder-to-shoulder taping, this soft, lightweight tee is made from 100% combed and ring-spun cotton and cut to be flattering on both men and women.

Real Heroes Resist T-Shirt
Real Heroes Resist! Get your soft, lightweight tee made with 100% combed and ring-spun cotton with just the right amount of stretch. Side-seamed, and with shoulder-to-shoulder taping, this tee is comfortable and flattering for both men and women.

Suprahuman Resist T-Shirt
Get your very own Suprahuman Resist tee inspired by our upcoming graphic novel, Dark Threads: Surfgirl. This t-shirt is soft, lightweight, and perfect for both men and women. Made from 100% combed and ring-spun cotton, it is side-seamed and features shoulder-to-shoulder taping.

Bella Rachlin Art Prints
Get one of these beautiful full-size museum quality reproduction art prints featuring the artwork of Bella Rachlin.


 

Asche Adair - Author
Writer and founder of Smart Whimsy, Asche Adair as worked to assemble a international team of extraordinarily talent individuals to create the Dark Threads Universe.

Colorist behind Witchblade and Red Sonja & Vampirella meet Betty & Veronica, Bryan Valenza has joined the Smart Whimsy team bringing his coloring style to Dark Threads Universe.

story:
Summary

Esmond, a volunteer soldier for his industrial kingdom, comes across a discovery in his research. He takes it as a chance to investigate, ignoring his friends Alex and Gizmo. In the process  accidentally giving himself the powers of the Champion, an ancient god-like being that protected the land a millennium ago. With this new responsibility, he takes on a secret persona. Due to his broken friendships, he runs into trouble with a fight at a bank, meeting the vigilante Xerk, and a new scary threat.

Website:

https://sebanimates.com/

Interiors

Myself

 Hello, my name is Sebastian, but I also go by Seb Animates online. I want to become a comic writer and artist starting with this, my passion project.

Goals

 My goal for this book is 5,000 dollars. The money will be split into three categories. A third would go to paying my friends who have helped me create this book. Another third will go into the production of this book, such as websites and upgrading materials. The last third would go directly into advertisements across the internet (This part is more flexible just in case I don’t hit the goal). Funding will allow for free apparel and even sneak peeks.

Dreams

This project would be the start of a series of books, allowing me to tell a great story that I’ve been wanting to for years now. Any amount of help means a lot to the project as it could mean one more person being reached out to. My social media showcases my artistic abilities and my distinct style. They are a great place to get an idea of the book and who I am as a person. 

Obstacles 

This book has taken a lot of time. Including the script and drawing the pages this has been in production, since November 29th of 2019. The book has gone through several drafts, still being updated to this day. Even necessitating a reset of the book due to production errors allowing me, now with foresight, to redraw the book to be better thanever.

Other Pages

story:
Ruthless #1 is the first of a six-issue series by Velleity Studios. Written by Chris Hoffman (Salt City Strangers) and Andrew Malin (The Mighty Trümph), drawn by the incomparable Alexandre Nascimento (Salt City Strangers, Rage), and inked by Tyler Davis (The Mighty Trümph), with cover colors by Dijjo Lima (Titan Comics). The art is done! The writing is done! Back with confidence. Chris and Andrew have successfully crowdfunded 10 projects.

Read the first six pages by clicking on the image below:

About the book: 25 pages of story, B&W interiors.

 

You can also help the campaign by sharing the url:  https://igg.me/at/ruthless

Thanks for your help!

story:
Like most rational sentient beings (such as yourself), I love classic Golden Age Hollywood comedy teams.  And when I was able to work with Biffle & Shooster a few years ago, I thought that they’d be just as funny in comic books as they are on the Silver Screen – just like the 3 Stooges, Dean Martin & Jerry Lewis, and Abbott & Costello (not to mention those great film/comic book stars Bob Hope and Phil Silvers)!  

 

Luckily, Benny Biffle and Sammy Shooster agreed.  So I became their editor and a deal was struck with the great Mike Kazaleh to be their comic book artist and writer.  You know Mike from all those Simpsons, Ren & Stimpy, Captain Jack, Mighty Mouse, and Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtle comic books!  

 

Mike was actually on the set in Hollywood while the boys were filming one of their classics, “The Bride of Finklestein”, so he had a head start:  He already knew which guy was Biffle (“the funny one”, who a lotta people say looks like the Broadway star Nick Santa Maria) and which guy was Shooster (“the other one”, who a lotta people say looks like me, the cartoon and radio voice guy).

 

And now, after years in the making, the FIRST BIG ISSUE is finally ready to ship - and it coincides with the Kino-Lorber Films DVD release of Biffle & Shooster classics and rarities!  The first issue of “The Adventures of Biffle & Shooster” is 28 big pages of cool art (featuring the epic saga of Biffle & Shooster entering the sub-atomic particles of an onion bagel), with a smattering of text and photos, a personal message from Benny and Sammy to You the Reader, and more.  And the interior pages are all in genuine black and white, just like most of Biffle & Shooster’s movies! 

 

Mike Kazaleh and I have already started working on the second issue – with some major surprise guest artists!  But we won’t publish the second Biffle & Shooster comic until we’re sure the first issue is a hit with the fans - of comic books, of classic comedy teams, of swell comic art and writing, or of just plain wacky ideas.  The proceeds from sales of the first issue will go towards the next issue – and, if all goes very well, towards the issue after that!

 

If all this sounds like your cup of ambrosia, please join our campaign and help keep the presses rolling!  Let’s keep seein’ Biffle & Shooster in the Funny Pages, as well as on the Silver Screen!  And “Thank You in Advance” for your kind participation in this delirious enterprise!

- Will Ryan, Editor in Chief

story:
HELP LAUNCH EXCITING NEW COMIC BOOK SERIES - DRACULANGELA!

When her parents mysteriously disappeared, Angela Von Witt was left with a modest fortune consisting of money, ancient literature, and artifacts.  A technological abomination known as RTEMYS comes looking for one of those artifacts, and Angela finds herself fighting for her life. While battling this monster, Angela ultimately unleashes the mystical powers that draw from the dimensions of light and darkness. Now, she must harness the heavenly power to defeat her enemy before the darkness consumes her soul.

Draculangela is an ongoing comic series that will evolve out of an initial story line spanning five issues, explaining this young woman's transition to the entity she is only now discovering within. The premier issue (24 pages of story, plus bonus artwork) is already completed, spanning an intriguing and action packed storyline, incredible inked and colored art, as well as outstanding lettering and richly formatted pages. It is a story decades in the making, and has evolved through a collaboration of dedicated effort, passion for the comic book format, a touch of fortune (to compile such a truly international gathering of talented writers and artists) and steady, but relentless vision to get to this point in Draculangela's unveiling.  We now hope that what you see from the campaign will entice and entertain you, and we ask for YOUR assistance to raise the funds to satisfy the printing costs involved.

THE SYNOPSIS

Illustration by the fantastic Ivan D. Saboya - Colors by the wonderful Ivanna Matilla

Daughter (Angela Von-Witt) of a turned (bitten by a direct descendant of Dracula) count (father – Victor Von-Witt) and an earthbound/disgraced angel (mother– Sonia Von-Witt). 

Age - Entering her twenties.

Her parents (presumed to be deceased) had hoped she would enjoy a normal life, hiding their own mysterious pasts and powers, however her hidden ‘abilities’ have come to the surface as she matures.

Current powers she gains an awareness of…
Morphing ability to change out of human form and into the hybrid half vamp/half angel persona. When morphed, she has an ‘icy’ blue glow to her. Morph takes place when she takes hold of scepter (described below).

Retracting fangs not for blood, but for soul possession/impression on weak minded souls/redemption of dire/lost souls.

Impervious to vampire weaknesses (sunlight/stakes, etc..) due to DNA from her mother. Equally unimpressionable to heavenly creatures who might attempt any influence on her.

Mesmerizing stare – icy blue eyes that turn glowing rose red when initiating hypnotic state on susceptible victims. (mostly male humanoids or inferior demons).

Schizophrenic tendencies due to her lineage. Always fighting good v.s. evil within herself.

Athletic, martial arts-trained, with great stamina, reflexes and agility beyond that of humans. Resilient to injury or toxins, with quick healing ability.

She wields the "Scepter of Souls". The golden scepter is a catalyst for Angela's abilities, but comes with some surprises for her as she learns more about this powerful weapon.


Concept Sketches for Draculangela - Chris Williams (Cdubbart)

​Setting is Twenty-Second century Earth (2170). Humans have been forced to adapt to harsher conditions after violent clashes with mechanoid beings from another galaxy. Many of the major cities are in a rebuilding phase. The weapons from the spaceships used by the "Bio-Mechs" have affected the atmosphere of the planet making temperatures more extreme in both directions depending on the season. Grounded factions of the mechanoid army still reside on earth, searching for ways to contact their kind. They have taken a human female robotics scientist, and assimilated her into a half breed version of themselves. 


Illustration by the fantastic Ivan D. Saboya - Colors by Mark Compton

This woman (RTEMYS – formerly Melyssa Sands) hated Angelina’s father (reason to be revealed). She is accumulating segments of knowledge of Draculangela’s family history. She aims at obtaining Angela’s scepter and incorporate the force within for her own purposes.  

RTEMYS Concept Sketches - Chris Williams (Cdubbart)

 The Bio-Mechs were an alien force that invaded the Earth in order to harvest a resource their race needs to thrive in the galaxy. Abducting humans and transforming them into slaves, Mechs range from drones, to warriors, to leaders like RTEMYS. The human race managed to drive this evil alien race away, but the impact of the invasion reverberates throughout the Earth years later. 

Standard Cover - Chris (cdubbart) Williams

Vinz El Tab Variant Cover:

Tiago Da Silva Variant Cover:

Indiegogo Exclusive Variant Cover: Saboya/Matilla

Vince Rodriguez Variant Cover:

Cottony Variant Cover:

INTERIOR PAGE EXAMPLES:



 

Stretch Goals:


The Team:

RISKS AND CHALLENGES:
Thank you again for having a look at Draculangela! The comic is completely finished in digital format. Once the campaign ends we will work with our print-house (an established organization known for producing excellent quality COMIC BOOKS), and put the packing/shipping wheels in motion. This is our first production run, so we may have one or two hiccups, but we do have a former print production supervisor on board to move things along smoothly.
YOUR SATISFACTION is our first goal. YOU are helping to bring Draculangela to life, so we are going to make every possible effort to provide you with a quality product in a timely manner. As long as that Corona thing doesn't make any appearances here, or RTEMYS doesn't make any more trouble (for a while anyway), we'll move things forward in a timely manner.

International Shipments: Please make sure you are aware of your VAT tax, tariffs, and customs for your country! Each country is different so we can’t estimate how much these extra fees will cost. We also declare the full value of your shipment on the Customs forms. We will be shipping with USPS to cut down on handling fees from Fedex and UPS. 

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP:
We understand that some of you are not able to support DRACULANGELA with a financial pledge. No worries....We would greatly appreciate any shares of our campaign link through your social media pages and word of mouth. We thank you for any kind of support of our premier issue and appreciate your effort for taking the time to do so!! 

Excelsior!
Mark C.
https://www.instagram.com/markuspublishing/


https://www.facebook.com/markuspublishing

story:
SUCKER is a grindhouse horror graphic novel series for Mature Readers! We recently crowdfunded the second 64-page volume and would like to open both volumes up for pre-orders. Funds collected will go toward producing the third and final book in the SUCKER Saga. 

"The best thing about the horror and gore (and boy howdy, there’s a bunch of gore in this book, and plenty of nudity as well) is that it’s not just exclusive to the vampires – Talbert does a good job showing what McNamara is hinting at, that humans can be just as nasty as vampires when it comes to inflicting pain."

-Greg Burgas from his review at Atomic Junkshop 

In the 1980s, Bruce Jacobs was a successful night trader of stocks and one of the thousands of vampires who secretly lived among us. But a personal tragedy sent him into a 30-year exile. When he emerges in the present day he is shocked to discover that he is the last vampire.

Clyde Benton was the greatest vampire hunter of the '90s. The problem was, he was too good. He and his team wiped out all the vampires before the pharmaceutical companies could decode their immortal properties.

Now, Clyde and his team are reactivated with a single objective: capture the last vampire. If they succeed, all of America will be addicted to immortality. 

Tony Talbert (Co-Plotter and Penciller) is a comic book artist and muralist based out of Philadelphia, Pennsylvania. He has produced a dozen subversive and abrasive graphic novels for many otherwise well-meaning and unsuspecting comic companies. He previously collaborated with Jason on Continuity, First Moon and Less Than Hero. 

Jason McNamara (Co-plotter and Script ) is the graphic novel author of The Cicada, SUCKER, The Rattler, The Crossing, Abandon, From Mars with Love, The Martian Confederacy, Short Hand, Continuity, First Moon and Less Than Hero. He teaches comic book scriptwriting at Pacific Northwest College of Art.  

John Heebink (Editor and Inker) has worked in comics since 1990, mainly as a penciler or inker. Credits include Nick Fury, Quasar, Rick Remender’s Doll and Creature, Peter David’s Soulsearchers & Co., Vampirella, Link Yaco’s Space Chicks and Businessmen and a long run on Elvira. His willingness to draw almost anything has led some—meaning Jason—to label him the Ron Jeremy of Comics.

Paul Little (Color Artist) is a colorist whose work has appeared in comics from Dark Horse, Image, IDW, Joe Books, and more. He colored the back half of the Eisner Award-nominated Morning Glories from Image Comics, and he has contributed colors to a whole whack of anthologies over the years.

Peter Secosh (background inks) is a San Francisco based artist with a background in poster art, board games, logos, storyboards, and tattoo design. He previously inked the Stela series Out with a Bang as well as providing background inks for Vampirella, The Nocturnals: Troll Bridge, Elvira, and Soulsearchers & Co.  

The SUCKER graphic novels are 64-page full-throttle grindhouse vampire romps with nudity, dark sensibilities and hideous language topped with a light dusting of social commentary. In terms of tone and content, I like to describe it as The Wolf of Wall Street meets The Tomb of Dracula. 

The SUCKER volumes are not your typical comic books: these are square-bound books that take a lot of time and passion to produce. We believe in creating high-quality content that is priced comparatively to mainstream releases with a similar page count.
story_txt: SUCKER is a grindhouse horror graphic novel series for Mature Readers! We recently crowdfunded the second 64-page volume and would like to open both volumes up for pre-orders. Funds collected will go toward producing the third and final book in the SUCKER Saga. "The best thing about the horror and gore (and boy howdy, there’s a bunch of gore in this book, and plenty of nudity as well) is that it’s not just exclusive to the vampires – Talbert does a good job showing what McNamara is hinting at, that humans can be just as nasty as vampires when it comes to inflicting pain."-Greg Burgas from his review at Atomic Junkshop In the 1980s, Bruce Jacobs was a successful night trader of stocks and one of the thousands of vampires who secretly lived among us.
